title: failed to emit precompiled header '/Users/flutter-dev/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Runner-dghhhijkztquumaijdrrzdcoklxr/Build/Intermediates.noindex/PrecompiledHeaders/Runner-Bridging-Header-swift_3M45BMBR9VCN7-clang_3TF9NZCX310S2.pch' for bridging header '/Users/flutter-dev/AndroidStudioProjects/flutter_lt_3.0/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h'
body:
Hi, not able to build iOS app due to this build issue:
failed to emit precompiled header '/Users/flutter-dev/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Runner-dghhhijkztquumaijdrrzdcoklxr/Build/Intermediates.noindex/PrecompiledHeaders/Runner-Bridging-Header-swift_3M45BMBR9VCN7-clang_3TF9NZCX310S2.pch' for bridging header '/Users/flutter-dev/AndroidStudioProjects/flutter_lt_3.0/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h'

Earlier it was working properly.

podfile:
# Uncomment this line to define a global platform for your project
platform :ios, '12.0'

# CocoaPods analytics sends network stats synchronously affecting flutter build latency.
ENV['COCOAPODS_DISABLE_STATS'] = 'true'

project 'Runner', {
  'Debug' => :debug,
  'Profile' => :release,
  'Release' => :release,
}

def flutter_root
  generated_xcode_build_settings_path = File.expand_path(File.join('..', 'Flutter', 'Generated.xcconfig'), __FILE__)
  unless File.exist?(generated_xcode_build_settings_path)
    raise "#{generated_xcode_build_settings_path} must exist. If you're running pod install manually, make sure flutter pub get is executed first"
  end

  File.foreach(generated_xcode_build_settings_path) do |line|
    matches = line.match(/FLUTTER_ROOT\=(.*)/)
    return matches[1].strip if matches
  end
  raise "FLUTTER_ROOT not found in #{generated_xcode_build_settings_path}. Try deleting Generated.xcconfig, then run flutter pub get"
end

require File.expand_path(File.join('packages', 'flutter_tools', 'bin', 'podhelper'), flutter_root)

flutter_ios_podfile_setup

target 'Runner' do
  use_frameworks!
  use_modular_headers!

  flutter_install_all_ios_pods File.dirname(File.realpath(__FILE__))
end

post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    flutter_additional_ios_build_settings(target)
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
          config.build_settings['ENABLE_BITCODE'] = 'NO'
          config.build_settings['SWIFT_VERSION'] = '5.0'
        end
  end
end
comments:
Hi @ArpanaSwarnkar, Thanks for filing the issue.

There is a similar issue describing this case https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/99387, Please check [this comment on the issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/99387#issuecomment-1081238267) for the cause of the solution 
Please follow up there for further updates, Closing this issue as a duplicate. If you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

comments: Duplicate of #56811

title: Soft keyboard pops up at any external hardware keyboard key press
body:
1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample see "Code sample" section below)
2. Connect an external hardware keyboard
3. Type something on the keyboard

**Expected results:** No flashing soft keyboard

**Actual results:** Flashing soft keyboard that triggers MediaQuery at every key press since the soft keyboard changes the screen size

Here's a video that shows the problem:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6929765/161416206-79e1a7da-26a9-4a7a-9063-ac5208b98248.mp4

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter TextField issue',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyScreen(title: 'Flutter TextField issue'),
    );
  }
}

class MyScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyScreen({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyScreen> createState() => _MyScreenState();
}

class _MyScreenState extends State<MyScreen> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: const TextField(),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

comments: Closing this as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/70546

I'm not sure it is the same issue... in that one @TahaTesser says that this behavior can be turned off with the switch "Show virtual keyboard" in the device settings. But that settings is already turned off in my device, yet the behavior is the wrong one you can see in the video.

@aleripe 
Check also this similar issue https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/51478

@darshankawar 
There is no solution on that issue and seems quite different from mine. I don't use any `RawKeyboardListener`, I just write on a TextField using an external keyboard.

title: horizontal white line in the bottom of my custom app bar on Android
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

So I am trying to make a custom reusable appbar widget like this

```
class MyCustomAppBar extends StatelessWidget implements PreferredSizeWidget {
  const MyCustomAppBar({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return AppBar(
      backgroundColor: primaryColor,
      elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
      titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
      title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
    );
  }

  @override
  Size get preferredSize => const Size.fromHeight(50.0);
}
```

and then I use it on my scaffold like this

```
class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: MyCustomAppBar(),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Container(
            width: double.infinity,
            height: 100,
            color: Theme.of(context).primaryColor,
            child: Center(
              child: Text(
                "this is container that has the same color with appbar",
                style: TextStyle(
                  fontSize: 10,
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

and here is the result: https://i.stack.imgur.com/ZvTZ0.png

as you can see, there is a white horizontal line between the appbar and the container inside the column. and it will only apppear on Android, in iOS everything is ok as I expect.

If I change the Scaffold background color to be red, then that horizontal line will turn to be red as well.

I need to make a custom reusable widget. If I implement directly (without widget separation) like the code below, that horizontal line will not appear
```

class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar( // I don't want to implement it directly like this. I want separate Appbar widget
        backgroundColor: primaryColor,
        elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
        titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
        title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
      ),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Container(
            width: double.infinity,
            height: 100,
            color: Theme.of(context).primaryColor,
            child: Center(
              child: Text(
                "this is container that has the same color with appbar",
                style: TextStyle(
                  fontSize: 10,
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

**Expected results:** 

I expect there is no horizontal below my app bar if make a custom app bar widget. I expect I don't need to change the scaffold background color to remove that horizontal line

**Actual results:** 
I see horizontal line below my custom app bar

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>


```
class MyCustomAppBar extends StatelessWidget implements PreferredSizeWidget {
  const MyCustomAppBar({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return AppBar(
      backgroundColor: primaryColor,
      elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
      titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
      title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
    );
  }

  @override
  Size get preferredSize => const Size.fromHeight(50.0);
}

class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    return Scaffold(

title: `prefer_final_parameters` lint error in `generated_plugin_registrant.dart`
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

1. enable `prefer_final_parameters` in `analysis_options.yaml`:
    ```yaml
    linter:
        rules:
            prefer_final_parameters: true
    ```
2. run `dart analyze`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
no error, as it's a generated file that should never trigger any lint errors

either `final` should be added to the `registrar` parameter, or the rule should be ignored like the others

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
```
   info - Prefer final for parameter declarations if they are not reassigned -
          lib\generated_plugin_registrant.dart:13:22 - prefer_final_parameters
```

Thank you.

title: using FocusNode.requestFocus() on a TextField does not prevent the keyboard from disappearing unless a delay is used
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Tap on the TextField
3. Tap on "done" on your keyboard (or its equivalent)
4. The keyboard disappears, but the blue line below the TextField remains.
5. Now uncomment the line `await Future.delayed(const Duration(milliseconds: 1));` between `myFocusNode.unfocus();` and `requestFocus();`
6. Tap on the TextField
7. Tap on 'done' again

This issue is also referenced at #33305 but the issue has been closed with no apparent resolution.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I expected the keyboard to just remain in place, without moving, and without having to use a `await Future.delayed()`

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Using the `await Future.delayed()`, the keyboard remains, but there is some glitchy visual animations of the keyboard disappearing for a moment and the textfield moving up and down.

**Edit:**
I've noted that the amount of time used for the delay seems to vary as I develop my app, and so far I've seen cases where 10 milliseconds is insufficient and the keyboard still disappears, but it's "fixed" by increasing the duration of the delay. Maybe the `FocusNode.unfocus()` function should be asynchronous so we can `await` for it or something?

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main(List<String> args) {
  runApp(const MaterialApp(
    home: MyApp(),
  ));
}

class MyApp extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<MyApp> createState() => _MyAppState();
}

class _MyAppState extends State<MyApp> {
  late FocusNode myFocusNode;

  @override
  void initState() {
    myFocusNode = FocusNode();
    super.initState();
  }

  @override
  void dispose() {
    myFocusNode.dispose();
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: Padding(
        padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
        child: Center(
          child: TextField(
            focusNode: myFocusNode,
            onSubmitted: (string) async {
              myFocusNode.unfocus();
              await Future.delayed(const Duration(milliseconds: 1));
              myFocusNode.requestFocus();
            },
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

title: FR: Column & Row widget: add `spacing` (similar to Wrap one)
body:
## Use case

I would like the `Column` and `Row` widgets to have a `spacing` parameter that would work exactly the same as in `Wrap`, so that information could be easily displayed by adding a certain space between each child node of the widget.

## Proposal

Simply add a new attribute `spacing` to `Column` and `Row` that defaults to `0` to preserve current default behaviour.
comments: Duplicate of #55378

title: [Web][integration_test][Edge] - Unable to start Edge WebDriver Session for Flutter for Web testing
body: Steps to Reproduce: With example in https://docs.flutter.dev/cookbook/testing/integration/introduction. 1. starting edge driver: `./msedgedriver --port=4444` 2. executing the command: `flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ --browser-name edge --no-headless` And then, one Chrome is opened. But it does not open an edge window to execute the test. Error message:
comments: Closing this as duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/76213

@darshankawar I reviewed all comments in [https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/76213](url) And I found a possible problem with the command to execute the test in your discussion. The key command for run integration test for Edge is **NOT** '-d edge': `flutter drive --driver=test_driver\integration_test.dart --target=integration_test\example_test.dart -d edge -v ` but rather '--browser-name edge': `flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ --browser-name edge --no-headless` And I tried to fix this problem, just modify the file in flutter SDK: Since we have modified the flutter sdk, we use the dart method to execute the test: `dart --disable-dart-dev --packages=/xxxxx/tools/flutter/packages/flutter_tools/.packages /xxxxx/tools/flutter/packages/flutter_tools/bin/flutter_tools.dart drive --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart --target=integration_test/app_test.dart --web-renderer canvaskit --release --browser-name edge --web-run-headless` Then I can execute the test normally on edge:

@ZhengYingDS 
Please share your findings in original issue.

Okay, I'm updating here because the comments section here is cleaner without too much information, but I'll still sync my findings in the original issue.

> @ZhengYingDS Please share your findings in original issue.

title: Letter spacing isn't working in Arabic language
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Run the code sample in dart pad.

**Expected results:** Arabic characters to appear separated for example: ا ل ا س م ا ل ا و ل

**Actual results:** Arabic characters appears joined and letter spacing is ignored for example: الاسم الأول

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

const Color darkBlue = Color.fromARGB(255, 18, 32, 47);

void main() {
  runApp(MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      theme: ThemeData.dark().copyWith(
        scaffoldBackgroundColor: darkBlue,
      ),
      debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false,
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Center(
          child: MyWidget(),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const Text(
      'الاسم الأول',
      style: TextStyle(letterSpacing: 4),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

```
```

<!--
     Run `flutter analyze` and attach any output of that command below.
     If there are any analysis errors, try resolving them before filing this issue.
-->

```
```

<!-- Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here. -->

```
```

</details>


<!--
      Consider also attaching screenshots and/or videos to better
      illustrate the issue.

      You can upload them directly on GitHub.
      Beware that video file size is limited to 10MB.
-->
comments:
Hi @M144-Coder, Thanks for filing the issue. Dartpad isn't the appropriate tool to understand the actual representation of how flutter works on the web. Running the same code sample locally on the web, I see the letter spacing. However, if you are still seeing this issue, I would suggest you please follow up on the existing issue https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/71220.

Closing this issue as a duplicate of the above linked issue.

Also, change the spacing to `10`.

You will see:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2410127/160572919-838d1023-1cdd-4925-ba8a-10f169205d54.png)


Once can argue, that "lam" and "alef" are not really separated, but I wonder if there is a real-life scenario where letter spacing is needed in Arabic.

title: [web] [CanavasKit] Font fallback in CanavasKit does not support Unicode characters outside the BMP (Basic Multilingual Plane)
body:
Fallback font for characters outside the BMP like "𥻨" (U+25EE8) can not be found, and this log is printed.

```
Could not find a set of Noto fonts to display all missing characters. Please add a font asset for the missing characters. See: https://flutter.dev/docs/cookbook/design/fonts
```

I can see that every font‘s supported CodeunitRange are listed here.
https://github.com/flutter/engine/blob/main/lib/web_ui/lib/src/engine/canvaskit/font_fallbacks.dart#L630
And almost none of them contains characters outside the BMP.

But actually NotoSansJP supports the character above (maybe some other fonts support it too), and it shows properly if I bundle the font file of NotoSansJP in my app.

title: Execution of the command buffer was aborted due to an error during execution. Caused GPU Timeout Error
body:
I would like to re open #97910 as it is still happening despite no UI logic is impacted or reloaded when app state becomes inactive.
 
I only send 6 `http` requests inside this method, and there is no warning in the Flutter documentation or anywhere else that we should not do that.

If we should not, i would like to know what are the limitations please because the buffer of all my iPhone's GPU seems overloaded when the app is swiped up to go to the `App Switcher` on iOS.  
This has for effect to completely freeze the phone's UI which is highly undesirable.

Thanks for your understanding
comments: Closing this and reopening the linked issue.

title: [Proposal]Run Skia operations from Flutter
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation

     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

I have a widget showing an image and some `dart:ui Path`s. The problem is, I need some graphics operations to this combination. For example (as a simplified requirement), I need to subtract the image by the Paths, dilate it (Skia does have a dilate image filter), and combine with the image and Paths, etc.

The problem is, I have not found any way to directly manipulate at the Skia level. I wonder how can I do this? Thanks for any hints!

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. N/A

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
see above

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
see above

<summary>Code sample</summary>

      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
n/a

comments: Hi @fzyzcjy, Thanks for filing the issue. I am not aware of any such way where we could execute skia operations from flutter. However, I believe we could consider exposing those functions to flutter. Labeling this issue for further insights from the team.

Skia is an implementation detail in the Flutter engine and there are no plans to expose the entire API directly. Closing this as won't-fix.

If you want a specific feature, please file a separate proposal specific to that feature.
Oh, I see you filed https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/100830.
Get it. Thanks all the same!

title: [Web] can't make register form where chrome will recognize username(email)
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Clone https://github.com/matanshukry/tmp-ex-login
2. Run the example: `flutter run -d chrome`
3. Click the `Create Account` button (looks like link)
4. Enter random details, e.g. email `matanshukry@gmail.com`, password `Aa123456`
5. Optional: Click the `SIGN UP` button.
6. Click the "key" icon in the url bar on chrome browser. That will allow you to check what chrome currently detects as username/password.
7. You can see the password is correctly filled, but the username is blank.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5613042/160238001-8c5740ce-eed2-4ef5-9cea-cb087301b3c3.png)

Note: step 5 is optional because the validation can be seen both before and after submitting the form.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The username should be filled. That is, the fields should be set in a way that allow chrome to correctly detect and use the username field.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Chrome can't detect the username field. I tried to add `autofillHints`, which successfully added some details to the input, but the result is the same.

@maheshmnj yes and no.
Actually the issue I reported can be solved by using `AutofillGroup` (I wasn't familiar with it).

Now chrome correctly *saves* the data.

But now I'm encountering the 2nd issue that you linked, where chrome doesn't restore it (for both username and password).
Upvoted and will follow that - thanks!

title: [webview_flutter] Expose the allowsLinkPreview property in WKWebView for iOS
body:
## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

I am using the WebView widget in my application and have noticed that users can long-press links to get a preview, aka, peek and pop view (iOS only feature):
![Simulator Screen Recording - iPhone 13 - 2022-03-25 at 17 17 57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877327/160169909-63893694-b4be-42e5-87b2-d63331ae8df5.gif)


I would like to have control over what WebViews have this property enabled on iOS.

This can be set by using the [allowsLinkPreview](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/webkit/wkwebview/1415000-allowslinkpreview) boolean property on WKWebview.

Some other packages do expose this property like [flutter_inappwebview](https://pub.dev/documentation/flutter_inappwebview/latest/flutter_inappwebview/IOSInAppWebViewOptions/allowsLinkPreview.html) - [allowsLinkPreview](https://pub.dev/documentation/flutter_inappwebview/latest/flutter_inappwebview/IOSInAppWebViewOptions/allowsLinkPreview.html)

However, I feel this is a foundational level functionality for webviews on iOS and noticed that flutter_webviews package doesn't expose this property but does expose other iOS only properties like `gestureNavigationEnabled`.

## Proposal

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

In a similar manner to the `gestureNavigationEnabled` property I was going to propose adding `allowsLinkPreview` and passing that through to the native WKWebView set up.
comments:
Hi @b099l3, it looks like there's already an existing issue requesting this feature, see #69748. 

Kindly update your PR to reference that issue instead. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

Hi @danagbemava-nc 
Sorry I had a look but was searching on the "[webview_flutter]" term, not to worry.

Updated my PR

  flutter_linkify: 5.0.2
  dart_code_metrics: 4.12.0
  firebase_crashlytics: 2.5.1
  firebase_crashlytics_platform_interface: 3.1.13

flutter:
  uses-material-design: true
  assets:
<stripped>
  fonts:
  - family: <stripped>
    fonts:
<stripped>
flutter_intl:
  enabled: true
  class_name: <stripped>
  main_locale: pl
```

This is an e-commerce app.

I don't think this issue is different from https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/100777 apart from `Another exception was thrown: Instance of 'DiagnosticsProperty<void>` exception. Would be good to track this in already triaged and linked issue.
Closing this as duplicate. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

Stacktraces differ significantly
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3340954/160421571-afda62f4-0d85-4dbd-8dd2-f0239ac39b2e.png)

However, if you are sure that the cause of the issue is located somewhere in the first 6 common lines then indeed they are duplicates.
IMHO the reason is located exactly in differing parts :) Some check should be located somewhere there, not at common lines which are mostly simple getters.

title: flutter_web_plugins PathUrlStrategy ignores fragments

title: [url_launcher] UniversalLinks not opened from safari on iPhone
comments:
@Tom3652 
I believe you are hitting same case as https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/91660. Please check and confirm.

Hi @darshankawar yes it seems exactly my case, though i have no logs because it's from flutter web that i am using the `launch` method so i don't have the debug mode.  
But this happens when trying to open a deep link from a real iOS device inside a SafariViewController indeed.

But it guess the error and the behavior are the same as the mentioned issue.

Thanks for the update. I suggest you to follow-up in linked issue for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate.

title: [desktop] High memory consumption

title: Image.network still throwing exception with errorBuilder but only with 'https://' in link
body:
## Steps to Reproduce I have a list of links and some may point to a link that doesn't exist anymore. In that case I want my app to display not found icon. Everything works fine with the url empty or with just anything in it except for 'https://'. If the latter occurs my debugger stops because there apparently is an unhandled exception, and then after manually continuing the expected icon is shown. So my only problem is the debugger stopping even though the exception is handled by `onError`. **Expected results:** **Actual results:**
Code sample ``` import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; class Test extends StatelessWidget { const Test({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return Material( child: Image.network( 'https://sldkfjlsdkjf', errorBuilder: (BuildContext context, Object exception, StackTrace? stackTrace) { return const Icon(Icons.not_interested); }, ), ); } } ```

title: Android Autofill not working on latest stable (2.10.3)
body:
Autofill is not working when using 2.10.3 (also didn't work for 2.10.1) especially when I use `AutofillHints.creditCardNumber` `AutofillHints.address` and so on. `AutofillHints.name` works fine. This problem was also reported in another issue, but it's still not solved although the issue was closed and release notes also mentions it as resolved in 2.10.1.
older issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94043 / https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98112
comments: CC @LongCatIsLooong

the old issue was fixed and cherrypicked to 2.10.3. I can confirm "email" works fine on 2.10.3 Was "creditCardNumber" or "address" working at some point? Depending on the autofill service you're using, you may need to set those up in the system "autofill service" settings and provide relevant information to the autofill service for those to work.

Hi @aya2453, Thanks for filing the issue. I can confirm that name, email, Password works on `stable 2.10.3`,
But `postalAddress` (since `AutofillHints.address` does not exist)  and `creditCardNumber` doesn't work (I have saved these details, but the autoFill doesn't show up).

The issue for `creditCardNumber` is being tracked here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98762 please follow up there for further Updates closing this issue as a duplicate. In case you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.



https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/159864161-174200dc-a9b9-4efa-b1e6-b9c55f084e16.mov



<details>
<summary>code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter/services.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Material App',
      theme: ThemeData.dark(),
      home: Home(),
    );
  }
}

class Home extends StatelessWidget {
  List<String> hints = [
    AutofillHints.name,
    AutofillHints.email,
    AutofillHints.password,
    AutofillHints.creditCardNumber,
    AutofillHints.addressCity,
    AutofillHints.addressState,
    AutofillHints.addressCityAndState,
    AutofillHints.postalAddress,
  ];

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: SingleChildScrollView(
        child: AutofillGroup(
          child: Padding(
            padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
            child: Column(
              mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
              children: [
                SizedBox(
                  height: kToolbarHeight,
                ),
                for (int i = 0; i < hints.length; i++)
                  Column(
                    children: [
                      TextField(
                        decoration: InputDecoration(hintText: hints[i]),
                        obscureText: hints[i] == AutofillHints.password,
                        keyboardType: hints[i] == AutofillHints.creditCardNumber
                            ? TextInputType.number
                            : hints[i] == AutofillHints.email
                                ? TextInputType.emailAddress
                                : TextInputType.text,
                        autofillHints: [hints[i]],
                      ),
                      const SizedBox(
                        height: 16,
                      ),
                    ],
                  ),
                ElevatedButton(
                  child: const Text("Save"),
                  onPressed: () {
                    TextInput.finishAutofillContext(shouldSave: true);
                    debugPrint("Saving");
                  },
                ),
              ],
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```
</details>

title: Showmodalbottomsheet has obvious jamming when running for the first time
body:
## Details Showmodalbottomsheet has obvious jamming when the app is installed and run for the first time, reaching 250ms / frame. Normal thereafter **Target Platform:** **Target OS version/browser:** **Devices:** ## Code
code sample ```dart import 'dart:ui'; import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:flutter/rendering.dart'; void main() { runApp(MaterialApp(home: MyPage())); } class MyPage extends StatefulWidget { MyPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override _MyPageState createState() => _MyPageState(); } class _MyPageState extends State { @override void initState() { super.initState(); } _renderDialog() { return Container( alignment: Alignment.center, height: 600, child: Material( color: Colors.transparent, child: Ink( width: 100, height: 50, decoration: const BoxDecoration( gradient: LinearGradient( begin: Alignment.topLeft, end: Alignment.bottomRight, stops: [0.0, 1.0], colors: [Color(0xffccd3d92), Color(0xffce05d4b)], ), ), child: InkWell( onTap: () {}, child: Container( alignment: Alignment.center, child: const Text( 'gradient', style: TextStyle( fontSize: 14, ), ), ), ), ))); } @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( showPerformanceOverlay: true, home: Scaffold( body: Center( child: TextButton( child: Text('show'), onPressed: () { showModalBottomSheet( context: context, isScrollControlled: true, builder: (ctx) { return _renderDialog(); }); }, ), )), ); } } ```

Hi @1663049254, there's a similar issue describing what you're experiencing in #78356. 

Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

title: Document on flutter's wiki the versioning schema for releases
body:
Flutter is working on following the OSSF best practices and some of those best practices are related to documentation of releases. Even though the information exists it is already spread on multiple places and not easy to find by someone new to the flutter community.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54371434/159527683-e4fee4cb-21e3-40b9-9ec8-191de077e915.png)
comments: \cc @Hixie @itsjustkevin do you know if we have our release versioning schema documented somewhere?
@godofredoc there is an [issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96282) open on a proposal to change the versioning schema.
Closing this issue in favor of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96282

@darshankawar  commented in this link https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98523#issuecomment-1041251511

Hi @micrcx, Thanks for filing the issue. This issue is fixed on the master channel and the fix should be available on the stable channel in the upcoming stable release. This was previously filed here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060.

You may get the fix before the release by switching to the latest master channel by running.
```
flutter channel master
flutter upgrade
```
If you still encounter this crash on the latest master channel, do let us know by filing a new issue or leaving a comment below.

Closing as the duplicate of the linked issue above.

Hi @Wian-TMC, Thanks for filing the issue. Is the crash reproducible locally? If so can you please check if this reproduces on the latest stable channel of flutter `stable 2.10.3`?

Looks similar to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98481 and https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95568

Hi @maheshmnj, browsing through #98481, it still seems to occur on `stable 2.10.3`. I am not able to reproduce the crash on an emulator and I have no iOS device myself, but our testers have iOS devices which seem to crash relatively often (once or twice a day).

Thanks for the info @Wian-TMC, I am closing this issue as duplicate of #98481. Please follow up there for further updates. Incase you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

title: [ScrollBehavior] Stretch overscroll indicator behaves weird on Android
body:
Scrollable seems jumping when using `AndroidOverscrollIndicator.stretch` and dragging reversely a couple of times on Android.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15884415/159432034-78858e5d-8fb0-43cb-a493-2c722d56ced3.mp4

## Steps to Reproduce

```dart
MaterialApp(
  scrollBehavior: const MaterialScrollBehavior(
    androidOverscrollIndicator: AndroidOverscrollIndicator.stretch,
  ),
  home: Scaffold(
    body: ListView.builder(
      itemCount: 10,
      itemBuilder: (_, index) => Center(child: Text('$index')),
    ),
  ),
)
```

1. Make a list view.
2. Drag reversely a couple of times.
3. The list starts to jump when the drag direction changes.

**Expected results:** Not jumping.

Hi @pademo57, Thanks for filing the issue. This issue is fixed on the master channel and the fix should be available on the stable channel in the upcoming stable release. This was previously filed here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060.

You may get the fix before the release by switching to the latest master channel by running.
```
flutter channel master
flutter upgrade
```
If you still encounter this crash on the latest master channel, do let us know by filing a new issue or leaving a comment below.

Closing as the duplicate of the linked issue above.

title: [Web][Integration Test] Two Chrome instances launched, and the unnecessary Chrome instance breaks the foundation of the integration test [Edited]
body: With example in https://docs.flutter.dev/cookbook/testing/integration/introduction, after executing the command: ``` flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ -d chrome ``` One Chrome is opened. Be noticed that it is not labelled with 'chrome is controlled by automated test software'. Then try to execute the command plus arg `--no-headless`: ``` flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ -d chrome \ --no-headless ``` Two Chrome instances are launched: - One [backend one] is launched as device [this is NOT intend for test cases execution] - The other [frontend one] is launched via webdriver (chromedriver this case) [this is intend for test cases execution, labelled with 'chrome is controlled by automated test software'] [**Note**: Mostly, the two Chromes are overlaid, please try to drag it away (up or down), then back one would be visible.] Both Chrome instances have test executed. However, the Chrome is launched not via chromedriver has major negative impact to test: - For js, css loading, increase the networking pressure as need to load two copies - For some write, delete scenarios, the test will result in unexpected results (as two Chromes both will try to execute delete action) **That is, the unnecessary Chrome instance breaks the foundation of the integration test (via flutter drive)** ---- Source Code Analysis: Flow the flutter drive flow ---- - (1) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L243-L244 https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L252-L259 https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L274-L275 - (2) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/drive/web_driver_service.dart#L93 - (3) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/isolated/resident_web_runner.dart#L307-L314 - (4) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/web/web_device.dart#L120-L153 Per above code, it shows: - Per (1) the --no-launch-chrome is set to true if web, but per (3)(4) it is not passed to startApp, that is, below expression is always true https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/web/web_device.dart#L143 - However, even the --no-launch-chrome is passed correctly, the code will exit with error, as there exists isAppStarted check https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/drive/web_driver_service.dart#L117-L119

The Dart registration has already worked in the error you listed; it's using the correct method channel.

What you are missing is the registration of the native code for your isolate; Flutter only registers plugins for the main isolate. This has always been true, and is unrelated to Dart registration.

If you want to use plugins on an isolate you need to manually register them with an engine that is running that isolate, or use one of the community plugins that manages that for you, as has always been the case.

> The Dart registration has already worked in the error you listed; it's using the correct method channel.
> 
> What you are missing is the registration of the native code for your isolate; Flutter only registers plugins for the main isolate. This has always been true, and is unrelated to Dart registration.
> 
> If you want to use plugins on an isolate you need to manually register them with an engine that is running that isolate, or use one of the community plugins that manages that for you, as has always been the case.

Solved! Thx!!

title: TextField not getting onSubmitted callback - Flutter Web
body:
TextField not getting submitted on Android Chrome.  Works just fine on Desktop chrome (though no OS keyboard) and Android native.

### Setup
Add a single TextField with an `onSubmit`:

```
 TextField(
              controller: controller,
              autocorrect: false,
              enableSuggestions: false,
              maxLength: 5,
              autofocus: false,
              textInputAction: TextInputAction.search,
              onSubmitted: (String text) {
                setState(() {
  /// do stuff with `text`!
```

### Expected
When hitting "enter" on the keyboard, the keyboard is dismissed and the input fed to `onSubmitted`.

### Actual
* Keyboard remains
* `onSubmitted` never called
* "suggestions" above input flicker

### Horrible work around
Click on the first suggestion; then click enter. This produces the desired outcome.

<details>
<summary>  flutter doctor </summary>

Dockerfile:
```
ARG NGINX_VERSION=1.21.6
FROM bitnami/nginx:$NGINX_VERSION
ADD phone_book/build/web/ /app/
```

Could you please provide some help?
comments:
Hi. 
I've packaged the app in release mode (so that's not minified) and that's the error on the console
```
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
localhost/:1 Error while trying to use the following icon from the Manifest: http://localhost:8080/icons/Icon-192.png (Download error or resource isn't a valid image)
(index):91 Failed to load app from service worker. Falling back to plain <script> tag.
(anonymous) @ (index):91
:8080/assets/FontManifest.json:1          Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
main.dart.js:12407 Uncaught Failed to load asset at "assets/FontManifest.json" (403)
    at Object.wrapException (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:7567:17)
    at http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:42814:27
    at _wrapJsFunctionForAsync_closure.$protected (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:10118:15)
    at _wrapJsFunctionForAsync_closure.call$2 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:65144:12)
    at _awaitOnObject_closure0.call$2 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:65138:25)
    at _RootZone.runBinary$3$3 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:67591:18)
    at _FutureListener.handleError$1 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:65683:21)
    at _Future__propagateToListeners_handleError.call$0 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:66018:49)
    at Object._Future__propagateToListeners (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:10362:77)
    at _Future._completeError$2 (http://localhost:8080/main.dart.js:65848:9)
```
With IE, instead, I get a syntax error (I assume the code is generated for ECMAScript 6 or more, in fact the error is on a lambda function `navigator.serviceWorker.register(serviceWorkerUrl).then((reg) => {...}`)
Finally, I've tried running the app with Chrome without extensions (started with `--disable-extensions`), but the error is the same.

Hi.
I've tried using the Python web server with the following Dockerfile definition:
```
ARG HTTP_PORT=8080
ARG PYTHON_VERSION=3.9.11-alpine3.14
FROM python:$PYTHON_VERSION
WORKDIR /app
ADD phone_book/build/web/ /app/
ENV HTTP_PORT=$HTTP_PORT
EXPOSE $HTTP_PORT
RUN adduser -D app && chown -R app:app /app
USER app
CMD python3 -m http.server -d /app $HTTP_PORT
```
but the situation is even worse since I get just an empty response.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8491864/159171229-a286a205-3656-41d1-8cbc-c055335f7c6d.png)
I managed to fix the issue with the Python HTTP server, but the one with nginx still remains...

Hi @cdprete, Thanks for filing the issue. Please see  https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/90712#issuecomment-931601183 and see if any of those links help deploy in nginx.  However deploying to custom servers is supposed to be documented and the feature request is being tracked https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/89763

Closing this issue as the duplicate of the above linked issue.

Hi @maheshmnj.
I'll give those links a try, but I don't think it's the same issue since in the suggested ticket the error is a 404 and I get a 403 instead.
I've more the impression that Flutter (actually the JS worker) tries to load the resources using absolute paths instead of relatives and probably it doesn't have access to some of the ancestors (since they belongs to root).

Somehow the issue seems to be caused by the `dockerfile-maven-plugin` which I'm using for building the image...
If I manually build it with `docker build -t something .` it works file...

Indeed a bug from the plugin: https://github.com/spotify/dockerfile-maven/issues/312
Doh!
Thanks for the update, The reason I pointed you to that issue was, It tracks the documentation required to configure the flutter web app on different servers.
I configured in the past frontends with nginx, that's why I was (badly) surprised :)
In case you find a fix feel free to add them in the comments, it might help others in the future.

Well, the dockerfile-maven-plugin is not maintained anymore, so there are different alternatives:
- run the Docker commands directly with the exec-maven-plugin
- use another plugin (i.e.: https://www.eclipse.org/jkube/ - PS I don't have any connection with the project)
- build the image manually
- use another HTTP Web Server (i.e. the one from python works fine, although it's not meant for production environments)
- [OVERKILL]: Create a web application (i.e. in Spring Boot) that serves the website as static resources

title: FLUTTER_FRAMEWORK_DIR didn't exist in Generated.xcconfig, which cause ios build failed.
body:

How to fix this problem?

title: flutter how to work on multiple windows on same time
body:
currently when we navigate to new screen we have to pop that screen to come back and work on previous screen.
requirement:-
want to work on multiple screen on same times . which resizeable or selectable . just like dialog screen. butt dialog screen show single one time. i want to open multiple just like windows forms MDI child.

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into. -->

1. Clone git SDK project from Flutter docs (Install Guide)
2. Use VS Code Way 

- create test-drive-project by command line 
- Install plugins Flutter And Dart
- Try run select different folders for test-drive-project.
       - Apply in pop-up window to use Flutter SDK (after). Now is working
- Run by F5
- It's Worked. OK. But refactor functions is missng. Then I went use Intellij.

3. Intellij Way

- Install plugins from Flutter docs (Flutter And Dart)
- Restart IDE
- Create Flutter New project by IDE , but set a dest project folder above the VS Code project. 
- I want Flutter for Windows Desktop (Not for Mobile)
- I use recomend command before creating project, in SDK folder like: `--enable-linux-desktop`, and for macos, and for windows done the same.
- Then create project by press FINISH.
- Select run by windows (green triangles button)
- Not working, error.
- Then I try use command from error link wolloving to docs. It new commands also not working , throw error.
- ANd I run `flutter doctor` in Terminal in Intellij, and see this error.
- The end.

title: [IOS]build fails: `'Flutter/Flutter.h' file not found` error: failed to emit precompiled header
body:
Hi, I seem to be having loads of issues with iOS. My app is in production and live on both the play store & app store however since upgrading to support null saftey I've been unable to get the iOS build working.

### Error logs:

- Output of `flutter build ios --verbose`: [flutter_build_ios.log](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/8264189/flutter_build_ios.log) (2.5Mb)
- Output of xcode trying to run on device: 
[Build Runner_2022-03-16T15-17-53.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/8264442/Build.Runner_2022-03-16T15-17-53.txt) (18.6Mb)


I've tried removing ios/Flutter/Flutter.podspec, I've made sure I'm running the most up to date packages.  I've generally been having a generally bad experience with iOS + flutter for a while, maybe something in my case is wrong and fixable? These are the issues i've been living with:

- Builds take 5-10 minutes which is just a nightmare for fixing issues or diagnosing build problems like this
- I'm unable to run from VSCode - it tells me that i should try running from Xcode instead

Please let me know if you have any advice for sorting out my ios builds, thanks!


<details>
  <summary>Flutter doctor -v</summary>

comments:
Hi @jimmyff, Thanks for filing the issue. Sorry for the delayed response for some reason this issue didn't show up in untriaged issues.  


> /Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h:1:9: note: in file included from /Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h:1:
               #import "GeneratedPluginRegistrant.h"
                       ^
               /Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/GeneratedPluginRegistrant.h:10:9: error: 'Flutter/Flutter.h' file not found
               #import <Flutter/Flutter.h>
                       ^
               1 error generated.
               <unknown>:0: error: failed to emit precompiled header '/Users/jimmyff/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Runner-gvjwzkyvgjwthnbmjzvxikjasgyi/Build/Intermediates.noindex/PrecompiledHeaders/Runner-Bridging-Header-swift_3B2RD1630KUEL-clang_56KV530HTHM6.pch' for bridging header '/Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h'
               /Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h:1:9: note: in file included from /Users/jimmyff/Development/esc_party/esc_app/ios/Runner/Runner-Bridging-Header.h:1:
               #import "GeneratedPluginRegistrant.h"
                       ^
               2 errors generated.

From your logs this issue looks same as this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/99387, 

> Builds take 5-10 minutes which is just a nightmare for fixing issues or diagnosing build problems like this

Is this issue with a newly created flutter project too? if so I would recommend you to please file that as a separate issue.

> I'm unable to run from VSCode - it tells me that i should try running from Xcode instead

Could you please share the complete error/message when this happens.

Closing as the duplicate of the above linked issue. Please follow up there for further updates. Incase you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

title: [integration_test] Mocking method channels with dynamic name is not possible without guessing
body:
We are testing our app with integrationtests. At one point we mock method channel with of a plugin. In the method channel name is the view_id. So the channel name is dynamic. To correctly mock it, we need to get this id from the widget. 

The _inboundHandlers Variable of tester.binding.defaultBinaryMessenger contains the channel name with the id, but its private.
comments:
@test0terter0n 
Can you provide `flutter doctor -v` and a complete minimal reproducible code sample that shows actual behavior against the expected one you are looking for ?

<details>

Here's how I solved the issue:
macOS: Monterey
XCode: 13.3
Flutter: 2.10
Dart : 2.16.1

Once you've the above config set, run 'flutter packages upgrade'.
Then create a backup of your 'ios' folder and delete it from your project repo.
now run 'flutter clean' followed by 'flutter create .' This will create an 'ios' folder in the repo.
Copy the Info.plist,  Podfile and any other config files like GoogleServices.plist from the backup 'ios' folder to the newly created 'ios' folder.

Run the project now and it should work!

Copy the Info.plist, Podfile and any other config files like GoogleServices.plist from the backup 'ios' folder to the newly created 'ios' folder.
> 
> Run the project now and it should work!

Worked for me :-)

After updating the macOS and accepting terms in Xcode, It only worked running these command:

> flutter clean
> rm -rf ios/Pods
> rm -rf ios/.symlinks
> rm -rf ios/Flutter/Flutter.framework
> rm -rf ios/Flutter/Flutter.podspec
same issue on Qt, i solved in this way https://github.com/cagnulein/qdomyos-zwift/discussions/740

I had this same issue and none of the above suggested solutions fixed it. What did it for me was running:

`flutter build ipa --no-tree-shake-icons`

Running `flutter build ipa --verbose` showed a more detailed error message which suggested using the `--no-tree-shake-icons` option to fix it. I'm not sure why that fixed it, but it did.

body: the plugin already support ios, but not support macos

title: DraggableScrollableBottomSheet rebuilds every single frame while dragging
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

The `DraggableScrollableBottomSheet` rebuilds its child every single frame while dragging up and down. In my case that means, my `FutureBuilder` is fetching every single frame data from Firebase. 

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Drag up and down <!-- describe steps to demonstrate bug -->
3. Watch console for print <!-- for example "Tap on X and see a crash" -->

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

Only fetch data once and do not rebuild every frame.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Executes the fetch every single frame.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->


```
                    FutureBuilder<QuerySnapshot<Activity>>(
                              future: FirebaseFirestore.instance
                                  .collection("activities")
                                  .get(),
                              builder: (BuildContext context,
                                  AsyncSnapshot<QuerySnapshot<Activity>>
                                      snapshot) {
                                print("BUILD");

                                if (snapshot.hasData) {
                                  return SliverList(
                                        delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
                                      (context, index) {
                                       
                                        return ListTile(
                                          title: Text(index.toString()),
                                        );
                                     }
                                      childCount: snapshot.data!.docs.length,
                                    )),
                                  );
                                } else {
                                  return SliverToBoxAdapter(
                                    child: Container(
                                        height: 160,
                                     ),
                                  );
                                }
                              });

```


</details>

title: Embedding flutter app to Android using cachedEngine failed with MissingPluginException
comments:
If i skip ArcoreController things,

the error was like,

```
E/flutter: [ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(209)] Unhandled Exception: PlatformException(ServiceAreNotBounded, service is not bounded, null, null)
E/flutter: [ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(209)] Unhandled Exception: PlatformException(SERVICE_STATUS_ERROR, Location service status couldn't be determined, null, null)
    #0      StandardMethodCodec.decodeEnvelope (package:flutter/src/services/message_codecs.dart:607:7)
    #1      MethodChannel._invokeMethod (package:flutter/src/services/platform_channel.dart:167:18)
    <asynchronous suspension>
    #2      MethodChannelLocation.serviceEnabled (package:location_platform_interface/src/method_channel_location.dart:130:25)
    <asynchronous suspension>
```

@wangmir 
`Unhandled Exception: MissingPluginException(No implementation found for method checkArCoreApkAvailability` this seems to be pointing to third party package. 

If you skip it, and getting below errors:

`Unhandled Exception: PlatformException(ServiceAreNotBounded, service is not bounded, null, null)`
`PlatformException(SERVICE_STATUS_ERROR, Location service status couldn't be determined, null, null)`

Seems to also point to third party plugin, `location`, for which a similar issue is open in dedicated repo: https://github.com/Lyokone/flutterlocation/issues/568

If you directly follow the steps mentioned in the [document](https://docs.flutter.dev/development/add-to-app/android/add-flutter-screen?tab=cached-engine-with-initial-route-kotlin-tab) as-is without adding any third party plugins, do you still get any kind of exception ?

Actually, I exactly mean that.

When I remove location library, it also happened at other library too.

```
E/flutter: [ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(209)] Unhandled Exception: MissingPluginException(No implementation found for method requestIgnoreBatteryOptimizations on channel flutter.demen.org/android_power_manager)
    #0      MethodChannel._invokeMethod (package:flutter/src/services/platform_channel.dart:165:7)
    <asynchronous suspension>
    #1      AndroidPowerManager.requestIgnoreBatteryOptimizations (package:android_power_manager/android_power_manager.dart:18:7)
    <asynchronous suspension>
    #2      _ShoppingStartAlertDialogState.startingView.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:catcha_module/screens/dialogs/shopping_start_dialog.dart:147:27)
    <asynchronous suspension>
```

I tested with the clean flutter module, and that was running perfectly, but if i use some library which implements functionality using platform channel, it seems to fail.

So, I'm wondering that should i do something more when I use cachedEngine to warm up engine with platform implementation.

Because, it run perfectly when I launch with new engine.

I think this issue can be a hint.
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/93968

Are there any guideline for this function? `GeneratedPluginRegistrant.registerWith(flutterEngine)`

@darshankawar it may be caused by the same reason. But, the case is different. In the case of #83000, it fails when the android application calls the method channel to plugin, and that method channel start flutter activity, but in my case the sequence is just like,

1. prepare flutter module (aar) and Android application which will embed flutter aar.
2. flutter aar references library which contains platform-channel functions.
3. pre warming flutter engine using cached engine.
4. And pre-warming sequence failed with that.

@wangmir 
Thanks for the feedback. Can you try [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98473#issuecomment-1058500136) solution and see if it helps ?

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: IgnorePointer doesn't work properly when wrapped around a webview running JS (ex. google maps)
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

Open google maps in a webview on Iphone, and wrap it in ignore pointer, absorb pointer, or anything else of the like. You can also put an alert dialog above it, and when tapping the dialog, google maps will respond.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
No response

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
google maps responds, zooms in, drops a pin etc.
<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>


```import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';

class InAppWebViewBug extends StatelessWidget {
  const InAppWebViewBug({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
        body: IgnorePointer(
            child: WebView(
      javascriptMode: JavascriptMode.unrestricted,
      initialUrl: 'https://www.google.com/maps/',
    )));
  }
}
```


<!--
      Consider also attaching screenshots and/or videos to better
      illustrate the issue.

      You can upload them directly on GitHub.
      Beware that video file size is limited to 10MB.
-->
comments:
@darshankawar Which open issue?

Also it's not just ignore pointer, it also happens when you stack anything on top of it that should be blocking the gestures (buttons, dialogs, modal bottom sheets, other widgets, and even transparent page routes).

Sorry, missed to link the original issue. Updated my previous comment.

title: tap to move cursor in textfield not working on android
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

This only seems to happen on physical devices. So far it has occurred with the s8 and the s10. Unsure if the issue can be reproduced elsewhere, but it does not occur in ios simulator, physical ios, or android emulator.

1. Create a `TextField` widget and type something in it
2. Tap somewhere in the middle of the text you just typed, with the intention of moving the cursor to where you tapped

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Cursor moves to the location that was tapped
**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
The text between where you tapped and the last character in the textfield gets selected (highlighted).

Because of this issue it's very difficult for a user to go back and fix typos and such.

title: [tool_crash] DartDevelopmentServiceException
body:
## Command
```
flutter run
```

## Steps to Reproduce
1. ...
2. ...
3. ...

## Logs

title: Content behind AppBar when using FlexibleSpacebar
comments:
Hi @delizondo, Thanks for filing the issue. I am able to reproduce the issue the TabBar is overlapping SilverPersistentHeader. 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/157817063-c5a333a2-1a7c-4cd8-b17b-f4cc803264e5.mov

This is a known issue and is being tracked here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/26667.


To partially prevent that error you could add background color to TabBar's Container (even though the content still overflows) in `_SliverAppBarDelegate`, so that the content overflow is not visible upfront

```dart
 return Container(
        color: Colors.red, // add a color
      child: _tabBar,
    );
```

 I would suggest you to please follow up on that issue for further updates. Closing this issue as a duplicate of the linked issue. In case you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

title: showDatePicker should be able to close itself as soon as a date is selected
body:
## Use case
Quickier date selection.
Right now, the user has to tap on the date he wants, then tap on the OK button. It would be an improvement if the user could just tap the date and have the Picker close itself without having to tap OK.

## Proposal
Add a `closeOnDateSelection` boolean which would enable this behaviour.

title: [video_player] Formatting issue with uncommon aspect ratios.
body:
Hi there, I face an issue when using the video_player plugin with videos having uncommon aspect ratios. For example, the video texture will vertically overflow its container when the video has a fairly small aspect ratio: The red block on the right is a container having the aspect ration given by the `VideoPlayerController`, while the actual video on the left is displayed incorrectly. It can be reproduced on the latest version using the example project in [this fork](https://github.com/TomVeniat/plugins).
Video to reproduce https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5921144/157257830-342e66cd-05e2-4e11-8ee8-50bbaf919007.mp4
flutter doctor -v

This problem doesn't happen on iOS. I only see it on Android, at least on Pixel and Honor phones. Let me know if you need anything else to diagnostic this issue.
comments:
@TomVeniat 
Thanks for the detailed report. It seems that the issue is video doesn't fit into the parent widget and goes out of the container, that leads me to this similar / related issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/51250. Can you check this and see if it's same as your case ?
Thanks for you quick response, this issue is indeed closely related.
Based on the issue you linked, I found this closed issue that seems to be related as well : https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/37387 . 
The observed stretching in the original issue is still visible in the example above (also related to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/64233).
Thanks For the feedback @TomVeniat.
The stretch at the bottom is the same as you mentioned: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/64233 in which you can follow-up for the fix.

As for the issue you reported, it seems to me that the video doesn't fit into the container goes out of the bounds, which seems to be similar to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/51250. Would like to know how your issue is different than 51250 and if the behavior you reported can be followed up in the original issue.

title: Divide main.dart.js into main.dart.mini.js + project.js
body: Flutter web first loading is too slow for the big size of main.dart.js. Why not divide main.dart.js into main.dart.mini.js + project.js. Main.dart.mini.js only contains the flutter framework basic code, NOT changed at build time. And the project.js comains the app codes. Please consider the cocos-js solution!
comments:
Hi @UsherBaby, Thanks for filing the issue. There is already a feature request being tracked to make the Web app's first load faster https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/76009, Regarding your proposal which is more of a question, I would suggest you please continue the discussion on that thread.

Closing as the duplicate of the linked issue. Incase you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: [tool_crash] FileSystemException: Cannot create link, OS Error: Access is denied., errno = 5
body:
## Command
```
flutter test
```

## Steps to Reproduce
I tried creating a CI/CD pipeline building a Flutter application to Windows with [DroneCI](https://www.drone.io/), but it seems that even though I allowed full access to `C:\drone` permission is still denied when creating a link in `C:\drone\src\windows\flutter\ephemeral\.plugin_symlinks\path_provider_windows`.
I also used a custom image for running the jobs (can be found [here](https://hub.docker.com/r/internerd/windows-flutter)) with Flutter and Dart installed (see the `flutter doctor -v` output below).

1. Create a Drone CI host (eg., via a docker-compose file, can be provided if needed)
2. Create a Windows runner which registers to the DroneCI host (can also be provided)
3. With the following `drone.yml` the logs below are reproducable:
```yml
kind: pipeline
type: docker
name: windows-app

platform:
  platform:
  os: windows
  version: "1809"

steps:
  - name: test
    image: internerd/windows-flutter
    commands:
      - whoami
      - flutter doctor
      - flutter test
```


## Logs
FileSystemException: Cannot create link, path= 'C:\drone\src\windows\flutter\ephemeral\.plugin_symlinks\path_provider_windows' OS Error: Access is denied.
, errno = 5

title: Error while building Flutter APK for android-arm only
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

I got into this problem since last month. 
- I can build APK for android-arm64, android-x86 or all of them combined.
- It can even create an android-arm apk with the command `flutter build apk --split-per-abi`
- But it cannot build apk specifically for android-arm alone.

## Thing I have tried
- I tried changing gradle versions to 6.7-all, 7.3.1-bin and 7.2-bin
- I tried removing flutter folder and reinstalling it all

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter build apk --target-platform android-arm --analyze-size` 

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
APK built for android-arm architecture

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

comments:
Hi @OutdatedGuy, do you have this issue with the counter app? 

If you do, please provide the complete output of `flutter build apk --target-platform android-arm --analyze-size -v`. The output is likely to be huge, so kindly put it into a .txt file and attach it here. 

If it doesn't reproduce with the counter app, kindly provide your `pubspec.yaml`, `android/build.gradle`, `android/app/build.gradle` as well as the verbose logs of `flutter build apk --target-platform android-arm --analyze-size -v`

Thank you

Yo @danagbemava-nc , YES I have this issue with the counter app too.

Here is the output for the command you gave: [counter_app_build_verbose.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/8198382/counter_app_build_verbose.txt)

More to add:
- There was no issue a month ago
- It likely started after I downloaded the stable windows flutter version(i.e. 2.10.0)

There's a similar issue reported in #97764. 

Kindly follow up there for updates. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

comments:
@biad-iritie 
For `HTTP Host Availability` issue, this was fixed recently and should be available on latest master, so switch and upgrade to latest master to see the fix. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98170

Regarding `gRPC-Core` and `cloud_firestore`, check this similar issue and underlying comments and see if it helps to resolve the issue: https://github.com/FirebaseExtended/flutterfire/issues/2533
If not, please open the issue in dedicated repo.

Closing from here.
Ok, thanks

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (the doctor check crashed)
body:
Due to an error, the doctor check did not complete. If the error message below is not helpful, please let us know
      about this issue at https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues.
   FormatException: Unexpected extension byte (at offset 5)
comments: I need help on error when I run flutter doctor in windows PowerShell

I also have this problem but for IntelliJ Ultimate:

```
[☠] IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (the doctor check crashed)
    ✗ Due to an error, the doctor check did not complete. If the error message below is not helpful, please let us know about
      this issue at https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues.
    ✗ FormatException: Unexpected extension byte (at offset 5)
```

One way to "fix" it that worked on my machine was to update the version of gradle and dart.

I downloaded the latest 'complete' version and added /bin from the extracted folder to the system environment variables.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64156428/156901049-9f82abd2-e66a-4abd-9da4-c6d3a867c64c.png)

Then in the configuration files... 
- andriod/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties
I updated the distributionUrl to https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-7.4-all.zip

- andriod/build.gradle
ext.kotlin_version to '1.6.10'
And I also updated 'com.android.tools.build:gradle:x.x.x' to com.android.tools.build:gradle:7.0.4

$ flutter clean

I hope I have helped in some way.
