title: Feature: WebView support for all desktop platforms (Windows/MacOS/Linux)
body:
Currently, more and more customers demand for a WebView inside our desktop flutter app.
It boosts productivity, sometimes websites are quickly scanned within an application, just for a few seconds, without opening another window (and closing it)

Currently, [WebView for Flutter](https://pub.dev/packages/webview_flutter) is a very popular plugin for mobile platforms, but **this does not work for e.g. Windows**.
I know that there are other plugins such as [flutter-webview-windows](https://github.com/jnschulze/flutter-webview-windows), but it is only working for windows and we want to offer our application to Mac and Linux users aswell.

Are there any official plans to support WebView on desktop platforms?
I'm asking because the "View/report issues" of [WebView for Flutter](https://pub.dev/packages/webview_flutter) is tied to the flutter-repository.
comments:
Kindly see the following issues

- https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/41725
- https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/37597
- https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/41726

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

title: [video_player][Android] Looping network video downloads data repeatedly
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->
I'm experiencing an issue with the video_player package on Android. I couldn't reproduce it on iOS. 

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a flutter app with the video_player package `2.2.19`.
2. Integrate the custom widget `LoopingVideo` of the code sample in the app.
3. Run the app on an Android device or emulator.
4. Navigate to the code sample widget and keep it visible on the screen.
5. Inspect the data consumption.

**Expected results:** The player downloads the video one time and loops over it. It's even possible to cut the network connection of the device once the video is fully downloaded and it repeats the video forever.

**Actual results:** The player downloads the video over and over again, probably once for every loop replay. If you cut the network connection of the device, the loop iterates a couple of times and then stops.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:video_player/video_player.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class LoopingVideo extends StatefulWidget {
  final _LoopingVideoState _state;

  LoopingVideo({required String url}) : _state = _LoopingVideoState(url);

  @override
  _LoopingVideoState createState() => _state;
}

class _LoopingVideoState extends State<LoopingVideo> {
  VideoPlayerController? _controller;
  final String _url;

  _LoopingVideoState(this._url);

  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
    final playerOptions = VideoPlayerOptions(mixWithOthers: true);

    _controller = VideoPlayerController.network(
      _url,
      videoPlayerOptions: playerOptions,
    );

    _controller?.initialize().then((_) {
      setState(() {
        _controller?.setVolume(0.0);
        _controller?.play();
        _controller?.setLooping(true);
      });
    });
  }

  @override
  void dispose() {
    _controller?.pause();
    _controller?.dispose();
    _controller = null;
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    if (_controller?.value.isInitialized ?? false) {
      return AspectRatio(
        aspectRatio: _controller!.value.aspectRatio,
        child: VideoPlayer(_controller!),
      );
    } else {
      return Container();
    }
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>

<!-- Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here. -->

```
[✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on macOS 11.3.1 20E241 darwin-arm, locale de-DE)
    • Flutter version 2.8.1 at /Users/juria/develop/flutter
    • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
    • Framework revision 77d935af4d (3 months ago), 2021-12-16 08:37:33 -0800
    • Engine revision 890a5fca2e
    • Dart version 2.15.1

[✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3)
    • Android SDK at /Users/juria/Library/Android/sdk
    • Platform android-30, build-tools 30.0.3
    • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/Contents/Home/bin/java
    • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165)
    • All Android licenses accepted.

[✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 13.2.1)
    • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer
    • CocoaPods version 1.11.2

[✓] Chrome - develop for the web
    • Chrome at /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome

[✓] Android Studio (version 2020.3)
    • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents
    • Flutter plugin can be installed from:
      🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter
    • Dart plugin can be installed from:
      🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart
    • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165)

[✓] VS Code (version 1.64.2)
    • VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents
    • Flutter extension version 3.34.0
```

</details>
comments: Hi @juri180, Thanks for filing the issue. This issue looks the same as  ~https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/99417~ https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98482  where the video is redownloaded when seek To beginning or when video plays on loop. Could you please check and confirm if this is the same issue?
Hi @maheshmnj, thanks for your response. I guess you've posted the wrong link? The link is this issue itself.
Oops! I am so sorry, Please take a look at this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98482

Thanks! [#98482](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98482) is a very similar issue, if not the same. I didn't realize a delay, but I've used videos with very small sizes (~3 seconds, ~100KB). Those videos are used like GIFs in my use case. They loop infinitely which causes a lot of data consumption on Android.

I've also tested to use `seekTo(Duration.zero)` as soon as the video ends, but this caused the same issue. Only one difference: Using `seekTo` caused less data consumption than `setLooping(true)`.

In my example with the ~3 seconds/~100KB video, the data consumption was as follows:

- `setLooping(true)`: up to 10MB/minute
- `seekTo`: 2-3MB per minute.

No idea why there is a difference. Both looked identically on the UI.

Thanks for the update, 

> In my example with the ~3 seconds/~100KB video, the data consumption was as follows:

>setLooping(true): up to 10MB/minute
seekTo: 2-3MB per minute.


May I know how you are measuring the data consumption? Does this happen with any video source or a specific video?

My videos are hosted in Firebase Storage and I tested it in a development-only Firebase project, so I could observe the "Usage" tab in the Firebase console to measure the data consumption. I'd love to have a better way, but I couldn't use the network tab of the Dart DevTools so far (nothing appeared there).

It happened with all my videos, which are MP4 files using the h.264 codec. I haven't checked other video formats.

First I tried your unchanged code sample on an Android device and observed, that when the video is almost done playing and I cut the network connection and press the replay button, the video doesn't start again. Thus, the video has to be downloaded on every replay, indeed. That's not the case on iOS. On iOS you can press replay without an available network connection.

Then, I uploaded the video to my Firebase Storage and set looping to `true`. I observed the "usage" tab in the Firebase console and the result is similar to my own videos I described earlier. While the video loops, it downloads ~10MB per minute.

Thanks for the update @juri180, This issue looks the same as this  https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98482 as pointed out earlier. I am closing this issue as a duplicate of the linked issue.
In case you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: [Bug] The text breaks words in the middle with wrap.
body:
Flutter Text widget doesn't wrap words correctly in the Latvian language. It breaks words in the middle.


![flutter_latvian_word_wrap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31936990/156186525-86a2c563-1d1f-44e5-9b85-965ad720a910.png)


[Example Code](https://dartpad.dev/?id=dcf4c7850f935b1753a550eebf013c73)
comments: Hi @ThickLine, Thanks for filing the issue. I can see same behavior the word is broken in the middle I believe this is a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/61081 which is tracking controlling of word break, Could you please confirm this?
Hi. Yep, it looks the same.
Thanks for the confirmation, Closing as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/61081, Please follow up on that issue for further updates.

title: [web] [CanvasKit] Text rendering issue when truncated with ellipses
body:
The problem is that when I use the CanvasKit renderer, text widgets that use ellipses for handling overflow show an additional character at the end which looks like a square. This doesn't happen with the default web font but in my tests, it happened with both my imported `ttf` font and Google Fonts. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a new project and use the sample code provided here. 2. Make sure you add the google-fonts package using `flutter pub add google_fonts`. 3. Run the app using the CanvasKit renderer by running `flutter run --web-renderer canvaskit`. 4. Observe the extra character at the end. Optionally you can compare it with using HTML renderer and see how that works fine. **Expected results:** **Actual results:**
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:google_fonts/google_fonts.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( home: Material( color: Colors.white, child: Center( child: SizedBox( width: 500, child: Material( color: Colors.transparent, child: Text( 'This is just a text which is long enough to trigger the ellipses overflow' ' so we can see how it is not working correctly using the CanvasKit renderer.', style: GoogleFonts.allan(fontSize: 30), overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis, maxLines: 2, ), ), ), ), ), ); } } ```
Logs `flutter doctor -v` ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.10.2, on macOS 12.2.1 21D62 darwin-x64, locale en-US) • Flutter version 2.10.2 at /Users/behnamsattar/tools/bin/flutter • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 097d3313d8 (10 days ago), 2022-02-18 19:33:08 -0600 • Engine revision a83ed0e5e3 • Dart version 2.16.1 • DevTools version 2.9.2 [!] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3) • Android SDK at /Users/behnamsattar/Library/Android/sdk ✗ cmdline-tools component is missing Run `path/to/sdkmanager --install "cmdline-tools;latest"` See https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line for more details. ✗ Android license status unknown. Run `flutter doctor --android-licenses` to accept the SDK licenses. See https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/macos#android-setup for more details. [✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 13.2.1) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • CocoaPods version 1.11.2 [✓] Chrome - develop for the web • Chrome at /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome [✓] Android Studio (version 2020.3) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Flutter plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter • Dart plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) [✓] VS Code (version 1.64.2) • VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents • Flutter extension version 3.34.0 [✓] Connected device (1 available) • Chrome (web) • chrome • web-javascript • Google Chrome 98.0.4758.109 [✓] HTTP Host Availability • All required HTTP hosts are available ! title: [web] [html-renderer] Path.combine() is not implemented
body:

title: ListView content visible outside of ListView
body:
## Details
If you set ListTile -> selected to true and set selectedTileColor, this will be visible outside the list on any transparent Wiget. Same applies to the highlight/splash effect on Inkwell Items inside ListView - the aren't cut at the border of the Listview.
Tested under Win 11, Web and Desktop app.

### Actual result
The background color of the selected ListTiles/Inkwell is visible outside of my ListView. Same applies with a Inkwell highlight on hover/splash effect.

### Expected result
No element of the list should ever be visible outside the list.

### Assets
<details>
<summary>Image showing the problem</summary>

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65506676/156011739-6a8f3841-ed49-4f00-b515-7b662fd3fe7f.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>minimal Source code</summary>

```
class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {

title: Flutter App freezes  after  animating for a few seconds

Hi @doradsoft, Thanks for filing the issue. I am able to reproduce the issue the app gets frozen after a while ~android, ios and on web with canvaskit~ on all platforms, while it works fine with HTML renderer. This is reproducible on both the stable and the master channel.

HTML | Canvaskit
:-: | :-:

:-: | :-:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/156369631-6c69cd8c-8de5-4052-89dd-60448b0cc6f8.mov

}

  late Timer timer;
  @override

    super.initState();
    timer = Timer.periodic(const Duration(milliseconds: 20), (timer) {
      setState(() {
        angle += 0.01;
      });
    });
  }

  @override

    timer.cancel();
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override

    return Scaffold(

        ),

Rackham."""))))),
        ));
  }
}

Hey @maheshmnj, thanks for your effort making this issue better to solve.
You have changed the issue title and I think it's not accurate. As I mentioned in #99233 the issues reproduces also without `Timer.Periodic`. It happens with Animation and AnimatedBuilder as well.
I think it's more about the child widget type.

Reproduced this on Android.

This is due to the same cause as https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98275

I spent days on this problem without understanding the cause of it since I was using animations, images (including gif) and Transform on a large number of widgets. It worked quite fine on mobiles and macOS but it would just freeze each time after a while on Web.
It apparently happened only because there was a label on top of my animated widgets as suggested by @jason-simmons. Thank you so much for pointing this out, it drove me crazy. 🙏
Closing this as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98275 that has a linked Skia issue. I'm going to elevate the priority of the linked issue.

title: BorderRadius.circular should be a const constructor
body:
As of Flutter 2.11, the `BorderRadius.circular` constructor isn't `const` but I think, it could be. Other constructors are.

This would allow something like this:

```
const FluentContextMenu({Key? key, required this.items, this.borderRadius = const BorderRadius.circular(8)}) : super(key: key);
```

As a workaround, I have to do this:

```
const FluentContextMenu({Key? key, required this.items, this.borderRadius = const BorderRadius.all(Radius.circular(8))}) : super(key: key);
```
comments:
Closing this as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98575.
Please see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98575#issuecomment-1041488980 for more details and further reference.

title: SEO Support
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

I just want to know what the progress is on SEO support in Flutter - specifically with 1. crawler support and 2. meta tag support:

1. crawlers still struggle to actually render my website past the #. I understand this is an issue with all SPA/JS based apps however considering Flutter 2.0 Navigation (and the fact that this is a Google Framework) I feel we should have some better support for this? Maybe we could support native prerendering on build (like NextJS) or similar to help make the sites more crawlable.

2. meta tags need a way to be updated dynamically to support keywords and all that fun stuff

While there are a handful of plugins that help with this - like [SEO renderer](https://pub.dev/packages/seo_renderer) - I do think native support for this would be a great way to increase the popularity of the platform, especially when compared to other SPA frameworks.

Mostly just interested in if this (SEO in general) is even on the timeline for Flutter. Is this of interest at all or just not an issue the Flutter team views as a Flutter problem.

Thank you in advance!
comments:
Hi @dan1229, SEO is important to the team but there are some prerequisites. See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/46789#issuecomment-1007835929. 

Feel free to share your contribution in #46789. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

title: [Image_picker] Add desktop support
body:
## Use case
I have an app that uses the [image_picker](https://pub.dev/packages/image_picker) plugin and I wanted to add windows to my flutter project, but I can't use the image_picker on the windwos app.

## Proposal
So my proposal is to add desktop support to the image_picker plugin. The ImageSource.camera would just use the camera of the pc (if it has any) and ImageSource.gallery would just ask for a image file.

title: Can't scroll a NestedScrollView with a not expandable pinned SliverAppBar
body:
## Summary

If we don't set the `expandedHeight` of a `SliverAppBar` or if we set it to the same value than the `collapsedHeight`, then we can't scroll a list under a `NestedScrollView`.

If for example we change the `SliverAppBar` declaration (in the following code sample) by this instead, we can scroll: 
```dart
SliverAppBar(
  title: const Text('Books'),
  pinned: true,
  expandedHeight: kToolbarHeight + 0.005,
  forceElevated: innerBoxIsScrolled,
),
```

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Try to scroll

**Expected results:**
We should be able to scroll the list.

**Actual results:**
We can't scroll.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  static const String _title = 'Flutter Code Sample';

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: _title,
      home: MyStatelessWidget(),
    );
  }
}

class MyStatelessWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyStatelessWidget({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final List<String> _tabs = <String>['Tab 1', 'Tab 2'];
    return DefaultTabController(
      length: _tabs.length,
      child: Scaffold(
        body: NestedScrollView(
          headerSliverBuilder: (BuildContext context, bool innerBoxIsScrolled) {
            return <Widget>[
              SliverOverlapAbsorber(
                handle:
                    NestedScrollView.sliverOverlapAbsorberHandleFor(context),
                sliver: SliverAppBar(
                  title: const Text('Books'),
                  pinned: true,
                  expandedHeight: kToolbarHeight,
                  forceElevated: innerBoxIsScrolled,
                ),
              ),
            ];
          },
          body: SafeArea(
            top: false,
            bottom: false,
            child: Builder(
              builder: (BuildContext context) {
                return CustomScrollView(
                  slivers: <Widget>[
                    SliverOverlapInjector(
                      handle: NestedScrollView.sliverOverlapAbsorberHandleFor(
                          context),
                    ),
                    SliverPadding(
                      padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
                      sliver: SliverFixedExtentList(
                        itemExtent: 48.0,
                        delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
                          (BuildContext context, int index) {
                            return ListTile(
                              title: Text('Item $index'),
                            );
                          },
                          childCount: 30,
                        ),
                      ),
                    ),
                  ],
                );
              },
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

```

body:
I am developing a Flutter App using google_sign_in.
https://pub.dev/packages/google_sign_in

When I log in using google_sign_in in Flutter App, an error occurs: 
```

Flutter App signing was done normally, and the hash value was properly registered in Firebase.

This is the cert value of app-release.apk.

SHA1: D9:94:3F:B7:XX:XX:XX:XX:68:22:A8:5D:23:78:07:8A:67:16:EE:C3

Why is this only happening in Flutter v2.10?

I downloaded the google-services.json file again and installed it.

I modified android/app/build.gradle file.

```
dependencies {
    implementation "org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk7:$kotlin_version"

buildscript {

        google()

    }

    dependencies {
        classpath 'com.android.tools.build:gradle:4.1.0'

}

allprojects {

        maven {
            url 'https://naver.jfrog.io/artifactory/maven/'
        }
    }
}

Hi @gracegyu, Thanks for filing the issue. As far as I know this issue is mainly due to incorrect sha in the firebase console. Since you are having issue only on the emulator and considering you are running in debug mode (since the emulator do not support other modes) Ensure that you have added a debug Keystore to firebase console https://developers.google.com/android/guides/client-auth

Closing this issue as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/33393. If you still encounter the issue please check for some of the solutions mentioned in that issue thread.

I actually registered the release build to Google PlayStore and tested it, but the same error occurs.

The only difference is Flutter v1.26 vs v2.10 (null safety)
Please followup on the linked issue.

Your `MainActivity` class in your `MainActivity.java` or `MainActivity.kt` needs to extends `FlutterFragmentActivity`.

There's an already open issue in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/81127 that seeks to address the documentation issue in the README of the package.

Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing as duplicate

title: Apple Watch target detection does not work for new Apple Watch targets
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## NOTE
This IS NOT an issue regarding Flutter supporting Apple Watch targets in general. I created #97721 already, but that one was closed as a duplicate. This is NOT a duplicate issue (unless someone beat me to it). Apple Watch targets created by older versions of Xcode used to build fine with Flutter.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an iOS flutter project using `flutter create`
2. Add an Apple Watch target
3. Fix miscellaneous unrelated issues with the generated watch target (thanks Xcode)
4. Run `flutter build ios`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

Flutter detects that the project contains an Apple Watch target and adjusts the build settings accordingly. The following line should appear in the build log:

```console
Watch companion app found.
```

Successful build

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Flutter cannot detect that new Apple Watch targets created by Xcode exist because the structure of Apple Watch targets changed

Build failure

<summary>Code sample</summary>

https://github.com/Rexios80/flutter_apple_watch_build_failure

## Additional Information
Currently, Flutter looks for a `WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier` key in plist files, but that key no longer exists in new Apple Watch targets.

The watchkitapp target no longer contains a plist by default, and the watchkitextension target contains a plist with the following contents:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>NSExtension</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExtensionAttributes</key>
		<dict>
			<key>WKAppBundleIdentifier</key>
			<string>dev.rexios.appleWatchTest.watchkitapp</string>
		</dict>
		<key>NSExtensionPointIdentifier</key>
		<string>com.apple.watchkit</string>
	</dict>
</dict>
</plist>
```

This issue can be worked around by adding the following items to the watchkitextension plist:
```xml
<key>WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier</key>
<string>dev.rexios.appleWatchTest</string>
```

Ideally this workaround would be unnecessary.

Location of the issue in the Flutter repo: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/e4351ff0531fe7be2c7b62e41683d60ffba421b4/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/xcode_project.dart#L335

title: Autofill on web does not work. Same code works fine on Android.
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce
Autofill does not work on a web application we are developing. To eliminate the problem, I created simple app with few fields and an autofill by following directions on AutofillGroup-class.html

How to reproduce:
Ran code sample from https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/AutofillGroup-class.html as web application in chrome. 

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run -d chrome --verbose` on the code sample published at https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/AutofillGroup-class.html 
2. autofill does not work.

**Expected results:** autofill on an attempt to populate fields

**Actual results:** autofill does not work

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() => runApp(const MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  static const String _title = 'Flutter Code Sample';

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: _title,
      home: Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(title: const Text(_title)),
        body: const MyStatefulWidget(),
      ),
    );
  }
}

class MyStatefulWidget extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyStatefulWidget({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<MyStatefulWidget> createState() => _MyStatefulWidgetState();
}

class _MyStatefulWidgetState extends State<MyStatefulWidget> {
  bool isSameAddress = true;
  final TextEditingController shippingAddress1 = TextEditingController();
  final TextEditingController shippingAddress2 = TextEditingController();
  final TextEditingController billingAddress1 = TextEditingController();
  final TextEditingController billingAddress2 = TextEditingController();

  final TextEditingController creditCardNumber = TextEditingController();
  final TextEditingController creditCardSecurityCode = TextEditingController();

  final TextEditingController phoneNumber = TextEditingController();

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return ListView(
      children: <Widget>[
        const Text('Shipping address'),
        // The address fields are grouped together as some platforms are
        // capable of autofilling all of these fields in one go.
        AutofillGroup(
          child: Column(
            children: <Widget>[
              TextField(
                controller: shippingAddress1,
                autofillHints: const <String>[AutofillHints.streetAddressLine1],
              ),
              TextField(
                controller: shippingAddress2,
                autofillHints: const <String>[AutofillHints.streetAddressLine2],
              ),
            ],
          ),
        ),
        const Text('Billing address'),
        Checkbox(
          value: isSameAddress,
          onChanged: (bool? newValue) {
            if (newValue != null) {
              setState(() {
                isSameAddress = newValue;
              });
            }
          },
        ),
        // Again the address fields are grouped together for the same reason.
        if (!isSameAddress)
          AutofillGroup(
            child: Column(
              children: <Widget>[
                TextField(
                  controller: billingAddress1,
                  autofillHints: const <String>[
                    AutofillHints.streetAddressLine1
                  ],
                ),
                TextField(
                  controller: billingAddress2,
                  autofillHints: const <String>[
                    AutofillHints.streetAddressLine2
                  ],
                ),
              ],
            ),
          ),
        const Text('Credit Card Information'),
        // The credit card number and the security code are grouped together
        // as some platforms are capable of autofilling both fields.
        AutofillGroup(
          child: Column(
            children: <Widget>[
              TextField(
                controller: creditCardNumber,
                autofillHints: const <String>[AutofillHints.creditCardNumber],
              ),
              TextField(
                controller: creditCardSecurityCode,
                autofillHints: const <String>[
                  AutofillHints.creditCardSecurityCode
                ],
              ),
            ],
          ),
        ),
        const Text('Contact Phone Number'),
        // The phone number field can still be autofilled despite lacking an
        // `AutofillScope`.
        TextField(
          controller: phoneNumber,
          autofillHints: const <String>[AutofillHints.telephoneNumber],
        ),
      ],
    );
  }
}

```

title: [Android] Copy paste is not working when copying text from some other application
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1, Create new Flutter Project
2. Copy text from Samsung Notes
3. Try paste it to text field in Flutter app

**Expected results:**
It should paste text to the text field.
It works in one of my older Flutter apps that built in 2020 and it also worked before in my other Flutter app, .
This also works in other apps that do not use Flutter.

**Actual results:**
Now it shows Paste button but it doesn't do anything.
Tested this also in new example app and also other computer where I have other Flutter app.

No issues found from flutter doctor.

Tested in Samsung Galaxy S8 (Android 9) and Galaxy S9.
comments:
Hi @Mevasir, Thanks for filing the issue, Does this issue occur only when copying text from Samsung notes or in general from other apps too? Are you able to paste the copied text in non-samsung apps (e.g chrome)?
Please share the output of `flutter doctor -v`.

Only when I'm copying text from Samsung notes or Samsung email (I haven't tested other Samsung apps) to Flutter app. Chrome and gmail works fine.

Here's output of flutter doctor -v

Thanks for the update @Mevasir I suspect if Samsung restricts accessing clipBoard data captured from the Samsung app in 
other apps. 
Can you please try copying data from Samsung apps and try passing it to other apps (non-Samsung)? 

> Are you able to paste the copied text in non-samsung apps (e.g chrome)?
I tested copying data from Samsung notes and passing it to chrome, gmail, signal etc. and it works fine.

title: [Android] App crashes when rotating screen with drawer open (Profile & Release)
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Execute `flutter run --profile`  or `flutter run --release` on the code sample
2. Open the drawer
3. Rotate the device

**Expected results:** 
The app should rebuild in landscape, as seen in debug mode.

**Actual results:**
The app crashes.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const TestApp());
}

class TestApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const TestApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        drawer: const Drawer(),
        appBar: AppBar(),
        body: const Center(
          child: Text('Rotate device after opening drawer'),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>
`flutter run --profile -v`

```

comments:
Hi @KevMCarp, can you confirm something for me? 

Is the crash you get an `AppName is not responding` or is it a hard crash?
Hi @danagbemava-nc initially it's AppName is not responding which leads to a hard crash after about a minute.

Hi @KevMCarp, thanks for confirming. 

While I could reproduce this on `stable`, I can't seem to reproduce it on either `beta` or `master`. 

Can you check either branch and see if you're able to reproduce?

Hi @danagbemava-nc,
I am also unable to reproduce on `beta` or `master`

Thanks

I tried reproducing this using 2.10.2 this but did not see the issue on the devices that I used.

If it is happening on 2.10.1/2.10.2 but not master, then it may have been fixed by https://github.com/flutter/engine/commit/0ca8e1a24c81b3187f33f7c71594fd659562fe1f

This seems like it might be affecting only some devices. 
On my `Poco X3 NFC`, I was able to reproduce it without even opening the drawer. It also reproduces with the drawer open. 
But my colleague could not reproduce it on his devices, `OnePlus 8` and `Redmi K20 Pro`.

This only reproduces on the current stable. It does not reproduce on master. It also does not reproduce on `2.8.1`.

Considering this is happening with release builds, I'll be leaving this issue open for further input. There's a chance more devices might be running into this in the wild. 

## Steps to reproduce
- Run the code sample below in `release` or `profile` mode
- Open the drawer and rotate the device a couple of times. 

<details>
<summary>code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/cupertino.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const TestApp());
}

class TestApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const TestApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        drawer: const Drawer(),
        appBar: AppBar(),
        body: const Center(
          child: Text('Rotate device after opening drawer'),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```
</details>

title: [webview_flutter] Expose property to bypass SSL
body:
Every new version I have to copy the folder plugin and customize the android and ios delegate classes to bypass ssl.

It would be really nice if I had a property to do this work.
comments:
Hi @mdmota, there's an open issue requesting the same in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/36925.

Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

title: ListView jank when app resumed from background
body:
This is something I noticed a while back and applies to any screen on any app, so it isn't specific to the version of flutter that was just released today.

I've provided a code sample below, but any screen with a ListView will work.  

1.) Install a release version of the app on **iOS (not sure about Android)**
2.) Run app, and then send the app to the background
3.) Click the app icon to bring the app back up from the background and immediately swipe up or down.
4.) You will see jank on the scroll.

Additional notes:
1.) After resuming the app, if you pause for half a second before swiping then you will not see jank.
2.) You will continue to get jank until you stop scrolling for half a second.  Meaning if you click the app icon to resume the already running app, and you swipe immediately, and keep swiping then you will keep getting jank for many seconds.
3.) This is the weirdest one: If you are doing a screen record IT DOES NOT JANK.  I figured this out when trying to create a screen recording of the issue.  
3.b.) I'm not sure what starting a screen recording does that resolves this issue, but Native iOS apps don't have this issue either way.
4.) It may seem like a minor issue, but in practice, users regularly start scrolling as soon as they resume apps with lists of data, which hurts the perceived quality of the app.  

Here is a minimum code sample that you can plug into a new flutter project:
```
class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemCount: 200,
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return Container(
            height: 100,
            color: index.isEven ? Colors.grey.shade600 : Colors.grey.shade800,
            child: Row(
              mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
              children: [
                Column(
                  mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                    const SizedBox(height: 32),
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                  ],
                ),
                const SizedBox(
                  width: 32,
                ),
                Column(
                  mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                    const SizedBox(height: 32),
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                  ],
                )
              ],
            ),
          );
        },
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

title: SystemChrome.getPreferredOrientations
body:
We already have the very useful SystemChrome.setPreferredOrientations() method, which probably all of us use. 

Recently I came across the issue of having one screen in an app that get's called from a lot of different pages and is the only one that can go landscape.

When disposing, I set the preferredOrientations back to just portraitUp, but I wanted to have a solution that is a little more flexible and just remembers the preferredOrientations before we changed it, so that I can just return it to the previous 'version' when disposing, rather than having it hardcoded.

I tried to write some native code to get the preferredOrientations, but I was unable to find out where they were stored on iOS and Android. 

Would a SystemChrome.getPreferredOrientations() method make sense/be possible/useful?
comments:
@MehmetMcfly 
I think your case is same as that of mentioned in below issues:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95719
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/74597

So please follow-up in them for further updates. Closing this in favor of above. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

title: Edge-To-Edge stops working after flutter run
comments:
@har-nick 
This seem to be happening because `SystemUiMode.edgeToEdge` is not enabled by default. Please see this similar open issue to make it default, for your reference: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/86248

Also, the fix you provided, ie to have `systemNavigationBarColor: Colors.transparent` helps to make `SystemUiMode.edgeToEdge` to make it work. See this similar issue comment: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/86248#issuecomment-879275168.

Based on above, I suggest you to follow-up in the linked issue for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

title: [docs] Contradicting migration docs
body:
When following docs to [migrate from Android Embedding V1 to V2](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Upgrading-pre-1.12-Android-projects#full-flutter-app-migration), in step 4, after setting both `LaunchTheme` and `NormalTheme` styles, next thing to do is *"Configure `MainActivity` to start with launch theme (...)"*. One of the specified things you have to do is make sure you have a `<meta-data android:name="io.flutter.embedding.android.SplashScreenDrawable">`.

However, after setting this, when you build your app you get a deprecation warning:

    W/FlutterActivityAndFragmentDelegate(14336): A splash screen was provided to Flutter, but this is deprecated. See flutter.dev/go/android-splash-migration for migration steps.

When visiting [mentioned URL](https://flutter.dev/go/android-splash-migration), you can see that `io.flutter.embedding.android.SplashScreenDrawable` **is deprecated and should actually be removed**, which is the opposite you get told to do in previous docs.

Further than this, at least in my case, removing the aforementioned `<meta-data>` causes splash screen not to show the app logo anymore.

---

**TL;DR** Two docs telling to do contradicting stuff.

title: How to jump to a position in percentage
comments:
Hi @carmel, Thanks for filing the issue. I verified with te below code sample I could not reproduce the issue the maxScrollExtent is always the same value.  Please share your output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproducible code sample. Also what target platform are you seeing the issue on? I verified on Android 

<details>
<summary>code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: 'ListView sample',
      home: HomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class HomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const HomePage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  _HomePageState createState() => _HomePageState();
}

class _HomePageState extends State<HomePage> {
  final controller = ScrollController();
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: () {
          print(controller.position.maxScrollExtent);
        },
        child: const Icon(Icons.arrow_upward),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        controller: controller,
        itemCount: 30,
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return ListTile(
            title: Text('Item $index'),
          );
        },
      ),
    );
  }
}

Thanks for the update, if this is related to markdown's maxScrollExtent then this is currently being discussed here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98813
Please follow up there for further updates, Closing this issue as a duplicate. Incase you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it.

Thank you.

Thank you.

@Mr-MahendraGurjar 
Since you seem to be using `iFrame` and trying to allow full screen, I am assuming you are using webview for it, if so, there's similar open issue currently describing same case, https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/27101
Please follow-up in it for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate.

title: Can't type into TextField focused via FocusNode.requestFocus(), in web browser
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup the Flutter Code Lab 3 (Friendly Chat), [Part 7](https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/flutter#6). The full source is here: https://github.com/flutter/codelabs/blob/1cf1863b08c9f28cc3c2cc8155506471ffae035d/friendly_chat/step_07/lib/main.dart
2. Run the app in debug mode in Chrome:
```
flutter run -d chrome
```
3. Click on the "Send a message" text field, type something in, and hit Enter. In the code, this results in the text field being cleared and then refocused using `FocusNode.requestFocus()`.
4. Note that the "Send a message" text field has been cleared, but is still focused (there's a blinking cursor inside). Try typing again: nothing happens / no text appears in the focused text field!

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

I expected that what I typed would appear in the text field, like the first time it was focused.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Nothing happens / no text appears in the focused text field! 

I also tested in Firefox and got the same result.

On the other hand, when I test in an android emulator, it works as expected.

If I (redundently) refocus the (already focused) text field by clicking on it again or pressing Tab a few times, then typing into it works again. In Firefox I was able to determine that the field is not really focused, as far as input focus is concerned from Firefox's point of view, since I'm using an extension there that provides shortcuts without modifer keys (e.g. typing plain "b" is a shortcut) and these shortcuts get triggered when the field is in the "focused but not receiving input" state. I also tried in vanilla Firefox with no extensions, and the problem persists.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
// Copyright 2017, 2020 The Flutter team. All rights reserved.
// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license
// that can be found in the LICENSE file.

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(
    const FriendlyChatApp(),
  );
}

String _name = 'Your Name';

class FriendlyChatApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const FriendlyChatApp({
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: 'FriendlyChat',
      home: ChatScreen(),
    );
  }
}

class ChatMessage extends StatelessWidget {
  const ChatMessage({
    required this.text,
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);
  final String text;

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(
      margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(vertical: 10.0),
      child: Row(
        crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
        children: [
          Container(
            margin: const EdgeInsets.only(right: 16.0),
            child: CircleAvatar(child: Text(_name[0])),
          ),
          Column(
            crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
            children: [
              Text(_name, style: Theme.of(context).textTheme.headline4),
              Container(
                margin: const EdgeInsets.only(top: 5.0),
                child: Text(text),
              ),
            ],
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}

class ChatScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const ChatScreen({
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<ChatScreen> createState() => _ChatScreenState();
}

class _ChatScreenState extends State<ChatScreen> {
  final List<ChatMessage> _messages = [];
  final _textController = TextEditingController();
  final FocusNode _focusNode = FocusNode();

  void _handleSubmitted(String text) {
    _textController.clear();
    var message = ChatMessage(
      text: text,
    );
    setState(() {
      _messages.insert(0, message);
    });
    _focusNode.requestFocus();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text('FriendlyChat')),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Flexible(
            child: ListView.builder(
              padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
              reverse: true,
              itemBuilder: (_, index) => _messages[index],
              itemCount: _messages.length,
            ),
          ),
          const Divider(height: 1.0),
          Container(
            decoration: BoxDecoration(color: Theme.of(context).cardColor),
            child: _buildTextComposer(),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildTextComposer() {
    return IconTheme(
      data: IconThemeData(color: Theme.of(context).colorScheme.secondary),
      child: Container(
        margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 8.0),
        child: Row(
          children: [
            Flexible(
              child: TextField(
                controller: _textController,
                onSubmitted: _handleSubmitted,
                decoration:
                    const InputDecoration.collapsed(hintText: 'Send a message'),
                focusNode: _focusNode,
              ),
            ),
            Container(
              margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 4.0),
              child: IconButton(
                  icon: const Icon(Icons.send),
                  onPressed: () => _handleSubmitted(_textController.text)),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

title: Failed to update ui::AXTree in accessiblility_bridge.cc(76)
body:
## Steps to Reproduce
Running a relatively simple Windows app example, I'm getting repeated accessibility bridge errors. They aren't fatal to the app (but maybe to accessibility itself, I don't know). 

App example is here: 
https://github.com/timsneath/win32_gamepad/tree/b4c96b699e562424203117515eb2ea3991da9bba/example/inspector

## Error
```
Restarted application in 373ms.
[ERROR:accessibility_bridge.cc(76)] Failed to update ui::AXTree, error: Node 29 is not marked for destruction, would be reparented to 3

title: CircularProgressIndicator draws outside the parent constraints
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Draw a CircularProgressIndicator inside a rect

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22373191/154630323-0a6fc98a-a61f-4a60-9425-5cb0dbc0d81d.png)

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Outerbound of the Circle to be inside the rect

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

https://dartpad.dev/ff216dcfc7e84112b7e3267a2807d298

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(
      height: 100,
      width: 100,
      color: Colors.yellow,
      child: CircularProgressIndicator(
        color: Colors.red,
        value: 1,
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
This also creates further complications when trying to draw customshaders since the rect doesnt completely cover the progressIndicator
comments:
Hi @Hari-07, Thanks for filing the issue. I am able to reproduce the issue on all platforms (Android/IOS/Web/Desktop), The circular indicator is painted slightly outside the container from all sides. 

Android             |  IOS
:-------------------------:|:-------------------------:
![flutter_01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/154670961-50d02029-a3c3-4077-9f89-dc72fc4c3bce.png) | ![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone 12 Pro - 2022-02-18 at 16 36 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/154671247-dc2354fd-f517-4126-a1ca-899963b179b3.png)

This is reproducible on stable and the master channel.

<details>
<summary>code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Navigation Basics',
      home: FirstRoute(),
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
    );
  }
}

class FirstRoute extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          toolbarHeight: 30,
          title: Text('First Route'),
          elevation: 0,
        ),
        body: MyWidget());
  }
}

class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Center(
      child: Container(
        height: 100,
        width: 100,
        color: Colors.yellow,
        child: const CircularProgressIndicator(
          color: Colors.red,
          value: 1,
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```
</details>

Column(

title: [camera] cache from imageStream causing invalid data
body:
Hi there,

i'm implement barcode/qr scanner using camera, 
which using imageStream and result from that will parse using google ml kit

but sometimes when i just opened the camera preview screen, after repetitive open and scan the qr,
it will use data image from previous imageStream

thought it was imageStream cache or memory management issue,
tested it using google pixel 3 on android 12,
but rarely on ios device

has anyone experienced this too?

and can we limit streamImage frame to avoid high memory usage ?

i create a repo to reproduce the issue
[https://github.com/myoganugraha/reproduce_imagestream_cache](https://github.com/myoganugraha/reproduce_imagestream_cache)

comments:
@myoganugraha 
Based on the description, I think you are hitting https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/88173 and also looks similar to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/60409.

Also, to confirm whether you have properly implemented `imageStream` or not, check this open issue and underlying comments and based on it, see if your implementation is missing anything or not. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/26348

With that, I am going ahead and closing this as duplicate fo above two linked issues. You can follow-up in it and share your current findings in those for better tracking.
If you disagree or think this is a separate issue other than what I linked, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

title: Customized Icon is black and cannot be changed it's size
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->
### I've already upload this simple project to my github repo
[Link to my repo](https://github.com/phungchiminhquang/Flutter_mapScreen)
1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample
2. Press on "right arrow" button you will see a black square at the mark location

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I want to see a marker like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58564617/154276184-c8bfd3b4-da6a-425b-80fe-7a8d7c8686c9.png)

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58564617/154276811-b69666c3-4286-4ac3-a96e-31eb6f816573.png)

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';

class MapScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const MapScreen({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  _MapScreenState createState() => _MapScreenState();
}

class _MapScreenState extends State<MapScreen> {
  Set<Marker> _marker = {};
  GoogleMapController? controller;
  BitmapDescriptor? _markerIcon;
  void onMapCreated() {
    setState(() {
      _marker.add(Marker(
          markerId: MarkerId("test"),
          position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
          icon: _markerIcon!));
    });
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    _createMarkerImageFromAsset(context);
    return Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          title: Text("Map Screen"),
        ),
        body: GoogleMap(
            onMapCreated: _onMapCreated,
            markers: <Marker>{_createMarker()},
            initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(
                target: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
                zoom: 15)));
  }

  Marker _createMarker() {
    if (_markerIcon != null) {
      return Marker(
        markerId: MarkerId("marker_1"),
        position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
        icon: _markerIcon!,
      );
    } else {
      return Marker(
        markerId: MarkerId("marker_1"),
        position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
      );
    }
  }

  Future<void> _createMarkerImageFromAsset(BuildContext context) async {
    if (_markerIcon == null) {
      final ImageConfiguration imageConfiguration =
          createLocalImageConfiguration(context, size: Size.square(10));
      BitmapDescriptor.fromAssetImage(
              imageConfiguration, 'assets/b.png')
          .then(_updateBitmap);
    }
  }

  void _updateBitmap(BitmapDescriptor bitmap) {
    setState(() {
      _markerIcon = bitmap;
    });
  }

  void _onMapCreated(GoogleMapController controllerParam) {
    setState(() {
      controller = controllerParam;
    });
  }
}
```

title: Flutter webview allow unique WKProcessPool
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
Android webview already share same localstorage. But not the ios webview.
We would shared local storage between multiple webview.
(We would keep the possibility to execute scripts to a specific webview).
<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
Use the WKProcessPool
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36332208/two-wkwebviews-share-local-storage-but-only-after-restart
<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->
comments:
This has been expressed in a different way before in an issue filed some time back. See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94591#issuecomment-985241204 for a similar comment. 

Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

If you disagree, kindly leave a comment below and I will repoen. 

Thank you

title: [iOS] After using Non-matching face the "Try Face ID again" button does nothing.
body:
Just like the title says, after presenting a non-matching face on iOS the user is presented with a dialog and the "Try Face ID Again" button doesn't do anything.

I'm guessing it wouldn't because it hasn't been setup that way ... Maybe this dialog could be customised or removed completely? I don't know.

![Screenshot 2022-02-15 at 17 22 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31341463/154104463-e2e6877a-7e34-4fd9-9832-be29bd5f15e4.png)
comments:
@carman247 
If you look at [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96390) similar issue, the actual result is that if FaceId is not recognized, it doesn't fallback on passcode, which it ideally should, but currently it seems to be showing `Face not recogized`. 

Do you get the `Face not recognized` error as well, or are you getting some other behavior ?
You can try the plugin example and see the behavior matches with the linked issue or not.

@darshankawar I'm using a simulator and I've just discovered that after tapping "Try Face ID Again" you have to select **Features > Face ID > Non-matching Face / Matching Face**. Only then does it try again. I imagine it happens instantly on a real device.

You're right though. It doesn't fallback on the passcode. However it did on one occasion after several attempts, but it wasn't automatic and I needed to call `localAuth.authenticate` again.

I'm not sure why it presented the passcode screen because it doesn't seem to be doing again.

I guess it's ok to close this issue as [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96390) is really the problem.

That being said, I think the sequence required to show the passcode screen while using a "simulator" is

**"Face ID" > Non-matching Face >  "Face Not Recognised" > Non-matching Face > Try Face ID Again > Non-matching Face > "Enter passcode for ..."**

Simply using "Non-matching face" after the "Face Not Recognised" message results in the "Face not recognised" error. You have to select it before AND aftre "Face Not Recognised" and then the passcode prompt is shown automatically.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: iOS: VoiceControl: Scroll down & scroll up commands are not working
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/

-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Clone [repository](https://github.com/lavinov-mercury/scroll_a11y_issue) or copy-paste example below
2. Enable VoiceControl (Settings -> Accessibility -> Voice Control) 
3. Run app
4. Say `Scroll down` or `Scroll Up`
5. Observe app's behavior

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
ListView scrolls when command recognized 

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Bubble with recognized command appears, however, app doesn't react

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemBuilder: (context, index) => ListTile(title: Text('Tile $index')),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

title: Color spaces in flutter
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
I released a photo sharing app, and some professional photographers have asked about offering a wider color space than sRGB. I wasn't able to find documentation anywhere about whether flutter supports wider color spaces when displaying images, and if so, how to use those color spaces.

I'm assuming that simply displaying images through an `ImageProvider` uses the sRGB color space, though I could be wrong on this - if so please clarify. 

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
Provide some way to display images through a different color space such as Adobe RGB or ProPhoto RGB. If this doesn't yet exist in flutter, this is probably quite a large amount of work to implement correctly based on my limited knowledge of color spaces. 

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->
comments:
Just use any `ImageProvider` object to display an image. For example, try `FileImage(image)`. This shows the image rendered with sRGB, as per your link.

I did suggest what kinds of color spaces would ideally be made available - Adobe RGB or ProPhoto RGB.

There aren't really any code samples I can give...this is as simple as it gets with regards to an explanation of the potential feature.

These aren't what I'm looking for.

These packages provide a way to convert between color space *representations* using colors other than red, green, blue. But they have nothing to do with how wide the space itself actually is.
Please check [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/55092) issue and see if it's related / similar to your use case.
That issue is what I was looking for. But it seems its been open for a year and a half? Is it being worked on?

It has P4 priority label. You can check here what each priority label means and to get an idea as how Flutter approaches these type of labels. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Issue-hygiene#priorities

With that said, I am going ahead and closing this as a duplicate. Please follow-up in it for further updates.

title: Issue with background isolate when obfuscating Android APK / AppBundle
body:
The background message arrives when `obfuscate` flag is not used. Seems like this is some kind of issue related to background isolate when obfuscating code.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Clone the project from `https://github.com/sarbagyastha/obfuscate`
2. Generate an APK with `flutter build apk --release --verbose --obfuscate --split-debug-info=test/symbols` 
3. Put the app in background.
3. Grab the push token from console and send push notification with following payload:
```json
{
    "data": {
        "title": "Test Title",
        "body": "Test Body",
        "type": "promotion"
    },
    "mutable_content": true,
    "content_available": true,
    "priority": "high",
    "registration_ids": [
        "<push-token>"
    ]
}
```

**Expected results:** 
We should see a `Push Message` payload in console for the background message.

**Actual results:**
We see nothing but, these logs.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9782008/154009387-ba1ebc9c-9b09-4d2f-a9d3-695a9aa2bfbb.png)

@sarbagyastha 
In that case, can you provide a minimal code sample without plugin that we can simply run and verify this behavior ?

Using the app clone provided and and obfuscating the android apk using `flutter build apk --release --verbose --obfuscate --split-debug-info=test/symbols` and then trying to push a notification when app is in background does show the same behavior as reported and see below:

title: Flutter integration_test: Support to simulate mouse operation like right/scroll/left clicks
body:
Implementing some integration_test for flutter-web application wherein I'm trying to simulate mouse operation like right/scroll/left clicks?

After much googling tried with the below code, seems to be like TestPointer doesn't have click operation:
`
final TestPointer testPointer = TestPointer(1, PointerDeviceKind.mouse); 
  await tester.sendEventToBinding(testPointer.hover());`
Please correct me if am missing something or any suggestion or docs reference would help?
comments:
@rajeshpatil95 
Check this similar open issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/61871 I think the mouse operations also don't seem to be supported yet for widgetTests. 
Also see below similar issues for your reference:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/80857
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/60061

So please follow-up in above issue for further updates. Closing this as a duplicate.

title: [in_app_purchase] is there any way to check if someone refunded a non-consumable item?
body:
Currently having an issue:
- User buys a non-consumable item
- I mark it as bought in my system (in this case, removing ads)
- User refunds it
- It is still marked as bought and there is no obvious way to check a purchase history or refund status

Due to how purchase info is sent via [purchaseStream](https://pub.dev/documentation/in_app_purchase/latest/in_app_purchase/InAppPurchase/purchaseStream.html) there is no obvious way to check what purchases a user has made and possibly refunded. `restorePurchases` causes nothing to be piped into the stream. [purchaseStatus](https://pub.dev/documentation/in_app_purchase_platform_interface/latest/in_app_purchase_platform_interface/PurchaseStatus.html) does not have a value for refunded.
comments:
@MilesAdamson 
Is this on Android or iOS ?

Regarding `restorePurchases` not returning anything, there's an issue for tracking the same for iOS: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98113, whereas the same seems to be working for Android.

Also check this open issue to add refund functionality for iOS and see if your case is same as it: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95404

This is iOS so likely a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98113, thanks for the response. I very much need a way to check if a purchase has been refunded because users can abuse the fact that refunding the purchase does not un-do what it gives
