title: app window cannot respond after display a few minutes lottie animation on Windows 7 service pack 1.
body:
On windows 7 Service pack 1, after displaying the gif/lottie animation for a few minutes, the app window becomes a black screen and cannot respond. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample 2. run with release on window 7. 3. Wait a few minutes (about 3 minutes in my virtual machine) **Expected results:** Animation works fine. **Actual results:** Animation stopped, and move the mouse pointer up and the window will turn black.
Code sample need add `lottie: ^1.2.1` to pubspec deps. ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:lottie/lottie.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); // This widget is the root of your application. @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: 'Flutter Demo', home: Scaffold( body: Wrap( children: [ Lottie.network( 'https://mixin-assets.zeromesh.net/stickers/5eedde22-0434-46d5-87ff-65d8ba612c67/covers/5eedde22-0434-46d5-87ff-65d8ba612c67.json', width: 100, height: 100, ), Lottie.network( 'https://mixin-assets.zeromesh.net/stickers/6a51ed77-27b8-4550-87aa-35fec3838641/covers/6a51ed77-27b8-4550-87aa-35fec3838641.json', width: 100, height: 100, ), ], ), ), ); } } ```
Logs ``` ``` ``` ``` ``` Flutter 2.11.0-0.0.pre.541 • channel master • https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git Framework • revision ad612b59e5 (3 hours ago) • 2022-02-13 17:20:18 -0800 Engine • revision cef6370095 Tools • Dart 2.17.0 (build 2.17.0-104.0.dev) • DevTools 2.10.0 ```
comments:
@boyan01 
Since `lottie` is a 3rd party plugin, can you try the same using this https://docs.flutter.dev/cookbook/images/network-image example and see if you still get same behavior with it too ?

Actually displaying Gif with `Image` Widget will have the same error. It's just that the time it takes for this to happen with Lottie is shorter, and it's also a problem when displaying multiple Gifs for a long time.

Actually, there's similar open issue describing your case, https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92571
Please follow-up in it for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate.

title: Icon shows Emoji instead
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Add `Icon(Icons.handshake)` or `Icon(Icons.handshake_rounded)` to any project.
2. `flutter run`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The [handshake icon](https://fonts.google.com/icons?selected=Material%20Icons%3Ahandshake%3A) should be shown.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Unrelated Emojis (like that [bathtub guy](https://emojipedia.org/raised-back-of-hand/)) are shown instead.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const Scaffold(
        body: Icon(Icons.handshake),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
</details>

Clearing the pub cache or browser cache doesn't help here.

@IConnC
 
This was a known issue that has since been fixed. The initial report was in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060.

The fix is available on the master channel but unfortunately, it hasn't rolled out to stable yet. Check this issue comment for your reference: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060#issuecomment-1018801980

I'm going to close this since it has already been fixed.

Thank you

title: Upgrade gradle version ?
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Google Mobile Ads for Flutter!

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     the Flutter's team guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

When running flutter create, Android use the following version of gradle : 
```
com.android.tools.build:gradle:4.1.0'
```

Why Flutter didn't use a more recent version ?

## Proposal

Use a recent version.
https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/gradle-plugin
<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like the `google_mobile_ads` plugin to be able to do.

     Consider attaching images showing what you are imagining.

     Does this have to be provided by the plugin directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

## Limitation

Is their any reasons to keep this old version ? Can we gain some performance and reduce production issue/crash with this ?
comments:
I think using old gradle version gives more bugs. 
As mentioned here [#googleads](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-flutter/issues/471)
Upgrading to later versions actually fixes the bugs on some devices.
Closing this as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92073

```dart
import 'dart:async';
import 'dart:io';

import 'package:android_intent/android_intent.dart';
import 'package:flutter/foundation.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:provider/provider.dart';
import 'package:router_annotation/router_annotation.dart' as rca;
import 'package:url_launcher/url_launcher.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/platform_interface.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';
import 'package:words/component/material_generator.dart';
import 'package:words/component/status_view.dart';
import 'package:words/flavor/sketch.dart';
import 'package:words/pages/web/web_model.dart';

part 'web_page.g.dart';

@rca.Page(
  name: '网页',
  routeName: '/web',
)
class WebPage extends StatefulWidget {
  const WebPage({
    Key? key,
    this.stickyTitle,
    required this.visitUrl,
    this.injectJS,
  }) : super(key: key);

  final String? stickyTitle;
  final String visitUrl;
  final String? injectJS;

  @override
  State<StatefulWidget> createState() {
    return _WebPageState();
  }
}

class _WebPageState extends State<WebPage> {
  Route<dynamic>? _route;
  WebViewController? _controller;

  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
    // if (Platform.isAndroid) {
    //   WebView.platform = SurfaceAndroidWebView();
    // }
  }

  @override
  void didChangeDependencies() {
    super.didChangeDependencies();
    _route ??= ModalRoute.of(context);
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return ChangeNotifierProvider<WebModel>(
      create: (BuildContext context) => WebModel(),
      child: Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          leading: IconTheme(
            data: IconTheme.of(context).copyWith(color: Sketch.primaryTextColor),
            child: createImplyLeading(),
          ),
          title: Selector<WebModel, String?>(
            selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => widget.stickyTitle ?? model.title,
            builder: (BuildContext context, String? title, Widget? child) {
              return Text(title ?? '', style: TextStyle(color: Sketch.primaryTextColor), overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis, maxLines: 1);
            },
          ),
          backgroundColor: Colors.white,
        ),
        body: Stack(
          fit: StackFit.expand,
          children: <Widget>[
            Builder(
              builder: (BuildContext context) {
                return WebView(
                  onWebViewCreated: (WebViewController controller) {
                    _controller = controller;
                    _loadInitialUrl();
                  },
                  // initialUrl: widget.visitUrl,
                  javascriptMode: JavascriptMode.unrestricted,
                  javascriptChannels: <JavascriptChannel>{
                    JavascriptChannel(
                      name: 'DevTools',
                      onMessageReceived: (JavascriptMessage message) {
                        if (kDebugMode) {
                          print(message.message);
                        }
                      },
                    ),
                  },
                  navigationDelegate: _navigationDelegate,
                  onPageStarted: (String url) {
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onPageStarted: $url');
                    }
                    WebModel.of(context).apply(
                      title: '',
                      isLoading: true,
                      isError: false,
                    );
                  },
                  onPageFinished: (String url) {
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onPageFinished: $url');
                    }
                    if (widget.injectJS?.isNotEmpty ?? false) {
                      _controller?.runJavascript(widget.injectJS!);
                    }
                    final WebModel model = WebModel.of(context);
                    if (!model.isError) {
                      _handleTitleManyTimes(model);
                    }
                    _checkNavigationControls(model);
                    model.apply(
                      isLoading: false,
                    );
                  },
                  onWebResourceError: (WebResourceError error) async {
                    final WebModel model = WebModel.of(context);
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onWebResourceError: ${error.errorCode} - ${error.description} - ${error.domain} - ${error.errorType} - ${error.failingUrl} - ${await _controller?.currentUrl()}');
                    }
                    unawaited(_checkNavigationControls(model));
                    // if (error.errorType == WebResourceErrorType.unsupportedScheme) {
                    //   return;
                    // }
                    if (error.failingUrl == await _controller?.currentUrl()) {
                      model.apply(
                        title: '',
                        isLoading: Platform.isIOS ? false : null,
                        isError: true,
                      );
                    }
                  },
                  gestureNavigationEnabled: Platform.isIOS,
                );
              },
            ),
            Selector<WebModel, bool>(
              selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isError,
              builder: (BuildContext context, bool isError, Widget? child) {
                return isError
                    ? Material(
                        color: Colors.white,
                        child: StatusError(
                          onRetry: () {
                            _reload(WebModel.of(context));
                          },
                        ),
                      )
                    : SizedBox();
              },
            ),
            Selector<WebModel, bool>(
              selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isLoading,
              builder: (BuildContext context, bool isLoading, Widget? child) {
                return isLoading
                    ? Material(
                        color: Colors.white,
                        child: StatusLoading(),
                      )
                    : SizedBox();
              },
            ),
          ],
        ),
        bottomNavigationBar: _buildNavigationControls(),
        backgroundColor: Colors.white,
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildNavigationControls() {
    return createBottomAppBar(
      color: Colors.white,
      child: SizedBox(
        height: Sketch.kBottomBarHeight,
        child: Row(
          children: <Widget>[
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => !model.isLoading && model.canGoBack,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool canGoBack, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: canGoBack
                        ? () {
                            _goBack(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.arrow_back_ios, color: canGoBack ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => !model.isLoading && model.canGoForward,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool canGoForward, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: canGoForward
                        ? () {
                            _goForward(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.arrow_forward_ios, color: canGoForward ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isLoading,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool isLoading, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: !isLoading
                        ? () {
                            _reload(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.replay, color: !isLoading ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Future<void>? _loadInitialUrl() {
    return _controller?.loadUrl(widget.visitUrl);
  }

  NavigationDecision _navigationDelegate(NavigationRequest request) {
    if (request.url.startsWith('tel:')) {
      _handleLaunchDial(request);
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    if (request.url.startsWith('sms:')) {
      _handleLaunchSendto(request);
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    if (!Uri.parse(request.url).isScheme('http') && !Uri.parse(request.url).isScheme('https')) {
      if (kDebugMode) {
        print('request_url: ${request.isForMainFrame} - ${request.url}');
      }
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    return NavigationDecision.navigate;
  }

  Future<void> _handleLaunchDial(NavigationRequest request) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      final AndroidIntent intent = AndroidIntent(
        action: 'android.intent.action.DIAL',
        data: request.url,
      );
      if (await intent.canResolveActivity()) {
        await intent.launch();
      }
    } else if (Platform.isIOS) {
      if (await canLaunch(request.url)) {
        unawaited(launch(request.url));
      }
    }
  }

  Future<void> _handleLaunchSendto(NavigationRequest request) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      final AndroidIntent intent = AndroidIntent(
        action: 'android.intent.action.SENDTO',
        data: request.url,
      );
      if (await intent.canResolveActivity()) {
        await intent.launch();
      }
    } else if (Platform.isIOS) {
      if (await canLaunch(request.url)) {
        unawaited(launch(request.url));
      }
    }
  }

  Future<void> _handleTitleManyTimes(WebModel model) async {
    await _handleTitle(model);
    await Future<void>.delayed(Duration(milliseconds: 300));
    await _handleTitle(model);
  }

  Future<void> _handleTitle(WebModel model) async {
    if (_route?.isActive ?? false) {
      final String? title = await _controller?.getTitle();
      model.apply(title: title);
    }
  }

  Future<void> _checkNavigationControls(WebModel model) async {
    final bool? canGoBack = await _controller?.canGoBack();
    final bool? canGoForward = await _controller?.canGoForward();
    model.apply(
      canGoBack: canGoBack,
      canGoForward: canGoForward,
    );
  }

  Future<void> _reload(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    final String? currentUrl = await _controller?.currentUrl();
    if (currentUrl?.isEmpty ?? true) {
      await _loadInitialUrl();
      return;
    }
    await _controller?.reload();
  }

  Future<void> _goBack(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    await _controller?.goBack();
  }

  Future<void> _goForward(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    await _controller?.goForward();
  }
}
```

// GENERATED CODE - DO NOT MODIFY BY HAND

part of 'web_page.dart';

// **************************************************************************
// PageCompilerGenerator
// **************************************************************************

class WebPageController {
  String get name => WebPageProvider.name;

  String get routeName => WebPageProvider.routeName;

  WidgetBuilder get routeBuilder => WebPageProvider.routeBuilder;

  String? get flavor => WebPageProvider.flavor;

  @override
  dynamic noSuchMethod(Invocation invocation) {
    if (invocation.isGetter) {
      switch (invocation.memberName) {
        case #name:
          return name;
        case #routeName:
          return routeName;
        case #routeBuilder:
          return routeBuilder;
        case #flavor:
          return flavor;
      }
    }
    return super.noSuchMethod(invocation);
  }
}

class WebPageProvider {
  const WebPageProvider._();

  static const String? flavor = null;

  static const String name = '网页';

  static const String routeName = '/web';

  static final WidgetBuilder routeBuilder = (BuildContext context) {
    final Map<String, dynamic>? arguments =
        ModalRoute.of(context)!.settings.arguments as Map<String, dynamic>?;
    return WebPage(
      key: arguments?['key'] as Key?,
      stickyTitle: arguments?['sticky_title'] as String?,
      visitUrl: arguments?['visit_url'] as String,
      injectJS: arguments?['inject_j_s'] as String?,
    );
  };

  static Map<String, dynamic> routeArgument({
    Key? key,
    String? stickyTitle,
    required String visitUrl,
    String? injectJS,
  }) {
    return <String, dynamic>{
      'key': key,
      'sticky_title': stickyTitle,
      'visit_url': visitUrl,
      'inject_j_s': injectJS,
    };
  }

  static Future<T?> pushByNamed<T extends Object?>(
    BuildContext context, {
    Key? key,
    String? stickyTitle,
    required String visitUrl,
    String? injectJS,
  }) {
    return Navigator.of(context).pushNamed(
      routeName,
      arguments: <String, dynamic>{
        'key': key,
        'sticky_title': stickyTitle,
        'visit_url': visitUrl,
        'inject_j_s': injectJS,
      },
    );
  }
}
```

```dart
import 'package:flutter/widgets.dart';
import 'package:provider/provider.dart';
import 'package:words/widgets/change_notifier.dart';

class WebModel with ChangeNotifier, SafetyChangeNotifier {
  String? _title;
  bool _isLoading = true;
  bool _isError = false;
  bool _canGoBack = false;
  bool _canGoForward = false;

  String? get title => _title;

  bool get isLoading => _isLoading;

  bool get isError => _isError;

  bool get canGoBack => _canGoBack;

  bool get canGoForward => _canGoForward;

  void apply({
    String? title,
    bool? isLoading,
    bool? isError,
    bool? canGoBack,
    bool? canGoForward,
  }) {
    _title = title ?? _title;
    _isLoading = isLoading ?? _isLoading;
    _isError = isError ?? _isError;
    _canGoBack = canGoBack ?? _canGoBack;
    _canGoForward = canGoForward ?? _canGoForward;
    notifyListeners();
  }

  // ---

  static WebModel of(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider.of<WebModel>(context, listen: false);
  }
}

I've got this exact error message but with a different scenario. The problems seems to be with multiple platform views from what I can tell. Saw the same issue here: [Link](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-flutter/issues/512)

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

2. Navigate to a page with a Google Map on it (  google_maps_flutter: ^2.1.1)

Sorry. No time to make a sample. Will do if requested.

title: Add flutter.minSdkVersion to local.properties
body:
Some packages are relying on a value to be set either in local.properties or in build.gradle for the minSdk. With the newer releases of flutter this property is now  `flutter.minSdkVersion` in `build.gradle` but does not figure in local.properties.

Adding that value there would make it easier to know which value flutter is using for those packages. Also it wouldn't require the user to explicitly overwrite it so the package can know the value by reading local.properties.
comments:
Hi @cedvdb, there's a similar issue reported in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95533 and there's a PR in flight to address this in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/95684. 

Kindly follow up in either of them for more information.

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

Hi @verkit, Thanks for filing the issue. I verified using the latest  `camera: ^0.9.4+11` plugin, and I was not able to reproduce the issue. 

> [ +167 ms] D/CameraCaptureCallback(32199): CameraCaptureCallback | state: STATE_CAPTURING | afState: 1 | aeState: 2

from your logs it looks like the `STATE_CAPTURING` is never completed which is the same issue as this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92973, Could you please share the android version of the other devices you mentioned " Realme, Samsung A02"

title: Black Screen When Flutter Open Translucent Activity
body:
Hey, I found an issue, when Flutter app open a translucent activity after that entry background and then  back to the foreground, the Flutter screen will have black screen.

Here is the [demo link](https://github.com/dotcink/flutter-black-screen-below-translucent-activity)

title: CalendarDatePicker should allow change the first day of the week
body:
missing setting for selecting first day of week.
And no, setting up localization for the app is not an acceptable solution when only this behavior in this control is the problem.
comments:
Hey @petrov-nikolay, here are some comments taken from https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/30051 which was closed:

> Material Design Date Picker depends on material localization, which takes care of the changing of the first week based on locale. (In Android native, there is a legacy Calendar option that has a parameter to set the custom first day of the week but the material design date picker doesn't depend on this). Overriding this manual will break the Calendar for other locales.

> If you don't need to take care of different locales, I would suggest using a third-party calendar that can provide this custom feature. Since third-party packages can implement custom features without material guidelines.

don't use locale changing param, just add an integer param to set first day of week and make it override the locale value if the param != null, it is in only 2 places in code, will solve the problem without breaking dependencies

title: Samsung keyboard does not show comma for number with decimals TextField
body:
Samsung keyboard shows disabled comma character and enabled dot character when using a `TextField` with `TextInputType.numberWithOptions(decimal: true)` keyboard type. In the Polish language, a comma is a correct decimal separator.

This issue looks like it's actually bug in Android or Samsung keyboard itself and it's not only for Polish language, those StackOverflow threads may suggest that (comments too):
* [Comma doesnt work on Samsung Android Keyboard](https://stackoverflow.com/q/65184373/3158312)
* [Decimal separator comma (',') with numberDecimal inputType in EditText](https://stackoverflow.com/q/3821539/3158312)

But just to be sure and have a record of such behavior I'm creating this issue.

<details><summary>Reproduction steps</summary>

Add `flutter_localizations` to dependencies in `pubspec.yaml`.

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter_localizations/flutter_localizations.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(
    const MaterialApp(
      locale: Locale('pl'),
      supportedLocales: [Locale('pl')],
      localizationsDelegates: GlobalMaterialLocalizations.delegates,
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Center(
          child: TextField(
            keyboardType: TextInputType.numberWithOptions(
              decimal: true,
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    ),
  );
}
```

</details>

<details><summary>Flutter doctor</summary>

```

[✓] Connected device (3 available)

![Screenshot_20220210-170155](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4085280/153446588-23067460-dad9-4584-b95a-bff707ba9b02.jpg)

@jalal-zy 
From the code you provided, you seem to be using `getx` package which is third party. In order to narrow down to framework issue, please provide only a [minimal complete reproducible code sample](https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example) without any 3rd party plugins that we can directly use and which replicates the behavior you are reporting.

Without additional information, we are unfortunately not sure how to resolve this issue. We are therefore reluctantly going to close this bug for now.
If you find this problem please file a new issue with the same description, what happens, logs and the output of 'flutter doctor -v'. All system setups can be slightly different so it's always better to open new issues and reference the related ones.
Thanks for your contribution.

title: App crash when using google_maps_flutter and webview_flutter
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->
This crash occurs on flutter 2.10.1 only on android (release + debug).
It does not occur on flutter 2.8.1 .


1. Execute `flutter run --debug` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2.  press next Page button
3. press app bar back button (left arrow button)
4. Crash!

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? --> Not crash

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? --> fatal app crash

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

Minimum reproducible example
```dart


import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';

void main() => runApp(const MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) =>
      const MaterialApp(home: Scaffold(body: FirstPage()));
}

class FirstPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const FirstPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) => Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text("first page (gmaps)")),
      body: Column(children: [
        const Expanded(
            child: GoogleMap(
                initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(target: LatLng(45, 25)))),
        OutlinedButton(
            onPressed: () => Navigator.of(context)
                .push(MaterialPageRoute(builder: (_) => const SecondPage())),
            child: const Text("next Page"))
      ]));
}

class SecondPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const SecondPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) => Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text("second page (webbrowser)")),
      body: const WebView(initialUrl: "http://www.google.com"));
}

```

pubspec.yaml
```yaml
name: flutter_dummytest
description: A new Flutter project.



publish_to: 'none' 
version: 1.0.0+1
environment:
  sdk: ">=2.15.1 <3.0.0"
dependencies:
  cupertino_icons: ^1.0.2
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  google_maps_flutter: ^2.1.1
  webview_flutter: ^3.0.0
dev_dependencies:
  flutter_lints: ^1.0.0
  flutter_test:
    sdk: flutter
flutter:
  uses-material-design: true
```

      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

-->



</details>

Run this code and try going to any stocks page and clicking on the export to excel button, it should show the download tab or download it, instead it does nothing in the flutter webview app

Show download tab or download the file

**Actual results:** 

Nothing, it goes to the link and refreshes the page, no download popup or file getting download

Hi @KaviHarjani, this is due to the fact that the `webview_flutter` plugin doesn't support downloads at the moment. 

There's an issue tracking this in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/39321. Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate.

title: Autofill not working on latest stable (2.10.0)
body:
Autofill is not working when using 2.10.0 (also didn't work for 2.8.x). This problem was also reported in another issue, but its still not solved although the issue was closed.

older issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94043
comments: Hi @mkranus, Thanks for filing the issue. Could you please share what target platform is not working?
@maheshmnj its not working on Android and iOS

Thanks for the info, AutoFill for Android is fixed on latest master see this discussion https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97633

IOS specific issue is being tracked here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/91354

Closing as the duplicate of the above-linked issues.

@maheshmnj I am facing a different issue. In my case the autofill completely does not work. It does not ask to save the fields, and also doesn't ask to fill the fields. And it also doesn't matter which field I focus on. It's the same as having autofill disabled. If I compile the same app with 2.5.3 is starts working like normal.

@mkranus,  AutoFill works on the master channel and is planned for a hotfix on stable 2.10.0 Please see this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97633#issuecomment-1033949522. I believe your issue should be fixed by this release.
@maheshmnj The iOS issue you attached earlier is different https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/91354. My problem is that it is completely not working.
@maheshmnj I tested the 2.10.1 release and it fixes the problem on iOS, but not on Android. This is weird, because I guess today's release was meant to fix it on Android?
@mkranus I do see that it has landed on `stable 2.10.1` https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Hotfixes-to-the-Stable-Channel. I will try to reproduce and update you on this.

@mkranus sorry for the delay I can confirm that autofill for Android works on `stable 2.10.2`, I verified with this  [code sample](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97633#issuecomment-1027853656).

title: Icons.sports_martial_arts_rounded shows Armenian flag.
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

* Create a new Flutter project in [dartpad.dev](https://dartpad.dev/) with this code:


```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(MaterialApp(
    home: Scaffold(
      body: Center(
        child: IconButton(
          iconSize: 200,
          icon: const Icon(Icons.sports_martial_arts_rounded),
          onPressed: () {}
        )
      )
    )
  ));
}

```

**Expected results:** 

![Expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54026120/153128906-905739ad-f50f-42ae-899a-50ba441610cb.png)

**Actual results:**

comments: i guess that's related when you switch from one channel to the other , if i were u , i would re-download the Flutter SDK again and try switching back and forth between channels to see if that problem still exists.
I switched from the master channel back to the stable channel, did ```flutter upgrade```, tested it, but the problem still persists.
It hapens on [dartpad.dev](https://dartpad.dev) too, so it's probably not just a problem with my system.

Hi @eliaxelang007, this is a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97767. 

> When I switched to the master channel, the problem disappeared.

title: Android Studio presence changes flutter toolchain
body:
Issue: Flutter uses the version of java bundled with android studio by default instead of the base system version, this is a problem because the android studio java (11) doesn't support `HmacPBESHA256 ` an algorithm used to sign builds when deploying for android. 

The only way to fix this currently is to remove android studio and develop with an alternative like `visual studio code` which is not sufficient as android studio is a much better IDE. 

## Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a flutter project and follow the steps here to signing the app https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#signing-the-app
 - Note: This issue originally started when trying to develop on a windows and mac machines where it wouldnt build development or release builds of our app due to the lack of the HmacPBESHA256 algorithm on JAVA 11.  When running `flutter build apk` or `flutter build appbundle` or `flutter install` on a physical device. the app would generate a stack error of this. 
```
Execution failed for task ':app:packageRelease'.
> A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.tasks.PackageAndroidArtifact$IncrementalSplitterRunnable
   > com.android.ide.common.signing.KeytoolException: Failed to read key upload from store "C:\Users\*\StudioProjects\*\*\app\upload-keystore.jks": Integrity check failed: java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: Algorithm HmacPBESHA256 not available
```
I followed the suggestion on stack overflow and changed the version of Java to Java 17, from the project structure page 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153084352-79d1f9a8-1636-4b4f-b9c4-1b3720bcf859.png)
and also from `gradle -version`, it says that it uses java 17
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153084590-59e2f2fc-fb36-409b-92e4-5ddf6143b9c8.png)
but i am unable to run `flutter build apk` and `flutter build appbundle` 
due to the same error 
```
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':app:packageRelease'.
> A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.tasks.PackageAndroidArtifact$IncrementalSplitterRunnable
   > com.android.ide.common.signing.KeytoolException: Failed to read key upload from store "C:\Users\**\StudioProjects\**\android\app\upload-keystore.jks": Integrity check failed: java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: Algorithm HmacPBESHA256 not available

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.

* Get more help at https://help.gradle.org

BUILD FAILED in 1m 34s
Running Gradle task 'assembleRelease'...                           95.2s
Gradle task assembleRelease failed with exit code 1
```
Flutter Doctor (note: android toolchain, uses java 11)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153085594-34ad1c6c-7832-45d3-95be-3b7c92feecd3.png)


I updated my enviroment variables for `JAVA_HOME` and `STUDIO_JDK` to my base java version and its unable to work 
```
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola> $Env:STUDIO_JDK
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-17.0.1
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola> $Env:JAVA_HOME
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-17.0.1
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola>
```
so i found the solution by:  **Uninstall Android Studio**

Flutter doctor - without android studio installed, (it uses java 17 instead of 11)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153087624-553025c7-1b44-4456-b523-a9632fabb564.png)

after uninstalling android studio, I am now able to run and build my app with the system version of java. 
I am unable to build my app for android or install on host devices due to the fact that Flutter will choose the java version bundled with android studio over the one installed on the base system. i have had this issue with mac and windows machine and the current solution for this seems to be uninstalling android studio.

if you reinstall android studio, the same issue comes back and you are unable to get any work done. Unfortunately android studio is a much better ide for flutter than visual studio code. so i am providing this issue with the hopes that it gets fixed. 


<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

- create a simple flutter project
- follow the guide here to sign the app https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#signing-the-app
- modify `android/app/build.gradle` to utilize the keytool 
```
signingConfigs {
        release {
            keyAlias keystoreProperties['keyAlias']
            keyPassword keystoreProperties['keyPassword']
            storeFile keystoreProperties['storeFile'] ? file(keystoreProperties['storeFile']) : null
            storePassword keystoreProperties['storePassword']
        }
    }
    buildTypes {
        release {
            minifyEnabled true
            shrinkResources true
            signingConfig signingConfigs.release
        }
    }
```
- try and build the app.
</details>
comments:
@VictorXLR 
Check [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67631927/error-building-aab-flutter-android-integrity-check-failed-java-security-n) SO link and underlying comments and see if any of them help to resolve this issue.

Also, there's similar open issue reported in flutter/website repo, since the instructions were followed using the steps mentioned in it: https://github.com/flutter/website/issues/5871. Check underlying comments from it to see if they help.

Closing from here, since it may be related to Android Studio itself and not with Flutter framework. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

Hi,

I have been on that SO page multiple times and setting my java version in gradle.properties to my system path didnt help,
I already have my keytool signed with the `-storetype jks` arguement too. I use `jetbrains toolbox` on my mac and desktop and i am running on the latest version of android studio `bumblebee patch 1` 

 the problem isn't with android studio but with flutter as `flutter doctor -v` will use the version of java bundled with android studio instead of the base system one. 

The only way i am able to fix it is for me to uninstall android studio entirely, no matter how many times i try to build my app bundle with android studio installed, it never worked until i removed android studio and then `flutter doctor -v` would use the system base java version over the one bundled with android studio.

Even with android studio closed and from the terminal and with `./gradlew -version` showing java 17, it will still use `java 11` from android studio over anything else. I updated my environment variables in my initial issue message and it didn't work.


I provided screenshots of my flutter doctor with android studio installed and not installed in my initial message to show the difference
I same issues
Hi, can you open this, its not a duplicate

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: -ios-signing-cert
body:
2 days wasted at trying to fix and find why flutter is picking up the wrong signing certificate. I have tried everything I could find on this not documented bug.

flutter config --clear-ios-signing-cert does clear anything

flutter channel master
flutter upgrade
flutter clean
flutter build ios

Doesn't do much, we get beautiful lines of terminal but after that not much.

Done my things directly in Xcode which by the way showed exactly the signing id it needed (back then). But Flutter knows better what to use to fail.

I have done multiple more trials at random things. Nothing works...

I even deleted all my certificates via 'security find-identity -p codesigning -v' and re-added only the one I wanted it still downloads a wrong one and set the project to it.

Still seaarching where is this file vim ~/.flutter_settings
To finally put:
{
  "ios-signing-cert": "Apple Development: stupidmoron@gmail.com (XXXXXXXX)",
  "enable-macos-desktop": false
}

What to do?

Bin the project, empty and cry???

And what a performance system when you build in 480sec maybe don't brag about it...
comments:
After hours... Why plugging a different phone miraculously fixes the issue? This is non sense... When, even more, now, the Xcode project has the wrong identifier auto picked because the one I want is manually impossible to choose.

"fixes the issue" ... only for the new phone... So now deleting the app (just for fun, how didn't I try that before???) ... No success... Restarting the phone... (like the laptop a dozen times since the issue) but nah I'm still unable to use the phone I always been using for over 70 apps made with Xcode only what a waste of time!

@SwiftyFlow 
You seem to have shared lot of details but I can't still figure out from it, as what exactly is the issue you are reporting.

Also, please see the code of conduct: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#code-of-conduct when you report an issue or comment about it.

Coming back to your issue, in order to properly address it, please elaborate on what exactly the issue you are facing so that we can analyze it and help you on it.

I'd be glad to know what is the issue too... Even more when I arrive today, try to push onto the device I couldn't for days and now it works... After over 10 hours on that...

Problem: trying to use the same phone I've always used to test my app.
However 2 weeks into the project, all in the sudden Flutter picks another iOS signing certificate than the right one for the app
Impossible to alter this wrong signing picked by Flutter -> flutter config --clear-ios-signing-cert -> doesn't clear anything

Tried manually in Xcode: impossible too. Deleted all my certificates... Re added only the one I wanted, then a build bring bad ones back.

In the end, when having non matching signing certificate, one auto picked by Flutter and the other manually picked on Xcode, with another device it then works. Magically. No explanation. Re-try on the impossible phone, still impossible. Stop for the day. Restart the next, do absolutely nothing except adding 2 dependencies and now it works on the cursed phone. And it now re auto pick the right signing certificate. This is proper non-sense.

English is not my first language it just comes out like that.... Sorry...

After all that, one clue is that I installed cached_network_image: ^3.2.0 run pub get then miss run on Mac then it was impossible to use the phone. Even tried to remove cached_network_image: ^3.2.0 but it didn't help. Bringing that up as today the only thing done was to install flutter_email_sender: ^5.0.2 & csv: ^5.0.1 which therefore re run pub get and solved (under me) all my problems (for now) I'm gonna sneeze and it will be over hahaha
I went to eat, big mistake now the cursed phone is unusable again. I was debugging/testing with it all morning... Why is it picking a wrong iOS signing certificate?

@SwiftyFlow 
From what I understand, the tool seems to be picking an old or wrong signing certificate. If so, check [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444) similar issue and see if it similar to your case.

Yes it is "the tool picking an old or wrong signing certificate". The forwarded similar issue is still open and it's been since 2019. The final fix purposed in this thread has been tried dozen of times already. Where as the other tricks: again 'flutter config --clear-ios-signing-cert' does clear anything at all, this 'To remove a setting, configure it to an empty string' when I do It re-picks the wrong one after and the direct Xcode signing team trick does not work.

Please follow-up in the original issue for further updates. It has P4 priority, meaning a bug and will be fixed per Flutter's bug fix policy.
Closing this as a duplicate.
@SwiftyFlow can you update https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444 with your findings? That one stalled because I saw the issue once and then never saw it again, I couldn't reproduce it.

Sadly I cannot tell what happened... I simply gave up on using the cursed device. Worked a bit more on my project, therefore I needed a few more pub.dev packages and after adding some the cursed device appeared to work again. If I remember right I also made sure that the pubspec.yaml has the dependencies cleared of comment and all grouped together as follow (note the indentation is wrong when pasted here and the # are now // because of the style modification on lines starting with #)


```yaml
environment:
  sdk: ">=2.15.1 <3.0.0"

// Dependencies specify other packages that your package needs in order to work.
// To automatically upgrade your package dependencies to the latest versions
// consider running `flutter pub upgrade --major-versions`. Alternatively,
// dependencies can be manually updated by changing the version numbers below to
// the latest version available on pub.dev. To see which dependencies have newer
// versions available, run `flutter pub outdated`.
dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  intl: ^0.17.0
  transparent_image: ^2.0.0
  cached_network_image: ^3.2.0
  shared_preferences: ^2.0.12
  firebase_core : ^1.12.0
  cupertino_icons: ^1.0.4
  cloud_firestore: ^3.1.7
  firebase_auth: ^3.3.6
  image_picker: ^0.8.4+5
  firebase_storage: ^10.2.6
  firebase_messaging: ^11.2.6
  sqflite: ^2.0.2
  package_info_plus: ^1.3.0
  flutter_email_sender: ^5.0.2
  csv: ^5.0.1
  provider: ^6.0.2
  path_provider: ^2.0.8
  shake: ^2.0.0
  material_segmented_control: ^3.1.2

dev_dependencies:
  flutter_test:
    sdk: flutter
 
  // The "flutter_lints" package below contains a set of recommended lints to
  // encourage good coding practices. The lint set provided by the package is
  // activated in the `analysis_options.yaml` file located at the root of your
  // package. See that file for information about deactivating specific lint
  // rules and activating additional ones.
  flutter_lints: ^1.0.0
  flutter_launcher_icons: ^0.9.2
```
i am facing the same issue when running app using flutter run command its picking the other certificate instead of which i applied in the Xcode.

@justjcool then can _you_ update https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444 with your findings? That one stalled because I saw the issue once and then never saw it again, I couldn't reproduce it.

@justjcool (couldnt signin as swiftyflow) the only thing I can advise you is to forget the device you want to push to. Keep working on your project via simulator (I know a pain if camera or push testing) but you’ll  end up adding one more dependecy in pubspec and it will all magically work again. In parallel double check your indentations in pubspec and make sure you group the dependencies (ie no green comment in between)

...but before you apply any workarounds please give us the requested output in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444#issuecomment-1039410544 so we can fix the issue for everyone without needing workarounds.
I wish I knew more

Got it just now! It's definitely due to this crap pubspec.yaml file. I still haven't figured exactly what is causing it but just now I had declared my assets as:

assets:
    - lib/assets/


To give me all from 'assets' folder yet the app wasn't finding what's inside the 'vehicles' subfolder so I tried to add it in there:

assets:
    - lib/assets/
    - lib/assets/vehicles/


But then I can't run my app on device because it appear that I still have the example signing (which is not true)

Remove - lib/assets/vehicles back to normal

If anyone knows what's up? Indentation? Repetition? it was 12:18? and it's cloudy...?

This is a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444, please make all updates there.  Particularly, we need the output requested in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/43444#issuecomment-1039410544 to make progress.  Locking.

title: TextSelection toolbar should be hidden when scrolled
body:
## Use case

Provide more native-like features on text selection toolbar

## Proposal

Toolbar for text selection should be hidden when text field is scrolled.
Please check videos below, how native application works.

**Native Android (record from YouTube)**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16171447/152736726-7f70be09-9bab-4ba2-8556-0dace92992b5.mov

**Native iOS (record from default Calendar app)**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16171447/152736772-51fb7d23-bb0e-4eaf-9a3c-3669b9df0135.mov


**How Flutter works now**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16171447/152736923-5ce971c1-34ec-445c-9cc8-789ec4d8b892.mov

title: [google_maps_flutter] (web) The GoogleMap widget is always on top.
body:
The GoogleMap widget is always on top.
I have tried to use stack, dialog, and IgnorePointer to block any action of the GoogleMaps but it's not working.
I think it is a bug. I can't play this with any widget. I am using the onTab of the GoogleMap to show the GoogleMap picker, when I click dialog, dropdown menu, the container in the stack, or icon button in the area of GooleMap, the GoogleMap will action it too or I click the icon button in the same position of pin location of GoogleMap, the GoogleMap will action by show info of this location.

In my opinion. I think it is a bug. The GoogleMap should be a general widget that can be used in a variety of ways.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
You can find this issue in my video.
1. The Inkwell on a GoogleMap to show the GoogleMap picker.
At 9 seconds, I click at the pin of the location. 
After I closed the dialog, the info will show at 16 seconds. 
I already used Inkwell but GoogleMap is still active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152727927-e122bbeb-0f00-4af6-99b4-ea7d6ad2ae76.mp4

2. The IconButton with The Stack on the GoogleMap.
At 5 seconds, I click the IconButton on the blank area and the map will move to my location. 
At 15 seconds, I click the IconButton on the pin location. After this, the map will move to my location and move again to this pin location.
I already used the Stack and the IconButton is on the GoogleMap but the GoogleMap still active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152728378-ce077e9a-0ea5-4d47-a454-22e65aba69eb.mp4

3. The Dropdown Menu on GoogleMap.
At 17 seconds, I click the menu of the Dropdown on GoogleMap, and the GooleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152728702-3fd9021e-8899-43f0-88f5-aeeb0b5e832a.mp4

4. The DatePicker on GoogleMap.
At 17 seconds, I click the DatePicker on GoogleMap, and the GooleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152729043-f7122316-a626-4e9f-b2b2-90a91370aaea.mp4

5. The dialog with the context on The GoogleMap.
At 8 seconds, I click the dialog on GoogleMap, and The GooleMap is active.
At 20 seconds, you can see the info of the pin location is active too. The function of GoogleMap for show info is under the dialog but it is still active.
At 28 seconds, you can see the zoom function of The GoogleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152729878-b7969c8c-a4a0-4cfc-a2dc-0312d3ddb3b5.mp4


-------------------------------------------------------------------------

I am using google_maps_flutter: ^2.1.1 and google_maps_flutter_web: ^0.3.2+1 package.

flutter doctor:
```
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[√] Flutter (Channel beta, 2.10.0-0.3.pre, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19042.1466], locale th-TH)
[√] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3)
[√] Chrome - develop for the web
[√] Android Studio (version 2020.3)
[√] VS Code (version 1.63.2)
[√] Connected device (2 available)
[√] HTTP Host Availability

• No issues found!
```

Now, I am using google map static API for my project.
But this solution is waste the internet to download the map picture and I need to create a custom button and function for Google Maps.
I hope the developer will solve this.

title: [integration_test] `reverFlutterImage` does not exist
body:
The integration bindings tells you to call `reverFlutterImage`, but `reverFlutterImage` does not exist.

It should either be added or, if the documentation is absolute, the line telling you to call it should be removed.
See: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/ba01ec8faae9a9be3cd90ee2b7357a803b7a7178/packages/integration_test/lib/integration_test.dart#L201

title: [Windows, Web] Hot Reload error and application connection
body:
## Steps to Reproduce
After I updated to Flutter 2.10 I can't run hot restart or hot reload, because it always throws the error (see log).
Also, Flutter doesn't keep my application attached for a long time, after a few minutes in the code editor, I go back to the terminal and see that Flutter has lost connection with device.

I only noticed this on Windows and Web, I haven't tested it on other platforms.
I think the problem is related to my copy of Flutter.

title: SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode Broken
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. run the code sample (on my phone :) )

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Full screen white

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
At the top, there is a black line in the size of exactly notification bar.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33402194/152657518-e4df35a9-8b53-439e-9ebb-cd1edd741b23.png)
If I pull the notification bar, the black bar disappears.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33402194/152657541-91abee16-617c-4c99-aec4-0450b3b56a0f.png)

The full screen mode works as expected in other apps on my phone.

The issue dissapears when I remove the line `SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode(SystemUiMode.immersive);`, or set it to `SystemUiMode.edgeToEdge` - both have the same effect.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter/services.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  State<MyApp> createState() => _MyAppState();
}

class _MyAppState extends State<MyApp> {
  @override
  void initState(){
    SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode(SystemUiMode.immersive);
    super.initState();
  } 

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(color: Colors.white,);
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--

title: Link moved on documentation
body:
In documentation at [8. Set up basic security rules](https://firebase.google.com/codelabs/firebase-get-to-know-flutter#7)
Paragraph 3 - Instruction 1. has a link. 

In the Firebase console's Develop section, click Database, and then select the Rules tab (or [click here](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/_/database/firestore/rules) to go directly to the Rules tab).

when you follow the link, popup message appears says : "Link moved, update your bookmarks"

title: [iOS]: App crashes after upgrading from 2.8 to 2.10 throwing `Flutter SkImageFilter::filterBounds(SkIRect const&, SkMatrix const&, SkImageFilter::MapDirection, SkIRect const*) const + 164 [        ] Flutter SkImageFilter::filterBounds:`
body:
Hi,

after switching from Flutter 2.8 to 2.10 my app crashes without warning. Switching back to 2.8 and the app runs fine again. Crash happens both in debug and prod (both on a physical iPhone 11).

I'm using ShaderMasks and ColorFilters (both mode and matrix) on an image. Tried to isolate the problem, but after trying for a few hours I have no clue where in the app the problem occurs. Therefore, I cannot post any code here.

**Expected results:**
App runs with 2.10 just like it did with 2.8.

**Actual results:**
App crashes immediately.

  <summary>Logs</summary>

```

Not sure if above logs would help to track down the cause of this issue, but per author, they can't provide a concrete reproducible code that throws this error and per their quote `I'm using ShaderMasks and ColorFilters (both mode and matrix) on an image.`, so labeling it for further investigation from the team.
/cc @jmagman @chinmaygarde
@knopp @jason-simmons Was this fixed by flutter/engine#30460, should it be hotfixed?
It seems like the same crash. It should be fixed by https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/30460.
I have the same problem after updating to latest Flutter version 2.10.
Closing a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95211.  I added a cherry-pick label for the fix to be considered in the next stable hotfix.
@darshankawar @jmagman  I don't know if this fix is supposed to be in 2.10.1, but I compiled with 2.10.1 and my problem persists with the same error.
It doesn't seem that 2.10.1 engine has the fix cherry-picked https://github.com/flutter/engine/commit/ab46186b246f5a36bd1f3f295d14a43abb1e2f38. @jmagman, any idea why?
This fix did not make it into 2.10.1 but is in the list of cherry picks for 2.10.2
@jason-simmons Any idea when 2.10.2 will be out?

Just ran my app with 2.10.2 and the error is gone :)
Thanks! Great job!

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

*Note: unmute the video for audio visual output*

<details>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  _MyHomePageState createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  Widget getScrollExample(int listSize, double width) {
    return SizedBox(
      width: width,
      height: 100,
      child: ListView.builder(
          shrinkWrap: true,
          scrollDirection: Axis.horizontal,
          itemCount: listSize,
          itemBuilder: (_, i) {
            return Row(
              children: [
                Container(
                  color: Colors.blue,
                  height: 100,
                  width: 100,
                  child: Text(
                    i.toString(),
                    semanticsLabel: 'Box $i',
                  ),
                ),
                const SizedBox(
                  width: 10,
                  height: 10,
                )
              ],
            );
          }),
    );
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final double width = MediaQuery.of(context).size.width;
    return Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
            title: const Text('Accessibility example'),
            actions: [IconButton(onPressed: () {}, icon: Icon(Icons.add))]),
        body: CustomScrollView(slivers: [
          SliverFillRemaining(
            hasScrollBody: false,
            child: Column(
              children: [
                const SizedBox(
                  width: 10,
                  height: 100,
                ),
                getScrollExample(6, width),
                const SizedBox(
                  width: 10,
                  height: 10,
                ),
                getScrollExample(6, width),
                ElevatedButton(onPressed: () {}, child: Text('Press me')),
                const Placeholder(
                  fallbackHeight: 200,
                  fallbackWidth: 300,
                  color: Colors.red,
                )
              ],
            ),
          ),
        ]));
  }
}

This appears to be an issue introduced somewhere between Flutter v1.22.6 and current. Running the same example on v1.22.6 seems to not have issues.

@timsneath @goderbauer @maheshmnj 
We found another (related?) breaking Accessibly issue #99300
seems to be a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/99300. and should probably be fixed at latest master. Closing this issue

title: FormatException: Unexpected extension byte (at offset 5)
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into. -->

1. Upgraded my flutter 2.8.x to 2.10
2. Flutter doctor throws error in Intellij Idea part
3. It prints **FormatException: Unexpected extension byte (at offset 5)**

See the logs

## Logs

<details>
<summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Include the full logs of the commands you are running between the lines
      with the backticks below. If you are running any "flutter" commands,
      please include the output of running them with "--verbose"; for example,
      the output of running "flutter --verbose create foo".
-->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18239859/152558305-5dce4f68-cccf-46b7-8496-147d81c73010.png)

<!-- If possible, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here. -->

```
[☠] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (the doctor check crashed)
    X Due to an error, the doctor check did not complete. If the error message below is not helpful, please let us know
      about this issue at https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues.
    X FormatException: Unexpected extension byte (at offset 5)
```

</details>
comments:
Through a process of elimination (by moving jar files to temp dirs), I found the exception occurs in reading my Dart.jar dated 12/1/2021,   version 213.5744.122

Oh, duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96651, which says this is fixed on the master channel. (So delete my comment after closing as duplicate, I guess!)

PS: I wonder if it might be the zip comment, which contains characters 1 and 6. But they are valid UTF-8 control characters, per utf8-chartable.de (namely, SOH and Acknowledge) :

C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Roaming\JetBrains\IdeaIC2021.3\plugins\Dart\lib>7z l dart.jar |  rg --no-unicode "[^\x09-\x7f]"
Comment = ☺E♠

C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Roaming\JetBrains\IdeaIC2021.3\plugins\Dart\lib>7z l dart.jar |  rg "[^\x09-\x7f]" | hx --color 0
0x000000: 0x43 0x6f 0x6d 0x6d 0x65 0x6e 0x74 0x20 0x3d 0x20 Comment =
0x00000a: 0x01 0x45 0x06 0x0d 0x0a                          .E...
   bytes: 15

@dipakbari4 
The fix is currently available on master and will be rolled out in beta and stable per Flutter's release guidelines.
See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060#issuecomment-1018801980 issue comment for your reference.
Closing this as a duplicate.

title: Flutter 2.10 upgrade fails at IntelliJ Plugin step on Linux

title: [google_sign_in] How do I set consent=prompt for the sign in?
body:
As of right now whenever a user has given consent for the scopes that were requested the sign in view does not show the consent prompt again.
This obviously is the expected behavior in most cases.
But it seems that the returned authorization code then cannot be exchanged once again to obtain a refresh token.

The issue is that if e.g. the user is able to perform the sign in with google, but afterwards is unable to successfully send the authorization code to my server for whatever reason, I am unable to obtain the refresh token anymore.
The user would need to revoke access and then try again which would be a terrible user experience.

Is there a way to force the consent prompt to come up?
comments:
Hi @elertan, The plugin currently doesn't support showing the consent screen once it is submitted, Unless the scopes are manually revoked. I believe this will be solved by https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/68882. Closing this issue as a duplicate of the above-linked issue. If you disagree feel free to write in the comments and we will reopen it. 

Thank you

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Problem with CupertinoContextMenu
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone X - 2022-02-03 at 15 38 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17973173/152429748-3e682d04-3c89-4306-b141-daac6b175f12.png)

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. I implemented CupertinoContextMenu and I can't expand the width of actions buttons

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone X - 2022-02-03 at 16 17 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17973173/152430610-0473049a-fbaf-46fc-800d-629e46e26ec7.png)

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone X - 2022-02-03 at 15 38 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17973173/152430187-ea004903-fe6b-455f-b3b3-27c8000d6dd5.png)
<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/cupertino.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Center(
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: <Widget>[
            CupertinoContextMenu(
              actions: [
                // Container(),
                Material(
                  child: _optionButton(
                    label: 'Llamar',
                    iconName: 'circle-phone',
                  ),
                ),
                Material(
                  child: _optionButton(
                    label: 'Whatsapp',
                    iconName: 'circle-whatsapp',
                  ),
                ),
                Material(
                  child: _optionButton(
                    label: 'Correo elctrónico',
                    iconName: 'circle-envelope',
                  ),
                ),
              ],
              previewBuilder: (context, _, __) {
                return _cupertinoModalPreview(context);
              },
              child: Container(
                height: 60,
                color: Colors.red,
              ),
            )
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _cupertinoModalPreview(BuildContext context) {
    return Material(
      color: Colors.transparent,
      clipBehavior: Clip.none,
      child: Stack(
        clipBehavior: Clip.none,
        children: [
          _headerContextMenu(),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _optionButton({
    required String label,
    required String iconName,
    void Function()? onTap,
  }) {
    return GestureDetector(
      onTap: onTap,
      child: Container(
        margin: const EdgeInsets.only(left: 18, right: 18),
        height: 48,
        child: Row(
          children: [
            const Icon(Icons.people),
            const SizedBox(width: 15),
            Text(
              label,
              style: const TextStyle(
                fontSize: 15,
                color: Color(0xFF040506),
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Container _headerContextMenu() {
    return Container(
      height: 65,
      padding: const EdgeInsets.only(left: 12, right: 12),
      decoration: BoxDecoration(
        color: Colors.white,
        borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(8),
      ),
      child: Row(
        children: [
          Text('CO'),
          const SizedBox(width: 13),
          Text(
            'Carlos Ospina',
            style: const TextStyle(
              fontWeight: FontWeight.w600,
              color: Color(0xFF040506),
              fontSize: 16,
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

 <summary>Logs</summary>

    es-419)

[✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 13.2.1)
[✓] Chrome - develop for the web
[✓] Android Studio (version 2020.3)
[✓] VS Code (version 1.63.2)
[✓] Connected device (3 available)

• No issues found
```
</details>


<!--
      Consider also attaching screenshots and/or videos to better
      illustrate the issue.

      You can upload them directly on GitHub.
      Beware that video file size is limited to 10MB.
-->
comments:
Hi @Carl0395, the sample you have provided is not complete. 

Please provide a complete minimal reproducible code sample. 

Thank you
Hi @danagbemava-nc, I have updated the issue with a complete code sample.

Hi @Carl0395, there's an open issue related to the fidelity of the CupertinoContextMenu open in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92260. 

In the meantime, you can fix the overflow error by wrapping your label with either a `Flexible` or an `Expanded`

Closing as duplicate of #92260
