The fix is merged (3e6e996f9eff), but it appears to still be on `master`. So, it should land the next refresh of `beta` (maybe early next week) and the *next* refresh of `stable` (May-June).

The impact seems to be limited to the `doctor` tool, and not the IDE or plugin itself. It looks very bad, but doesn't affect normal usage. You just can't get diagnostic information on IntelliJ.

Perhaps it should've been fast-tracked either as a blocker for release or a hotfix. Not sure where that discussion would be, but per the [guidelines](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Issue-hygiene#do-not-add-me-too-or-same-comments-to-bugs) it doesn't seem to be as an issue.

@i3games 
The fix is currently available on master and will be rolled out in beta and stable per Flutter's release guidelines. 
See [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060#issuecomment-1018801980) issue comment for your reference.
Closing this as a duplicate.

The bug report was opened on **stable** not on **master**. What is or isn't on master should not be of consideration. 

You are closing this again on a bug that is not fixed. Can you reexamine your current policy of closing issues prematurely, before they are fixed? 

It makes no sense to close issues with technical fixes *somewhere in the pipeline*, it wastes time for people who encounter these bugs, and it wastes time for the team that has to deal with these bug reports. 

Close issues after they are actually fixed, the definition being: the issue is resolved technically **and the fix is available on the channel where the issue is reported on**? 

This should be a general principle in the future.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Apple Watch app detection does not work for new Apple Watch projects
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Create an Apple Watch app for a Flutter iOS app
2. Attempt to run the app

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Flutter detects that the project contains an Apple Watch app and adjusts the build settings accordingly

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Flutter cannot detect that new Apple Watch targets created by Xcode exist because the structure of Apple Watch targets changed. The build fails.

**Details**
Currently, Flutter looks for a `WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier` key in plist files, but that key no longer exists in new Apple Watch projects.

The `watchkitapp` target no longer contains a plist by default, and the `watchkitextension` target contains a plist with the following contents:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>NSExtension</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExtensionAttributes</key>
		<dict>
			<key>WKAppBundleIdentifier</key>
			<string>dev.rexios.watchConnectivityExample.watchkitapp</string>
		</dict>
		<key>NSExtensionPointIdentifier</key>
		<string>com.apple.watchkit</string>
	</dict>
</dict>
</plist>
```
comments:
@Rexios80 
Currently Flutter does support Apple watch. See [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/2056) issue and relevant comments for your reference.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/2056#issuecomment-248377630
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/2056#issuecomment-561449188

So I am closing this in favor of above comments and link.
Uhhh I know. This is an issue with building a flutter app with a bundled Watch app.

title: PopupMenuButton issues
body: ## Use case I am using PopupMenuButton to display a list of suggestions to the user so that they can select from the suggestions. We should use PopupMenuItem to display each suggestion as required by PopupMenuButton. However, the width of the PopupMenuItem is not expanding to fit the entire screen regardless of my approach to wrap it with - SizedBox or Container with max width of the screen, The width of the suggestion list is somewhat fixed by default which prevents it from taking the available space. I found more about it in this issue : https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92591#issuecomment-953417550 Also, The safeArea[ top-bottom ] of PopupMenuButton cannot be removed. This can be registered as a separate issue but I left it here in the same one for consideration. I cannot find a solution for this issue yet. ## Proposal Flutter should provide a default way for PopupMenuItem to adjust to the full screen width by: - Using a boolean value that might be called setFullScreenWith On setFullScreenWith value set to true , the PopupMenuItem takes the full width of the screen, else it will have the default property.
comments:

Hi @neiljaywarner,  I can confirm that the autofill is not working on `stable 2.8.1` This was a known bug and is fixed on the latest master channel, You may verify this by switching to the master channel  by running 
```
flutter channel master
flutter upgrade
```
In case you still face the issue, we can continue the discussion here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97633

title: Chrome doesn't save username
body:
## Steps to Reproduce 1. implement a simple email/password form 2. input email and password 3. submit a form **Expected results:** Chrome saves both username (email) and password **Actual results:**: **Related issues**: #61301 (mentions password managers, my thinking is that these two have the same root cause)
Code sample ```dart class EmailForm extends StatelessWidget { final VoidCallback onSubmitted; final TextEditingController emailCtrl; final TextEditingController passwordCtrl; const EmailForm({ Key? key, required this.onSubmitted, required this.emailCtrl, required this.passwordCtrl, }) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return ConstrainedBox( constraints: const BoxConstraints(maxWidth: 400), child: Card( child: Padding( padding: const EdgeInsets.all(16), child: AutofillGroup( child: Form( child: Column( crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.stretch, mainAxisSize: MainAxisSize.min, children: [ TextField( autofocus: true, keyboardType: TextInputType.emailAddress, autofillHints: const [ AutofillHints.email, AutofillHints.username, AutofillHints.newUsername, ], controller: emailCtrl, decoration: const InputDecoration( labelText: 'Email', ), ), const SizedBox(height: 16), TextField( obscureText: true, autofillHints: const [AutofillHints.password], controller: passwordCtrl, onSubmitted: (v) { onSubmitted(); }, decoration: const InputDecoration( labelText: 'Password', ), ), const SizedBox(height: 16), ElevatedButton( onPressed: onSubmitted, child: const Text('Sign in'), ), ], ), ), ), ), ), ); } } ```
Logs ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on macOS 12.0.1 21A559 darwin-x64, locale en-BY) • Flutter version 2.8.1 at /Users/lesnitsky/flutter-sdk • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 77d935af4d (7 weeks ago), 2021-12-16 08:37:33 -0800 • Engine revision 890a5fca2e • Dart version 2.15.1 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 31.0.0) • Android SDK at /Users/lesnitsky/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-31, build-tools 31.0.0 • ANDROID_HOME = /Users/lesnitsky/Library/Android/sdk • ANDROID_SDK_ROOT = /Users/lesnitsky/Library/Android/sdk • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) • All Android licenses accepted. title: Comma doesnt work on Samsung Android Keyboard with Flutter
body:
My Samsung Galaxy Tab s4 (SM-T830) comma button key is disabled.

Although I'm using a TextFormField of type number with a keyboardType of TextInputType.numberWithOptions(decimal: true) it doesn't work.

![mRYrE](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97102349/152138834-33cb7c6a-5fd2-400d-9b25-18d95dfa1943.png)
comments: I think we have the same problem, check my issue : https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97634
Unfortunately your problem is not mine. Me my comma button is disabled while you it's another problem

Hi @YannBemba40, I see a similar issue being tracked in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/61175. It seems like this is a general Samsung issue as there was a similar issue reported on the Xamarin Forms repo https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1898. It seems to be related to locales. 

Closing as duplicate as a similar issue is already being tracked in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/61175.

If you disagree, leave a comment below and I will reopen. 

Thank you

title: [Android] Autofill is not working
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

The following code doesn't show any autofill hints in my physical Android device nor on web

**Expected results:** Autofill credentials popping up when textfield is being focused

**Actual results:** Nothing comes up

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
                                              Form(
                                                key: _loginFormKey,
                                                child: AutofillGroup(
                                                  child: Column(

                                                          keyboardType: TextInputType.emailAddress,
                                                          decoration: InputDecoration(

                                                            contentPadding: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 5.0),
                                                            labelText: 'E-Mail',
                                                          ),
                                                          controller: _usernameController,
                                                          autocorrect: false,
                                                          onSubmitted: (String value) {
                                                            if (state is! LoginLoadInProgress || state is! LoginLoadSuccess) {
                                                              _onLoginButtonPressed();
                                                            }
                                                          },
                                                        ),
                                                      ),
                                                      TextField(
                                                        key: _passwordKey,
                                                        autofillHints: const <String>[AutofillHints.password],
                                                        decoration: InputDecoration(
                                                          suffixIcon: const Icon(Icons.lock_outline),
                                                          hintStyle: _kbt.sb2().copyWith(color: Colors.grey.withOpacity(0.5)),
                                                          contentPadding: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 5.0),
                                                          labelText: 'general.password'.tr(),
                                                        ),
                                                        autocorrect: false,
                                                        controller: _passwordController,
                                                        obscureText: true,
                                                        onEditingComplete: () => TextInput.finishAutofillContext(),
                                                        onSubmitted: (String value) {
                                                          if (state is! LoginLoadInProgress || state is! LoginLoadSuccess) {
                                                            _onLoginButtonPressed();
                                                          }
                                                        },
                                                      ),
                                                      InkWell(
                                                        hoverColor: Colors.transparent,
                                                        splashColor: Colors.transparent,
                                                        highlightColor: Colors.transparent,
                                                        onTap: () {
                                                          setState(() {
                                                            _remember = !_remember;
                                                          });

                                                          if (_remember) _showRememberInfo();
                                                        },
                                                        child: Row(
                                                          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                                                          children: <Widget>[

                                                                });

                                                                if (_remember) _showRememberInfo();
                                                              },
                                                            ),

                                                              child: _kbt.h6('account.stayLoggedIn'),
                                                            ),
                                                          ],
                                                        ),
                                                      ),
                                                    ],
                                                  ),
                                                ),
                                              ),
```

comments:
> @jaredible Can you provide `flutter run --verbose` log in a text file ? Also provide `Runner.xcodeproj/project.pbxproj` and `ios/podfile`.

Please, let me know if this is correct.

[verbose_run.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/7988628/verbose_run.txt)
[verbose_run_other.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/7988630/verbose_run_other.txt)
[project_pbxproj.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/7988649/project_pbxproj.txt)
No podfile exists

@jaredible 
From the verbose log you shared, it's failing due to: 
```

`Target debug_universal_framework failed: ProcessException: Process exited abnormally:

ld: building for iOS Simulator, but linking in .tbd file`
```

Which is similar to this open issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/84788, so please follow-up in it for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate.
Ultimately, this helped me understand **fundamentally** the source of the problem: [https://stackoverflow.com/a/64139830](https://stackoverflow.com/a/64139830)

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: [google_maps_flutter] Adding label field to the marker
body:
Hi, 

Can label be added to the `Marker` 

```
const Marker({
    required this.markerId,
    this.alpha = 1.0,
    this.anchor = const Offset(0.5, 1.0),
    this.consumeTapEvents = false,
    this.draggable = false,
    this.flat = false,
    this.icon = BitmapDescriptor.defaultMarker,
    this.infoWindow = InfoWindow.noText,
    this.position = const LatLng(0.0, 0.0),
    this.rotation = 0.0,
    this.visible = true,
    this.zIndex = 0.0,
    this.onTap,
    this.onDrag,
    this.onDragStart,
    this.onDragEnd,
  }) : assert(alpha == null || (0.0 <= alpha && alpha <= 1.0));
```

It seems that this is available in the google maps documentation

https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/examples/marker-labels
comments:
Hi @jeffmilanes, Adding text label to marker is not supported as of today, This feature request is being tracked here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/26109. Please follow up there for further updates.

Closing this issue as a duplicate

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

> For sample 2 in your video you have a delayed of 1 second. But with delayed of 0 second, the focus is not shifted to the appbar title on Android 10 and 12.

@guinardA This seems to be working as intended Please see this comment https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97222#issuecomment-1022414938

For me it's two different issues.

the #97222  is just on iOS and this one is for Android and iOS.

Leaving this issue open for further investigation.

title: [url_launcher][mobile-web] Phone number and body fields are not always pre-populated in SMS app
comments:
Please provide the output of `flutter doctor -v` as well as the version of `url_launcher` you're using. 

Thank you

`url_launcher: ^6.0.18`

<details>
<summary>flutter doctor -v</summary>

```
</details>

I did another test. Removed all special chars from body. So now, I am launching this:
launching sms for android sms:+39999888777?body=OKTHANKS

This launches the sms app and prepopulates the phone number but body is still missing.

I just did another test on android and it worked just fine, see video below.  I'm using the code sample I posted earlier. 

<details>
<summary>video </summary>


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88313112/151969649-3bfa6409-9f05-4fe7-9b06-9e63a1cd8a42.mp4


</details>

Could you please tell me which device did you try it on (real android phone or ios?). 

I tried it on my iPad and it did work correctly. But I tried the same on my Asus Android phone and it did not work. I swear I have the exact same code that you suggested. It is printing out the correct uri in the log message, which I am able to see using chrome remote debugging ( chrome://inspect/#devices )

> Could you please tell me which device did you try it on (real android phone or ios?).

I initially tested on an `iOS simulator` before testing on android. On android, I tested on both:  emulator and physical device. 

Emulators: Pixel 4a API 31 & Pixel 4a API 30
Physical device: Poco X3 NFC, android 11

What os version is your device running?

I tried it with three phones 1: Android v 9 (Asus_X00TD),  2. Android v 11 ( Galaxy F41 and F62). 
On all three, the phone and body are absent when body has special chars (even though encoded). 
On all three, the phone is present but the body is absent when body is plain text with no special chars such as OKTHANKS.
OK, this is really weird but it is working on my very old phone that has Android version 6 on it. Unbelievable!

There's a chance this might be an issue that is affecting only a certain group of devices. I don't know if this is something that url_launcher has any control over considering all it does it call a method to open the URL.  Can you confirm a few things for me?

- Everything works as expected in a mobile flutter app (ios/android)
- This works as expected on ios (according to your test on iPad) Which browser did you use?
- This works on some of your android devices but not on some

Where "This works" refers to SMS app opening with text and number prepopulated

Yes, it seems like it is device specific or some security trap. I guess some devices are interpreting the uri very strictly and allowing only the phone number part in the uri.

1. Everything works as expected in a mobile flutter app (ios/android)
The mobile flutter app works fine on various Android devices. Not tested on iOS because I haven't built the ios version of the app yet.

2. This works as expected on ios (according to your test on iPad) Which browser did you use?
Yes, the web version works on ios (ipad as well as iphone). Tested on Chrome.

3. This works on some of your android devices but not on some.
Yes, the web version running on Chrome fails consistently on relatively newer devices (Samsung and Asus) that I tested on. It worked on an old Android 6 device. Another interesting bit that I observed was that if you have an ampersand in the body (before url encoding), it fails even on that old android device. It had no impact on the app version. i.e. the app version works even if there is an & in the body text. 

Thanks for your attention.

Can you test if using 

```dart
 String body = Uri.encodeQueryComponent(msg);
```

instead of

```dart
String body = Uri.encodeComponent(msg);
```

makes any difference?
No, that didn't make any difference.
Hi @pryshrm, can you test with other browsers to see if it makes any difference?
didn't work on duckduckgo either. Launched the sms app but ph and text were empty.
On Via browser, it was worse. It couldn't even launch the sms app!
@pryshrm For the devices where this doesn't work in Flutter, have you tested to see if it works on a normal web page? e.g. `test`?

`sms` URLs don't have a standard behavior for extra parameters across platforms. This is not something within the control of the plugin, as it's at the level of the receiver of the URL.

Closing as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/18823

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

title: Flutter doesn't consistently reach 120 fps on macOS
body:
Similar to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/90675, support 120 hz / ProMotion on the macOS platform.

EDIT: Flutter does appear to support 120 fps on macOS, but doesn't consistently reach it. See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97530#issuecomment-1028590690.
comments:
@KevinBrendel 
Can you please elaborate on the issue by providing a code sample ? Is there a current limitation that you are facing specific to macOS ?

@darshankawar I must admit that upon further investigation, the issue appears to be slightly different than I originally thought. Flutter does in fact appear to support 120 hz on macOS, but it appears to be nearly impossible to actually reach it. In my [minimal example project](https://github.com/KevinBrendel/smoothness_test), (running on the current stable release on an M1 Max with 32 GPU cores), the Flutter profiler shows performance well above 120 fps with no dropped frames: But visually, the performance is much lower and extremely inconsistent, with large amounts of stuttering resulting from large variations in frame-times. This can be confirmed by profiling the app using Xcode with the Game Performance template. This also confirms that some of the frames do in fact render within the 8.33 ms required to achieve 120 fps. There appear to be some serious performance issues in the macOS implementation of Flutter that are not caught by the Flutter profiler. Colleagues confirmed that the performance issue also appears on Intel Macs. This same app runs smoothly on iPadOS. The issue is not limited to animations, as I originally encountered it in a real project in a SingleChildScrollView as well as when manually handling scroll events. When running on a 60 hz screen, the frame times are generally more consistent, but still, there frequently are dropped frames not caught by the Flutter profiler.

@KevinBrendel 
Thanks for the details. Can you check if [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/49757) issue is similar to your use case ?

@darshankawar 
It is definitely related to my issue. Running the linked code from that issue on the ProMotion display also only results in a 60 fps output being calculated in the Flutter code. (Although both the Flutter and Xcode profilers once again report much higher frame-rates.)
I am not sure if supporting higher frame-rates is the whole story, though, as I even experience dropped frames on 60 hz displays (although much less often than on 120 hz displays).

I don't know enough about the inner workings of Flutter, but it seems to me that the frames delivered by Flutter are not in sync with the frames delivered by the native application into which Flutter is embedded, resulting in the frame-rate mismatch and in the stutters (I have a hard time believing that these are actually performance issues).

Thanks for further details. I think following up in the linked issue : https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/49757 would help to better track your observation. You can also share your findings in that issue.
I am going ahead and closing this in favor of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/49757. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.

title: integration_test: Issue in simulating keyboard backspace action to clear text from TextFormField()?
comments:
@rajeshpatil95 
Thanks for the report. Does the behavior only occur on web or it persists on mobile too ?
Also, I am not sure if flutter integration_test / flutter_driver supports keyboard events yet, see this open issue for your reference: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9383.
I think per [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9383#issuecomment-752609022) comment, atleast the keyboard events such as `done`, `search`, `go` seems to be supported, but you may try to explore more on it to see if backspace button is supported or not.

@darshankawar 
Checked for web -d chrome on windows OS.....The keyboard events such as `done`, `search` and `go` are mainly for mobile...but luckily it works for web as well but i suspect if i refer to the internal implementation of `sendKeyDownEvent` its says platforms (e.g. Windows, iOS) are not yet supported.

@rajeshpatil95 
I looked at the code you shared and played around it a bit and observed that until `await tester.showKeyboard(nameInput);` line of code, the test passes. I also tried to tap the textformfield first by adding `await tester.tap(nameInput);` which passes too, but I think this line of code seems to be a problem: `await tester.sendKeyDownEvent(LogicalKeyboardKey.backspace);`. This will probably only press backspace once which may not delete the entire text (if at all the keyboard event api works properly) and hence it fails because it may not have deleted the text input entirely and hence `expect(find.text('Rajesh Patil'), findsNothing);` fails.

I also tried with `expect(find.text('Rajesh Pati'), findsOneWidget);` but it failed with same error.

So I am guessing, due to [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9383) limitation, the keyboard events are not firing.

Thanks @darshan for the reply much appreciated..!!
Even i tried the same drill with `await tester.sendKeyDownEvent(LogicalKeyboardKey.backspace);` suspecting only single character get trimmed off. So tried with `await tester.sendKeyRepeatEvent(LogicalKeyboardKey.select);` then followed by repeated events `await tester.sendKeyRepeatEvent(LogicalKeyboardKey.backspace);` but still no luck didn't succeed at it.
These lines actually corrupts the test case...tests starts behaving weirdly

title: (Android) Doesn't load images from gallery when launch mode is in singleInstance
body:
Hi there. Congrats for this excellent plugin, it has been a most have in all of my project. However, I have encountered an issue in Android devices when your declare in your main activity android:launchMode="singleInstance" instead of singleTop like the default config. Images from the default files app have no problems, however, if you switch to your gallery app, then images are not loaded after selection. ImagePicker.pickImage() just returns null. 

## Steps to Reproduce
Just go to your android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml and change the lauchmode options. Should be something like this:
``` xml
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
   ...
   <application
        ...
        <activity
          android:name="com.yalantis.ucrop.UCropActivity"
          android:screenOrientation="portrait"
          android:theme="@style/Theme.AppCompat.Light.NoActionBar"
        />
        <activity
            android:name=".MainActivity"
            android:launchMode="singleInstance"
            android:theme="@style/LaunchTheme"
            android:configChanges="orientation|keyboardHidden|keyboard|screenSize|smallestScreenSize|locale|layoutDirection|fontScale|screenLayout|density|uiMode"
            android:hardwareAccelerated="true"
            android:windowSoftInputMode="adjustResize">
```
Would be great to give some alternative to this feature...maybe it's something that we must include in the activity and I'm missing.
comments:
Hi @yarn-rp, it looks like there's a similar issue already open describing what you're experiencing in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/76856. It looks like it's not just an issue with the gallery, picking from google photos doesn't work either.

Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

Thank you

title: [webview] WebView not parsing and rendering contents until visible
body: Hi, this is a follow-up to [another issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95938), discussed with @darshankawar. This issue was not clearly spotted, so I took more time on a small test project. I now have more precisely qualified the issue. The sample project is here: https://github.com/Mantano/pagination_tests, in branch [Simplified](https://github.com/Mantano/pagination_tests/tree/simplified: this one uses webview_flutter) In my sample project, 6 webviews are placed in a [PreloadPageView](https://pub.dev/packages/preload_page_view). This PreloadPageView allows defining how many pages are preloaded (`preloadPagesCount` param). I see this, in the chrome devtools: And when looking at one of the "empty - never attached" webviews: As you can see, the document has been parsed, but not pre-rendered ("empty - never attached"). As a consequence, if I add some JS code that does some computation based on the rendered contents, it will fail (as it does in our real ebook reader app). I'm pretty sure (100%) that this isn't a behavior induced by PreloadPageView, since the related code is exactly the same between the 2 branches. I hope these explanations are sufficiently precise. I'm pretty sure there is a simple fix. I'd like to continue using webview_flutter instead of flutter_inappwebview for many reasons... **EDIT** Please note that I am using Hybrid Composition on Android since it provides better performances, and it matches iOS where this is the only option available. But the issue doesn't occur on Android when using Virtual Display. Maybe this clue can also help? title: [video_player] Aspect ratio of video is always 1 for HLS video format on IOS
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the example code in https://github.com/flutter/plugins/tree/main/packages/video_player/video_player/example
2. Replace the video in _BumbleBeeRemoteVideoState::initState to 'https://test-streams.mux.dev/x36xhzz/x36xhzz.m3u8'
3. Run the demo on iOS device or iOS simulator (in Android works fine)
4. On the first tap, you can see the video square because the width and the height are zero

**Expected results:** Correct aspect ratio
**Actual results:** Square aspect ratio

## What I found

I tried to find the problem and it started on version video_player-v2.2.12
The problem is in the file FLTVideoPlayerPlugin in setupEventSinkIfReadyToPlay
```
if (hasVideoTracks && height == CGSizeZero.height && width == CGSizeZero.width) {
    return;
}
```
if the 'hasVideoTracks' is removed (as it was on version 2.2.11), the video looks fine and you can get the right width and height. If not, you always get zero in width and height
comments:

title: TODO workflow improvement idea
body:
## Use case

There is a [flutter_style_todos](https://dart-lang.github.io/linter/lints/flutter_style_todos.html) rule and as I understand, it is designed to help with `TODO` comment audit. This comment style is used in Flutter code base.


## Proposal

I just have an idea which might improve `TODO` audit workflow. Instead of using `TODO(user-name)` comment as the linter rule suggests we may use `TODO(issue-labels)` comment, for example:

- `TODO(blocked)` -  The issue is blocked on third-party code or team
- `TODO(performance)` - Performance issue
- `TODO(tools)` -Tooling related issue
- `TODO(platform-web-performance)` - Web platform performance issue
- `TODO(easy-ux)` - Easy user experience related issue
- `TODO(code-smell)` - Code that needs refactoring

This is just a workflow idea which I started to use in my projects. Please feel free to if you think that it will not make Flutter workflow more effective.
comments:
Actually I found an original issue describing same case: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/37519, so please follow-up in it for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate.

@TechComet 
This issue was fixed and merged into master: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94181
So you will need to switch to latest master to see the fix working.

`flutter channel master`
`flutter upgrade`

Closing, as this is already fixed.

title: PageRouteBuillder rebuilds its widgets.
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

I was searching about the widget rebuild problem and stumbled upon this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/37878
This was working fine, but after updating the flutter version to `2.8.0` On `2.3.1`everything is working as expected. I'm facing a similar issue. This is precisely happening when I'm having two MaterialApps, and my routes are defined in the 

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. In the Material App provide the route names and build a route via PageRouteBuilder
3. In your widget have a `ListView.builder` with items as `TextField`s with print() statement in the `itemBuillder`.
4. Tap on the textField and you would notice didUpdateWidget() being called every time the soft keyboard opens/closes.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:cloudinary_media_sample/home_entry_point_widget2.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  // This widget is the root of your application.
  // GlobalKey key = GlobalKey();

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: MyHomePage(
        title: 'Title',
      ),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  _MyHomePageState createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      key: ValueKey('kk'),
      supportedLocales: [
        Locale("en"),
      ],
      localizationsDelegates: [],
      title: 'My app',
      debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false,
      themeMode: ThemeMode.dark,
      theme: ThemeData(brightness: Brightness.dark, primaryColor: Colors.blue),
      darkTheme: ThemeData(
        brightness: Brightness.dark,
      ),
      initialRoute: '/home',
      onGenerateRoute: (settings) {
        var child;
        if (settings.name == '/home') {
          return MaterialPageRoute(
              builder: (context) {
                return HomeEntryPointWidget();
              },
              settings: settings);

          child = HomeEntryPointWidget();
        } else if (settings.name == '/pp') {
          return MaterialPageRoute(
              builder: (context) {
                return HomeEntryPointWidget2();
              },
              settings: settings);
        } else {
          child = Container();
        }

        return MaterialPageRoute(
            builder: (context) {
              return child;
            },
            settings: settings);
      },
      onUnknownRoute: (settings) => MaterialPageRoute(
          builder: (context) => Scaffold(
                backgroundColor: Colors.black12,
                body: Center(
                    child: Container(
                  child: Text(' ${settings.name} Are you lost!!'),
                )),
              ),
          settings: settings),
      builder: (context, child) {
        return Container(
          color: Colors.red,
          child: Padding(
            padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
            child: child,
          ),
        );
      },
    );
  }
}

class HomeEntryPointWidget extends StatefulWidget {
  const HomeEntryPointWidget({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  _HomeEntryPointWidgetState createState() => _HomeEntryPointWidgetState();
}

class _HomeEntryPointWidgetState extends State<HomeEntryPointWidget> {
  @override
  void initState() {
    print('inside home_entry_point_widget.dart init');
    super.initState();
  }

  @override
  void didChangeDependencies() {
    print('inside home_entry_point_widget.dart didChangeDependencies');
    super.didChangeDependencies();
  }

  @override
  void didUpdateWidget(covariant HomeEntryPointWidget oldWidget) {
    print('inside home_entry_point_widget.dart didUpdateWidget');
    super.didUpdateWidget(oldWidget);
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    print('inside home_entry_point_widget.dart build : ');
    return Scaffold(
      body: ListView.builder(
          itemCount: 20,
          itemBuilder: (context, _) {
            print('inside building item $_::');
            return Column(
              children: [
                GestureDetector(
                    onTap: () => Navigator.pushReplacementNamed(context, '/pp'),
                    child: FlutterLogo(
                      size: 400,
                    )),
                TextField(),
              ],
            );
          }),
    );
  }
}

```

<!-- Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here. -->

```
[✓] Flutter (Channel unknown, 2.8.1, on macOS 11.4 20F71 darwin-x64, locale en-IN)

comments:
Hi @neelansh-creatorstack, Thanks for filing the issue. 

There is a similar issue describing this case #90550, Please follow up there for further updates, Closing this issue as a duplicate. If you disagree feel free to write in the comments and I will reopen it.

Thank you.

Yes @maheshmnj , this is the same problem of having nested Material App. Once I removed the nested Material App and passed the other Material App in the builder function of the first one, there are no more rebuilds happening. But if passed in the home parameter, the above issue happens.

Here is the Email from google, thank you for your reply:**

<br class="Apple-interchange-newline">Hello Google Maps Platform Customer,
We're writing to remind you that a major update of Maps SDK for Android (version 18.0.x), available via Google Play services, features a new map renderer that will become the default renderer for Android devices* through a progressive rollout, starting in June 2022 at the earliest.
Once the new renderer becomes the default, your apps will use the new renderer whether or not they were built against Maps SDK for Android version 18.0.x.
Update to the new map renderer (SDK latest version: 18.0.2) now to test and deploy the new SDK and renderer with your apps before the new renderer becomes the default for Android devices*.
We’ve improved how we serve tiles to your apps and render the map on client devices with the new SDK. Therefore, Android devices will benefit from:
	•	Reduced network load, processing demand, and memory consumption.
	•	Improved gesture handling for better animations, plus smoother panning and zooming.
	•	More fluid transitions and clearly positioned map labels.
	•	A more stable and improved user experience for future map innovations on Android.
The new SDK also includes the general availability of Cloud-based maps styling on mobile. Usage of Cloud-based maps styling for a map in Maps SDK for Android is billed with the Dynamic Maps SKU. For more information on pricing and included features, see our [Cloud Customization](https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEzOakgkc3e9Sb6FEkFuEzReXfhR6BJn4P94ctPDmP3LLUkgpcJVKcyHtJz7qJw97Gbq_dGo0__04_Mz__e3_fdbqwy2d5kwX-NPcWeY4TZ_RTLi40SfasHSkD67fCL-nnUPU6afjZu6Ko4aqXb2MwkWfB_ePgFgP1sv-YVA) documentation.
*All devices on Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or later with 2 GB or more of data storage will use the new renderer. All other devices will continue to use the legacy renderer until further notice.
What do I need to do?
To anticipate and avoid issues with your apps we advise you to:
	1	Specify version 18.0.x in your dependencies ([example](https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEx8Fof5IemMLOZI7ZHBClGGcyl4a7cPv8hGz2KIQyj8QSu9ZlYTs_0NRP7y9fih4LwvEqpZjvkJ62Fk81tr1rAZQT8XYMIZ17ca7aJlpT8VyMqKEpjHpI0mOSM9RnwqlqHzIHn6r1LsjSVtrzDJHktpHSkBYxxsN7mm50Ej0mCczbojAMhHHQ)).

title: Cached engine with custom entrypoint working on debug but not on profile or release
body:
Hi, I'm caching a flutter engine to reuse in another Activity. On debug mode it's working but it isn't on profile or release. I think that maybe it's about tree-shaking in my main.dart but don't know why because I'm already use @pragma annotation.

This error is blocking me for reusing the cached engine.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Added `android:name=".MyApplication"` in application tag in `AndroidManifest.xml`
2. Created MyApplication class

```
package productivity.timetracker.mytime

import android.app.Application
import io.flutter.embedding.engine.FlutterEngine
import io.flutter.embedding.engine.FlutterEngineCache
import io.flutter.embedding.engine.dart.DartExecutor
import io.flutter.view.FlutterMain.findAppBundlePath

class MyApplication : Application() {
    lateinit var flutterEngine : FlutterEngine

    override fun onCreate() {
        super.onCreate()

        // Instantiate a FlutterEngine.
        flutterEngine = FlutterEngine(this)

        // Start executing Dart code to pre-warm the FlutterEngine.
        flutterEngine.dartExecutor.executeDartEntrypoint(
            DartExecutor.DartEntrypoint(findAppBundlePath(),"mainLockScreen")
        )

        // Cache the FlutterEngine to be used by FlutterActivity.
        FlutterEngineCache
            .getInstance()
            .put("LockScreenEngine", flutterEngine)
    }
}
```

3. Added custom method in `main.dart`

```
@pragma('vm:entry-point')
void mainLockScreen() {
  debugPrint("mainLockScreen");
  ..... runApp...

}
```

**Expected results:** App runs normally as well as in debug mode 

**Actual results:**
```
E/flutter (25371): [ERROR:flutter/shell/common/shell.cc(94)] Dart Unhandled Exception: NoSuchMethodError: No top-level getter 'mainLockScreen' declared.
E/flutter (25371): Receiver: top-level
E/flutter (25371): Tried calling: mainLockScreen, stack trace: #0      NoSuchMethodError._throwNew (dart:core-patch/errors_patch.dart:218)
E/flutter (25371):
E/flutter (25371): [ERROR:flutter/runtime/dart_isolate.cc(718)] Could not resolve main entrypoint function.
E/flutter (25371): [ERROR:flutter/runtime/dart_isolate.cc(202)] Could not run the run main Dart entrypoint.
E/flutter (25371): [ERROR:flutter/runtime/runtime_controller.cc(384)] Could not create root isolate.
E/flutter (25371): [ERROR:flutter/shell/common/shell.cc(574)] Could not launch engine with configuration.
```

flutter doctor:
```
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[√] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on Microsoft Windows [versÃ£o 10.0.19043.1466], locale pt-BR)
[√] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 32.0.0)

```

title: AssetImage loading difference in web and android
body: I was trying AssetImage on Chrome and Android emulator. For the below shown folder structure, I found that using `Image(image: AssetImage('assets.png'))` works in Chrome and not in Android Emulator. I expect it not to be working on Chrome as well. Using `Image(image: AssetImage('assets/assets.png'))` works in both Chrome and Android as expected. Kindly let me know if my expectations happen to be incorrect. Folder Structure: ``` app └── .... └── lib └── assets └── assets.png ``` ## Steps to Reproduce In a basic flutter program, create a folder **assets** at the same level as **lib**, and add any image inside the **assets** folder, say **assets.png**. Load the said image using the below code: `Image(image: AssetImage('assets.png'))` Please run in Chrome and Android as well. **Chrome :** **Android :** Thanks !
comments:
hi @asashour 
Actually,without changing the pubspec.yaml chrome will show the Image but not the Android  phone.

`pubspec.yaml` is like this
```
flutter:
  uses-material-design: true
  assets:
    - assets/
```
According to the [document ](https://docs.flutter.dev/development/ui/assets-and-images)@asashour shared, the above specifications should show the image when we use
`Image(image: AssetImage('assets/assets.png'))` for the folder structure mentioned in the issue. It works in web and android.
(Note: we are mentioning the name of the folder too)

Currently `Image(image: AssetImage('assets.png'))` is loading the image in web, but not in android.

Hi @Rishaba-Jain, This is a known inconsistency on the web, This is being tracked here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/86833. Please follow up on the linked issue for further updates closing this issue as a  duplicate.

title: [camera] Crash on Android: CAMERA_ERROR (3): waitUntilIdle:1326: Camera 0: Error waiting to drain: Connection timed out (-110)
body:
Hi there,

I'm running `camera: 0.9.4+5` and I'm running into a crash on Android when using `startImagesStream`.

Here is how I initialize my frame stream:

```dart
_controller = CameraController(cameras[0], ResolutionPreset.veryHigh,
    enableAudio: false, imageFormatGroup: ImageFormatGroup.jpeg);
await _controller.initialize();

_controllerInit.complete();

await _controller.setFlashMode(FlashMode.off);
await _controller.setFocusMode(FocusMode.auto);
await _controller.lockCaptureOrientation(DeviceOrientation.portraitUp);
ready = true;
_controller.startImageStream((image) {
  print("got frame");
  if (_captureNext && !_capturedFrame.isCompleted) {
    _capturedFrame.complete(image);
    _captureNext = false;
  }
});
```

It works sometimes, but some other times the preview freeze and seconds later the app crashes with the following log:

```
I/Camera  (12572): close
I/Camera  (12572): startPreview
I/Camera  (12572): CameraCaptureSession onConfigured
I/Camera  (12572): Updating builder settings
D/Camera  (12572): Updating builder with feature: ExposureLockFeature

D/Camera  (12572): Updating builder with feature: FlashFeature
D/Camera  (12572): Updating builder with feature: ExposureOffsetFeature
D/Camera  (12572): Updating builder with feature: FpsRangeFeature
I/Camera  (12572): refreshPreviewCaptureSession
I/Camera  (12572): unlockAutoFocus
I/Camera  (12572): refreshPreviewCaptureSession
I/flutter (12572): Camera init took 342ms
I/Camera  (12572): closeCaptureSession
E/CameraCaptureSession(12572): Session 1: Failed to create capture session; configuration failed
I/Camera  (12572): CameraCaptureSession onConfigureFailed
I/Camera  (12572): open | onError
I/Camera  (12572): close
I/Choreographer(12572): Skipped 312 frames!  The application may be doing too much work on its main thread.
E/flutter (12572): [ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(209)] Unhandled Exception: CameraException(CameraAccess, CAMERA_ERROR (3): waitUntilIdle:1326: Camera 0: Error waiting to drain: Connection timed out (-110))
E/flutter (12572): #0      CameraController.startImageStream
package:camera/src/camera_controller.dart:434
E/flutter (12572): <asynchronous suspension>

```
The random nature of this issue makes it critical for my users in production.

Any idea of what could be happening ?

Cheers!

title: [Flutter 2.8.1] Scrollbar jumps around erratically when item in ListView is smoothly increasing in height
comments:
I just tried this to see if this would fix it but it still is jumpy:
- setting ListView.reverse: true
- expanding the *last* item in the list. 
- removing the timer and just setting the box height immediately: height: index == 0 ? 8000.0 : 200.0,

Didn't work. Scrollbar is still jumpy.

This seems like it might be due to uneven heights of the boxes? Maybe like #51470?

Hi @chipweinberger, Thanks for filing the issue. I can reproduce the same behavior the scrollbar is jumpy and does not smoothly scroll, But I believe this is intended since the list item is dynamically changing its height which changes the List maxExtent too.

Look at my last example, it reproduces even with statically sized box. Everything is Stateless.

This is a clear issue that seems like a simple thing to be broken.

Thanks for the code sample @chipweinberger, I can reproduce the issue on both stable and the master channel. However I see there is an issue already filed for this case https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/25652 Please follow up on this issue for further updates. Closing this issue as a duplicate.

Thanks @chipweinberger. I think this is expected behavior, you are changing the size of the scrollview dynamically every 30ms. Because of this, the scrollbar is going to update its position based on the change.

> How can the scroll bar for static items be broken?

What do you mean by static? In your code sample they are changing in size as a function of time.

The example where you have a fixed size of 8000 followed by 200, 200 200 is explained further in #25652

> I think this is expected behavior, you are changing the size of the scrollview dynamically every 30ms

Yes It makes sense that it jumps on the initial change. But, if I alter the first example (with the 30ms timer) to stop the timer after a few seconds, the scroll bar remains jumpy even after the timer stops (just like the first video).

That seems like unexpected (or at least not good) behavior. 

> What do you mean by static? In your code sample they are changing in size as a function of time.

Yes I was referring to my 2nd code example, with 8000 followed by 200, 200, 200. 

I will try the itemExtent you mentioned. Thanks for your suggestion. Hopefully that will get me most of the way there. I will also need to figure out a solution for this requirement:
- The content on the screen does not shift downward if extend the items above it.

Apologies for tone in the other thread. No offense intended. I understand this stuff can be tricky to get right.
ListView.shrinkwrap is another option you might want in the case of your static example.

title: [camera] Background music is stopped when calling `prepareVideoRecording` or `startVideoRecording`
comments:
Hi @Tom3652, Thanks for filing the issue. There is already an issue filed for this case please follow up here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95315 for further updates. Closing this issue as a duplicate.

ps: Is this issue only for IOS? I was not able to reproduce it on Redmi k20 pro (Android 11) using your code sample, I was able to record and play the video with the background music playing (spotify).

Hi @maheshmnj thanks for confirming. 
I also confirm that this seem to happen only on iOS, i have tested on my OPPO (Android 10) and it works just fine ! 

However, the issue you mentioned seems to be a feature request where for me it seems more like a bug since the behavior is different from Android and iOS and expected by most of users :/. 
 
If this doesn't change the priority, nevermind, but if it does change the priority (having this as a bug) it would be awesome.
I don't think I will be able to treat that issue as a bug since it has passed secondary triage. Let me check though

title: ITMS-90338: Non-public API usage - Macbook Air 2020 M1
body:
I have submitted my application more than 7 times to the appstore via XCode Archive but they reject it with the following message:

`ITMS-90338: Non-public API usage - The app references non-public symbols in Frameworks/Flutter.framework/Flutter: _IOIteratorNext, _IOObjectRelease, _IORegistryEntryCreateCFProperties, _IORegistryEntryGetChildIterator, _IOServiceGetMatchingServices, _IOServiceNameMatching, _kIOMasterPortDefault, _ptrace. If method names in your source code match the private Apple APIs listed above, altering your method names will help prevent this app from being flagged in future submissions. In addition, note that one or more of the above APIs may be located in a static library that was included with your app. If so, they must be removed. For further information, visit the Technical Support Information at http://developer.apple.com/support/technical/`

title: Flutter web App extremely slow to load first Time
body:
I saw previous issue on github. But none of them is helpful.
Here are two examples: one is flutter template app and other is build with php. Compare speed of loading both apps:

[App build with PHP](https://pi.afzl.me/#/)
[Flutter template app flutter build web](https://afzl.me/#/)

First one only take 2 seconds to fully load but flutter app takes atleast 15 second to load first time (after that it cache itself but still slow). 
Do Flutter or Google expects people to use flutter for their websites lol.
comments: Hi @afzl-wtu, Thanks for filing the issue, I ran your sample flutter app and it seems to load under 5 seconds for the first time and almost instantly later. Is this app built with canvaskit or auto renderer?  If yes then this is a known issue, To improve this further there is an open issue tracking this request https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/76009

> Hi @afzl-wtu, Thanks for filing the issue, I ran your sample flutter app and it seems to load under 5 seconds for the first time and almost instantly later. Is this app built with canvaskit or auto renderer? If yes then this is a known issue, To improve this further there is an open issue tracking this request #76009

Thanks for reply . it is just build with "Flutter build web" I am using Flutter 2.8.2.

But you can compare it with above complex php app there is a difference of  sky and earth. 

No one will allow to use flutter on his web server.

> it is just build with "Flutter build web"

That means you built with auto renderer which uses canvaskit on desktop and html on mobile devices. You can read more about it here https://docs.flutter.dev/development/tools/web-renderers

> I am using Flutter 2.8.2.

The latest stable version is  `2.8.1`, To get the latest fixes and features use the master branch. Closing this issue in favor of the linked issue above, since there is already an issue tracking this request.

> No one will allow to use flutter on his web server.

ps: You are comparing flutter web with a native technology that has been there for a decade now. software takes time to stabilize especially when its something complex like flutter which runs same thing on multiple platforms. (This is just a personal thought)

title: Missing scrolling inertia on iPadOS when using trackpad
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/

     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Connect an external trackpad to iPad (in this case, I am using the Magic Keyboard)
3. Use the two-finger scroll gesture

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Scrolling animation should not stop when I lift my fingers from the trackpad. It should have inertia, just like when using touch input or when scrolling on computers.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Scrolling animation stops abruptly when I lift my fingers from the trackpad.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    var text = "Example Text ";
    for (var i in Iterable.generate(100)) {
      text = text + i.toString() + '\n';
    }
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: SingleChildScrollView(
        child: Text(
          text,
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

```
No log at all! even with --verbose (except at build time) 
I guess scroll event simply isn't logged.
```

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12184989/150663131-6f110a09-8e41-490f-902d-eb7c89a938fb.MP4

Comparing trackpad scroll vs finger scroll (the transparent dot indicates trackpad is being used)
comments:
> @singularity-s0 
> 
> By missing scrolling inertia, do you mean when we try to flung scrollbar, it doesn't scroll correct ? 
> 
> If so, can you check if [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/78688) issue is similar to your case ?
> 
> 

Hi, thanks for the reply.

No, this issue has nothing to do with scrollbar. As you can see in the video no scrollbar activity is involved.

This issue occurs when one uses the two-finger scroll gesture on external trackpads connected to an iPad. It is  quite obvious. 

Scrolling with other input is not affected.
It prints `false` when scrolling with trackpad and `true` when scrolling with finger.

title: Mobile Web using RenderRepaintBoundary.toImage()
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce
RenderRepaintBoundary boundary = globalKey.currentContext.findRenderObject();
var image = await boundary.toImage();


**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I'm using Flutter-web to take a screenshot of a widget.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
 It works on PC but hasn't worked on my Android. Tried with chrome and the default browser. I get the error:
`Unsupported operation: toImage is not supported on the Web`

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

// Copyright (c) 2019, the Dart project authors.  Please see the AUTHORS file
// for details. All rights reserved. Use of this source code is governed by a
// BSD-style license that can be found in the LICENSE file.

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter/rendering.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false,
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  final String title;

  const MyHomePage({
    Key? key,
    required this.title,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  _MyHomePageState createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  GlobalKey globalKey = new GlobalKey();

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Center(
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: [
            RepaintBoundary(
                  key: globalKey,
                  child: Image.asset(''),
                ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: (){
          RenderRepaintBoundary boundary = globalKey.currentContext.findRenderObject();
          boundary.toImage();
        },
        tooltip: 'Increment',
        child: const Icon(Icons.add),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

comments:
Hi @BernardinD, please provide the output of `flutter doctor -v`. 

Thank you
@danagbemava-nc just added it

Similar to [47721](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/47721).

Hi @BernardinD,
Please see [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/47721#issuecomment-570718927) comment from above referenced ticket and another [comment](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/47721#issuecomment-638450866) in which the issue is split into two tickets.
Please follow-up there for updates on this issue.
Closing this as duplicate. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen.
Thanks.
@danagbemava-nc Those threads don't seem to cover mobile-web. I can get it to work from a PC so the problem seems to be mobile specific

Mobile-web is just the `html` renderer being used. The default for desktop is `canvaskit` whereas `html` is the default for mobile devices. You can confirm this by running `flutter run -d chrome --web-renderer html`. It will reproduce on desktop as well.
@danagbemava-nc i understand now. Thx so much! `flutter run -d chrome --web-renderer canvaskit` did the trick

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Keyboard transition shows Scaffold background color
body: ## Code to Reproduce ```dart Widget build(BuildContext context) { return Scaffold( backgroundColor: Colors.red, body: SingleChildScrollView( child: Container( color: Colors.white, width: MediaQuery.of(context).size.width, height: MediaQuery.of(context).size.height, child: Column( children: [ TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), TextFormField(), ], )), ), ); } ``` ## Step to reproduce Click any field that will be underneath the keyboard and you should see the background color appearing. You will see it even better when the keyboard closes. ## Demo Like here you can see that the scaffold color is appearing instead of being transparent

This may be an example of a known problem with antialiasing and mapping from logical pixels to device pixels. There's an open issue for a documentation fix: #14288

More info about the problem can be found here:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/14288#issuecomment-361375791
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/17084#issuecomment-385718108
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15035#issuecomment-370028740
Closing as duplicate of #14288

title: Input is voiced on a textfield with obscureText set to true when using VoiceOver
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Start typing in textfield 

**Expected results:** Input is not voiced

**Actual results:** VoiceOver voices the input


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19349394/150610304-af691867-dfe7-4f86-88d9-9ec002734ef5.MP4


<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem

title: StatefulWidget "reassemble" not working on web
body:
Hi.

My problem is that it doesn't go into "reassemble() " when reloading or hot reloading on the Web.

I'm developing an application with Nats, but a socket stays open every "reload". If it enters "reassemble()" or "dispose()" I can turn it off.

No callbacks to reassemble() in web development. ("hot restart" or "restart") 

```dart
class StatefulTest extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  State<StatefulWidget> createState() {
    return _StatefulTest();
  }
}

class _StatefulTest extends State<StatefulTest> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container();
  }

  @override
  void reassemble() {
    debugPrint("Here not working on web");
    super.reassemble();
  }
}
```

@KMACEL 
You may be seeing this behavior because hot reload isn't supported on web yet. See this open issue for your reference: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/53041
@darshankawar thank you.

title: integration_test invoking 'takeScreenshot' on iOS causes MissingPluginException (No implementation found for method captureScreenshot)
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

- Create a new project with "flutter create"
- Add dependencies to pubspec.yaml
```
  integration_test:
    sdk: flutter
  flutter_test:
    sdk: flutter
```
- Add folder 'integration_test' with file 'app_test.dart' and the following code with just an additional call to binding.takeScreenshot
- On Android this works great. On iOS, on the Simulator as well as an attached device - I get the following error.
```
import 'package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart';
import 'package:integration_test/integration_test.dart';
import 'package:screenshot_test/main.dart' as app;

void main() {
  //IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized();
  IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding binding = IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized() as IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding;

  group('end-to-end test', () {
    testWidgets('tap on the floating action button, verify counter',
            (WidgetTester tester) async {
          app.main();
          await tester.pumpAndSettle();

          // Verify the counter starts at 0.
          expect(find.text('0'), findsOneWidget);

          // Finds the floating action button to tap on.
          final Finder fab = find.byTooltip('Increment');

          // Emulate a tap on the floating action button.
          await tester.tap(fab);

          // Trigger a frame.
          await tester.pumpAndSettle();

          await binding.takeScreenshot('test');

          // Verify the counter increments by 1.
          expect(find.text('1'), findsOneWidget);
        });
  });
}

```
- execute 'flutter test integration_test/app_test.dart'
- chose an iOS device or simulator
-

**Expected results:** 
Same result as without the added "takeScreenshot" and the same as running the same code on Android.

**Actual results:**
```

I also had similar crash while running `flutter upgrade` and switching channels
Closing this as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/91559

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: [image picker] App state is lost after taking a picture
body:
Target phone:
Model: Xiaomi Redmi 8a
OS: Android 10

1. Run the program at target phone
2. Tap 3 times at + button at bottom of screen (**Plus** counter = 3)
3. Click at "Make photo" red button
4. Take a photo and tap at [✓]
5. All counters will reset

**Expected results:** increase **Photos** counter after take a photo

**Actual results:** reset all counters without errors

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:image_picker/image_picker.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  // This widget is the root of your application.
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Minimal code'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);
  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  final ImagePicker _picker = ImagePicker();
  List<XFile> imageFileList = [];
  int _counter = 0;
  int _errors = 0;
  String error = '';

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Center(
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: <Widget>[
            Text('Plus: $_counter'),
            Text('Photos: ${imageFileList.length}'),
            Padding(
              padding: const EdgeInsets.only(top: 20.0),
              child: MaterialButton(
                color: Colors.red,
                onPressed: () async {
                  try {
                    final XFile? xPhoto =
                    await _picker.pickImage(
                      source: ImageSource.camera,
                    );
                    if(xPhoto != null) {
                      setState(() {
                        imageFileList.add(xPhoto);
                      });
                    }
                  } catch (e) {
                    setState(() {
                      _errors++;
                      error = e.toString();
                    });
                  }
                },
                child: const Text('Make photo', style: TextStyle(color: Colors.white),),
              )
            ),
            Text('Errors: $_errors'),
            Text(error == '' ? '' : 'Last error: $error'),
            const Text('Photo: v 1.5.0')
          ],
        ),
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: () {
          setState(() {
            _counter++;
          });
        },
        tooltip: 'Increment',
        child: const Icon(Icons.add),
      ), // This trailing comma makes auto-formatting nicer for build methods.
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

  <summary>Logs</summary>

looks like it
Closing as a duplicate then; see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/48016#issuecomment-971918009

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

This is likely the same crash just happening on a different set of devices. 

Closing as duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96850

Is this issue related to the other issue [issue 96854](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96854) ?
Leaving this issue open for further insights from the team.
cc: @jason-simmons

@maheshmnj I seriously wonder why you're keeping this issue open...

It's clearly the same issue as:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96424
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95844
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96768

Which was fixed with https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/30835, and was pushed to master.
Now only needs to be released to beta and stable.

@mkay-42069 This issue was reported in production from the firebase console, The ones you pointed out are reproducible locally when closing the app.  Also, the logs don't look similar to this issue.

So I think it's better to wait for the teams input.

The symbolized stack trace in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/96851#issuecomment-1016409516 includes a crash in `flutter::Shell::OnPlatformViewSetSemanticsEnabled` during destruction of the `flutter::Shell`.  So this is a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95844
Thanks @jason-simmons, closing as duplicate of #95844 then.
