title: How to export package:flutter_gen/gen_l10n/app_localizations.dart which is in sub package
body: I'm try to support internationalization by following the guid form https://docs.flutter.dev/development/accessibility-and-localization/internationalization The different is that i put the different function into different package. I create core_lib package for main project, something like following: 1. export it in core_lib.dart ```dart library core_lib; export 'package:flutter_gen/gen_l10n/app_localizations.dart'; ``` 2. import it in main.dart ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:core_lib/core_lib.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); // This widget is the root of your application. @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: 'Flutter Demo', theme: ThemeData( // This is the theme of your application. // // Try running your application with "flutter run". You'll see the // application has a blue toolbar. Then, without quitting the app, try // changing the primarySwatch below to Colors.green and then invoke // "hot reload" (press "r" in the console where you ran "flutter run", // or simply save your changes to "hot reload" in a Flutter IDE). // Notice that the counter didn't reset back to zero; the application // is not restarted. primarySwatch: Colors.blue, ), home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'), supportedLocales: AppLocalizations.supportedLocales, localizationsDelegates: AppLocalizations.localizationsDelegates, ); } } ``` It has code hints but has build error so how can i use it in such case? and by the way vscode is not work good even i put localization in main project, it always to be not identified, something like https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64574620/target-of-uri-doesnt-exist-packageflutter-gen-gen-l10n-gallery-localizations log from vscode ``` [Error - 1:30:05 PM] Request completionItem/resolve failed. Message: No such element: AppLocalizations in package:core_lib/core_lib.dart Code: -32602 AppLocalizations [Error - 1:30:09 PM] Request completionItem/resolve failed. Message: No such element: AppLocalizations in package:core_lib/core_lib.dart Code: -32602 AppLocalizations [Error - 1:30:12 PM] Request completionItem/resolve failed. Message: No such element: AppLocalizations in package:core_lib/core_lib.dart Code: -32602 AppLocalizations ``` `flutter doctor -v` ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on macOS 12.0.1 21A559 darwin-x64, locale zh-Hans-CN) • Flutter version 2.8.1 at /Users/zmtzawqlp/Documents/flutter/2.8.0 • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 77d935af4d (5 weeks ago), 2021-12-16 08:37:33 -0800 • Engine revision 890a5fca2e • Dart version 2.15.1 • Pub download mirror https://pub.flutter-io.cn • Flutter download mirror https://storage.flutter-io.cn [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3) • Android SDK at /Users/zmtzawqlp/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-31, build-tools 30.0.3 • ANDROID_HOME = /Users/zmtzawqlp/Library/Android/sdk • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6915495) • All Android licenses accepted. [✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 13.2) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • CocoaPods version 1.10.0 [✓] Chrome - develop for the web • Chrome at /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome [✓] Android Studio (version 4.1) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Flutter plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter • Dart plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6915495) [✓] VS Code (version 1.63.2) • VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents • Flutter extension version 3.32.0 [✓] Connected device (3 available) • MI 6 (mobile) • 5a4b233b • android-arm64 • Android 8.0.0 (API 26) • macOS (desktop) • macos • darwin-x64 • macOS 12.0.1 21A559 darwin-x64 • Chrome (web) • chrome • web-javascript • Google Chrome 97.0.4692.71 ``` the demo is attached, please check it. comments:
i found an issue refer to this https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/84979
and i try to change l10n.yaml as following. yes it will not generate files in lib/l10n.
```
arb-dir: l10n
template-arb-file: app_en.arb
output-localization-file: app_localizations.dart
output-dir: lib/l10n
synthetic-package: false
```
wordaround is  run following command: 
flutter gen-l10n --arb-dir l10n --template-arb-file app_en.arb --output-localization-file app_localizations.dart --output-dir lib/l10n --no-synthetic-package

> wordaround is run following command:
> flutter gen-l10n --arb-dir l10n --template-arb-file app_en.arb --output-localization-file app_localizations.dart --output-dir lib/l10n --no-synthetic-package

Does this command help you to export the package properly ?
If so, this case is similar to the one you linked to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/84979

> > wordaround is run following command:
> > flutter gen-l10n --arb-dir l10n --template-arb-file app_en.arb --output-localization-file app_localizations.dart --output-dir lib/l10n --no-synthetic-package
> 
> Does this command help you to export the package properly ? If so, this case is similar to the one you linked to #84979

yes, but it can't create files with flutter packages get

@zmtzawqlp 
Please follow-up in the linked issue for further updates. Closing this as a duplicate and the command mentioned with `--no-synthetic-package` seems to resolve your original question.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Use flutter Native window as transparent overlay window on desktop
body:
Hi，
In desktop application development, it is very common to render content to the window through the main window handle, and create a new transparent window as an overlay to draw the UI.

After looking at the flutter window example, I found that flutter uses SetParent to attach the flutter Native Window to the main window.
That way, can I render the content onto the main window handle and let the flutter Native Window draw the UI as a transparent overlay?
comments:
There are similar issues filed for respective platform

windows: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/71735
Linux: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/66751
MacOs: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/59969

Closing as a duplicate.
> There are similar issues filed for respective platform
> 
> windows: #71735 Linux: #66751 MacOs: #59969
> 
> Closing as a duplicate.

I checked fluent_ Acrylic project. He uses `SetWindowCompositionAttribute` to realize the translucency of windows on windows platform. He can solve it #71735

But with this method, when I render the content to the main window, the translucent window still displays the content behind the main window rather than the content I want to render.

I used to use skia to draw the overlay window UI, Set the SKAlphaType of SKImageInfo to Premul,  and use WinAPI `UpdateLayeredWindow` in the overlay window to make the window translucent.

Translucent windows implemented using `UpdateLayeredWindow` can also be attached to the main window using SetParent.
and It can correctly display the content rendered in the main window.

Flitter also uses skia internally. flitter should be able to do it.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: [MacOS] - Provide error message when accessing String.fromEnvironment as non-const
body:
Recently I added some `--dart-define` values to a Mac OS build. I quickly coded it like this:

```dart
final myValue = String.fromEnvironment("MY_VARIABLE");
```

This resulted in empty values for my various build variables. I was confused why this was happening. There weren't any error messages, just empty values. I decided to build the same project for web and see what happens. When I ran the web version, I got an error complaining about needing to use a const constructor. That's when I realized that apparently I **must** access these environment variables as `const`s:

```dart
const myValue = String.fromEnvironment("MY_VARIABLE");
```

That fixed my issue.

Flutter should provide appropriate error messages on Mac OS and any other platform when these variables are accessed in illegal ways. It's difficult to notice the issue if a developer isn't already aware of it.

Flutter version: Flutter 2.8.0 • channel stable
comments:
Hi @matthew-carroll, I see a similar issue in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/55870. 
Kindly follow up there for more information. 

Closing from here as duplicate. 

If you disagree, kindly leave a comment below and I will reopen. 

Thank you

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Use the flutter starter app
2. Embed any scrollable element there

**Expected results:** 
The application should not lose performance during normal scrolling. And also after the application exits the background, there is a drop in performance for a few seconds.

**Actual results:**
Rendering performance is greatly reduced. When scrolling the fps element, it can sink up to 15 frames, and jerks occur. Considering that this is a completely empty application, without any complex widgets, there should be no such problem at all. In the video, you can see a demonstration of the application on the device.


Note:

In fact, the problem is low performance (low fps) in all my applications, in an empty application and in a working project. This problem is not limited to the scrollable element, it just made it easier to reproduce the problem.
The demo application was created using the command: flutter build ios --release

[Video with a demonstration of the problem](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I_ZvkBcI0cs)

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>


<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'dart:math' as math;

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return ListView.builder(
        itemCount: 100,
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return Container(
            color: Color((math.Random().nextDouble() * 0xFFFFFF).toInt())
                .withOpacity(1.0),
            height: 100,
          );
        });
    
  }
}

```

</details>

title: `W/IInputConnectionWrapper`, `D/InputMethodManager`, and `D/InsetsController` dumped to console on interaction with `TextField` on real Android 12 device
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. `flutter create example`
2. Update `lib/main.dart` to below code sample
3. `flutter run` on physical android device (Pixel 3, running Android 12)
4. Tap on rendered text field and type one letter (`h`, in this example)

**Expected results:** No warning or debug logs dumped to console.

**Actual results:** These types debug, warning, and info logs in console:

D/InputMethodManager
W/IInputConnectionWrapper
D/InsetsController

See below for more details.

<details>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {

@maheshmnj thanks for looking. I've built a simple app with the code above, and launched it on a simulator running ios 14.5 and typing using the hw keyboard doesn't work. No special keys needed. It just never works.

I'm on MacOS Big Sur, and running XCode 12.5.1 with command line tools version 13.2. I can install xcode 13 and give that a try, if you think that will make a difference?

Actually, I still had the "Connect Hardware Keyboard" toggled off from my previous runs. When I built a simple Flutter app and ran it with the toggle on, it works (though I found another bug... The backspace button when held doesn't keep deleting characters - logged here: #96660 96660).

In my case, our app is an "Add To Existing" module, so I've created a simple Add2App example that reproduces the problem. I'm attaching it here.

Steps to build:

1. Update flutter_module/build.sh and put your path to flutter
2. run build.sh like so: `./build.sh`
3. Open the ios project (ios/Add2AppTest.xcodeproj)
4. Build and run

The app will launch with a single button called "Launch Flutter". Tapping that will bring up the flutter view, with a TextField and you can repro the problem there.

I used the 2.8.1 stable release for this test.

Please let me know if you have any issues building the sample project.
Thank you.

[Add2AppTest (2.8.1 broken keyboard).zip](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/7871221/Add2AppTest.2.8.1.broken.keyboard.zip)

Thanks for the code sample @dannyvalentesonos, Is this issue reproducible in a normal flutter app or only in add to app? If the latter this seems like a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92997
@maheshmnj Yes it only happens in add_to_app. That issue is definitely the same. Thanks for pointing it out!
Thanks for the update closing as duplicate of #92997

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: CoreTelephony is not available when building for watchOS Simulator.

## Steps to Reproduce

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
keyboard will come up and the textfield will be edited...

in the case of an empty scaffold, it reloads the app.

in the case of the drawer, the issue only occurs if there is already some text in the appended controller.

title: GitLab CI/cd pipeline failed : Cannot invoke method toInteger() on null object in build.gradle
body:
I am trying to run build android build stage on GitLab CI pipeline, and am getting this error :

``` 
Build file '/builds/wecraft.tn/projects/xenon/front/mobile/android/app/build.gradle' line: 47
40* What went wrong:
41A problem occurred evaluating project ':app'.
42> Cannot invoke method toInteger() on null object

 ```
The error occurred because he couldn't get the mindk version in this line :

``` 
minSdkVersion localProperties.getProperty('flutter.minSdkVersion').toInteger()
         targetSdkVersion localProperties.getProperty('flutter.targetSdkVersion').toInteger()

 ```
The minsdk and targetSdkversion are both declared in localProperties file in new flutter sdk version , the file is declared by default in android's gitignore file . My question
 is how do I fix this error without having to push the file , can I declare the mindsdkversion in the ci/cd script ?

here's my current gitlabci file:

``` 

image: "cirrusci/flutter:2.8.1"
before_script:
  - flutter pub get


stages:
  - test # All jobs related for testing such as Unit Test
  - build
flutter_test: # Name of the lane
  stage: test # type of stage
  script:
    - flutter test # Run Flutter test
flutter_build_android: #Job name
  stage: build # kind of job
  before_script:
    - flutter packages get
    - flutter clean
  script:
    - flutter build apk
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - build/app/outputs/apk/release/app-release.apk
```
If anyone knows the solution please do not hesitate to respond thank you so much.
comments:
Hi @talbiislam96, Thanks for filing the issue.
 It seems like the constants from `local.properties` are not working. Does it work if you hardcode the `minsdkversion`? 
 
Closing as a duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95533, if you disagree feel free to write in the comments and I will reopen it.

Thank you.

@maheshmnj thank you so much for your answer , it doesn't work when I hardcode the minskVersion , I don't think the constants from local.properties aren't working , because when I build the project on my IDE it works just fine but when it's built from the ci it doesn't seem to be finding the file which is normal because I didn't push it , I want to know if there's any other way to create the file or declare the constants in the ci script without having to push the file since it is declared by Default in the android .gitignore file .Thank you so much in advance

@talbiislam96, Thanks for the info what version of flutter are you using locally? Could you please share the complete error logs of your CI script?

> The minsdk and targetSdkversion are both declared in localProperties file in new flutter sdk version , the file is declared by default in android's gitignore file . 

If you are using constants from this file I believe this shouldn't be in gitignore and should be pushed to version control.

> it doesn't work when I hardcode the minskVersion

From your error It looks like the localProperties are not being read, Did you try hardcoding both minimum and target SDK version?

title: should keep path / activity when memory can't keep app open
body:
When the RAM memory is not able to maintain a flutter application, it restarts in its entirety, that is, if it is on route B it returns to route A, while in a native app it stays on route B.

I don't want the path to be saved when I close the app manually, but I want it to be saved when I return to the app and the RAM can't keep the app open.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85927029/149370772-8d608b6d-c387-456d-88d3-07a0894bc2a6.mp4

The code is simple, it is nothing more than a button that opens another route
comments:
> @edsonISA Creo que esto está relacionado con la restauración del estado en el que el estado de la aplicación no se mantiene en situaciones como cuando la aplicación tiene demasiada memoria. Aquí se plantea el mismo problema #84193 . Puede hacer un seguimiento en él para obtener más actualizaciones. Cerrando esto como un duplicado. Si no está de acuerdo, escriba en los comentarios y lo reabriré.

yes, it's a duplicate, that's exactly what I say

title: [Camera] One back camera received instead of 3 with availableCameras() and iPhone 11
body:
An [issue opened by iNima](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/59964) 1.5 years ago describes it all.
The getAvailableCameras only returns 2 cameras in the case of an iPhone 11, which has 3 cameras. One on the back and one on the front.

For me it looks like iNima also found the root of the problem, however, the issue still persists so I'm not sure why it got closed.

The original issue opened is #59964

Sorry for the duplicate, but I think the issue still persists and I believe it was closed by accident.

It would be really nice to use the Telephoto, Wide, and Ultra Wide cameras as well.

Camera version: 0.9.4+5

title: [video_player] Add option to specify the rate of VideoPlayerValue updates
body:
## Use case

Currently the rate of updates for the `VideoPlayerValue` of the `VideoPlayerController` is set to a hardcoded 500ms in `_applyPlayPause()`.

There is no way to get faster updates (i.e. every millisecond).

## Proposal

Add a new configuration option to `VideoPlayerOptions` that is passed to the Timer in `_applyPlayPause()`, which defaults to the current value `const Duration(milliseconds: 500)`.
comments: Hi @navaronbracke, I'm curious, can you share a bit more about your use case that requires that you may need faster updates to the VideoPlayerValue?

I am building a video timeline widget with a line that indicates the current position in the video while it is playing. Currently it jumps every 500ms (because the video player value is the position source). I'd like to make it smoother. I'm not sure if an implicitly animated widget would be a good solution to smoothen out the gaps between updates.
Duplicate of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/90080

To fix this issue you may try reinstalling a stable version of Android studio. You may follow up on the linked issue for further updates, Closing this issue as a duplicate.

title: statusBarIconBrightness is not working on Xiaomi 11
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation

-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

when upgrade flutter from 2.2.0 to 2.8.1,
try to set statusBarIconBrightness: Brightness.dark, it works on HUAWEI，Samsung, iOS and other devices, but it doesn't work on XiaoMi 11. but it looks normal on XiaoMi 11 when flutter version is 2.2.0.

**Expected results:** Status bar icon colors must be a dark color

**Actual results:** Status bar icon colors are still white

<summary>Code sample</summary>

),

title: A KeyUpEvent is dispatched, but the state shows that the physical key is not pressed
body:
This is happening a lot now; from time to time again when am typing something on my MacOs to my app am getting this error:

```
KeyUpEvent is dispatched, but the state shows that the physical key is not pressed. If this occurs in real application, 
please report this bug to Flutter. If this occurs in unit tests, please ensure that simulated events follow 
Flutter's event model as documented in `HardwareKeyboard`. This was the event: KeyUpEvent#0ee09(physicalKey: PhysicalKeyboardKey#7000b(usbHidUsage: "0x0007000b", debugName: "Key H"), logicalKey: LogicalKeyboardKey#00068(keyId: "0x00000068", keyLabel: "H", debugName: "Key H"), character: null, timeStamp: 36:15:59.731822)
```
I was wondering if you can help me with it.

title: Scrollable SelectableText Bug: When selecting text in the bottom, the widget autoscrolls to top.
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. `flutter run` the code from below, on iOS simulator
2. Scroll to the bottom part of the text.
3. Long press on a word to select it

**Expected results:**
Text scroll positions stays the same.

**Actual results:**
The text widget scrolls to the top, so that the selection is not seen anymore. 

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(),
        body: const Center(
          child: SingleChildScrollView(
            padding: EdgeInsets.all(30),
            child: SelectableText(
              loremIpsum,
              style: TextStyle(fontSize: 20)
            ),
          )

    );

title: Crash on termination in iOS on 2.8.0 and greater
body:
Since 2.8.0 (also 2.8.1, 2.9.0), I consistently get a crash report (see below) after terminating an app on iOS (both real device through TestFlight in release mode and simulator). Note that this is the case even with a new default template counter app, a fresh flutter install, and even when building an app in a GitHub workflow (so not on my machine).

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Start an iOS simulator (I used iOS 15.2 on iPhone 13, but had the same problem on a real device on 15.2)
2. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample (default template counter app)
3. Terminate the app (swipe it away).

**Expected results:** 
The app closes and nothing happens.

**Actual results:** 
The app closes and a few seconds later, a crash log appears. On my real iOS device, I instantly get a popup saying that the app crashed, but no report. Hence I added instructions and log for a simulator.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

Simply using the default template works:

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  // This widget is the root of your application.
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        // This is the theme of your application.
        //
        // Try running your application with "flutter run". You'll see the
        // application has a blue toolbar. Then, without quitting the app, try
        // changing the primarySwatch below to Colors.green and then invoke
        // "hot reload" (press "r" in the console where you ran "flutter run",
        // or simply save your changes to "hot reload" in a Flutter IDE).
        // Notice that the counter didn't reset back to zero; the application
        // is not restarted.
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  // This widget is the home page of your application. It is stateful, meaning
  // that it has a State object (defined below) that contains fields that affect
  // how it looks.

  // This class is the configuration for the state. It holds the values (in this
  // case the title) provided by the parent (in this case the App widget) and
  // used by the build method of the State. Fields in a Widget subclass are
  // always marked "final".

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  int _counter = 0;

  void _incrementCounter() {
    setState(() {
      // This call to setState tells the Flutter framework that something has
      // changed in this State, which causes it to rerun the build method below
      // so that the display can reflect the updated values. If we changed
      // _counter without calling setState(), then the build method would not be
      // called again, and so nothing would appear to happen.
      _counter++;
    });
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    // This method is rerun every time setState is called, for instance as done
    // by the _incrementCounter method above.
    //
    // The Flutter framework has been optimized to make rerunning build methods
    // fast, so that you can just rebuild anything that needs updating rather
    // than having to individually change instances of widgets.
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        // Here we take the value from the MyHomePage object that was created by
        // the App.build method, and use it to set our appbar title.
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Center(
        // Center is a layout widget. It takes a single child and positions it
        // in the middle of the parent.
        child: Column(
          // Column is also a layout widget. It takes a list of children and
          // arranges them vertically. By default, it sizes itself to fit its
          // children horizontally, and tries to be as tall as its parent.
          //
          // Invoke "debug painting" (press "p" in the console, choose the
          // "Toggle Debug Paint" action from the Flutter Inspector in Android
          // Studio, or the "Toggle Debug Paint" command in Visual Studio Code)
          // to see the wireframe for each widget.
          //
          // Column has various properties to control how it sizes itself and
          // how it positions its children. Here we use mainAxisAlignment to
          // center the children vertically; the main axis here is the vertical
          // axis because Columns are vertical (the cross axis would be
          // horizontal).
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: <Widget>[
            const Text(
              'You have pushed the button this many times:',
            ),
            Text(
              '$_counter',
              style: Theme.of(context).textTheme.headline4,
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: _incrementCounter,
        tooltip: 'Increment',
        child: const Icon(Icons.add),
      ), // This trailing comma makes auto-formatting nicer for build methods.
    );
  }
}

- On 14.5 iPhone 11 it did

I can reproduce this by enabling VoiceOver and then closing a Flutter app in the app switcher.

I see, indeed it seems I had some accessibility functions turned on without me knowing, and turning them off removes the problem. Strange that the simulators also use semantics for me though.

> 
> I see, indeed it seems I had some accessibility functions turned on without me knowing, and turning them off removes the problem. Strange that the simulators also use semantics for me though.

How???

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Jitter when using the scroll up gesture on iOS
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a performance problem, then fill out the template below.
     Please read our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Details

<!--
1.  Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into.

2.  Please attach a small application (ideally just one main.dart file) that
     reproduces the problem. You could use https://gist.github.com/ for this.

3.  Switch flutter to master channel and run this app on a physical device
     using profile mode with Skia tracing enabled, as follows:
       flutter channel master
       flutter run --profile --trace-skia

     The bleeding edge master channel is encouraged here because Flutter is
     constantly fixing bugs and improving its performance. Your problem in an
     older Flutter version may have already been solved in the master channel.

4.  Record a video of the performance issue using another phone so we
     can have an intuitive understanding of what happened. Don’t use
     "adb screenrecord", as that affects the performance of the profile run.

5.  Open Observatory and save a timeline trace of the performance issue
     so we know which functions might be causing it. See "How to Collect
     and Read Timeline Traces" on this blog post:
       https://medium.com/flutter/profiling-flutter-applications-using-the-timeline-a1a434964af3#a499
     Make sure the performance overlay is turned OFF when recording the
     trace as that may affect the performance of the profile run.
     (Pressing ‘P’ on the command line toggles the overlay.)
-->

<!--
     Please tell us which target platform(s) the problem occurs (Android / iOS / Web / macOS / Linux / Windows)
     Which target OS version, for Web, browser, is the test system running?
     Does the problem occur on emulator/simulator as well as on physical devices?
-->

**Target Platform:** Apple/iOS
**Target OS version/browser:** iOS 15.
**Devices:** iPhone X

## Video showing the problem

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41989385/148679602-0197b857-d470-42f0-ae5e-4f4d112dfff7.mp4

## Reproduce the problem

<details>
<summary>Code of "main.dart"</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/cupertino.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(),
      body: const SafeArea(
        child: Padding(
          padding: EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 16),
          child: CustomScrollView(
            slivers: [
              SliverToBoxAdapter(child: SizedBox(height: 16)),
              SliverToBoxAdapter(
                child: CupertinoSearchTextField(),
              ),
              SliverToBoxAdapter(child: SizedBox(height: 16)),
              TitleSliver(title: "Frequent"),
              FrequentSliverList(),
              SliverToBoxAdapter(child: SizedBox(height: 16)),
              TitleSliver(title: "Groups"),
              GroupSliverList(),
              SliverToBoxAdapter(child: SizedBox(height: 16)),
              TitleSliver(title: "All"),
              AllSliverList(),
              SliverToBoxAdapter(child: SizedBox(height: 16)),
            ],
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

class TitleSliver extends StatelessWidget {
  final String title;

  const TitleSliver({
    Key? key,
    required this.title,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return SliverToBoxAdapter(
      child: Text(
        title,
        style: const TextStyle(
          fontSize: 20,
          fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

class MyListTile extends StatelessWidget {
  final String titleSuffix;

  const MyListTile({
    Key? key,
    required this.titleSuffix,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return ListTile(
      title: Text(
        "Some dude on the internet: $titleSuffix",
      ),
    );
  }
}

class FrequentSliverList extends StatelessWidget {
  const FrequentSliverList({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return SliverList(
      delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
        (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return MyListTile(
            titleSuffix: "$index",
          );
        },
        childCount: 2,
      ),
    );
  }
}

class GroupSliverList extends StatelessWidget {
  const GroupSliverList({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return SliverList(
      delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
        (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return MyListTile(
            titleSuffix: "$index",
          );
        },
        childCount: 3,
      ),
    );
  }
}

class AllSliverList extends StatelessWidget {
  const AllSliverList({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return SliverList(
      delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
        (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return MyListTile(
            titleSuffix: "$index",
          );
        },
        childCount: 999999,
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
</details>

## Logs

<details>
<summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
     Run `flutter analyze` and attach any output of that command below.
     If there are any analysis errors, try resolving them before filing this issue.
-->

```
Analyzing my_project...                                              
No issues found! (ran in 2.6s)
```

<!-- Finally, paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here, with your device plugged in. -->

```
[✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on macOS 11.4 20F71 darwin-x64, locale en-SA)
    • Flutter version 2.8.1 at /Users/yazeedalkhalaf/dev/flutter
    • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
    • Framework revision 77d935af4d (3 weeks ago), 2021-12-16 08:37:33 -0800

title: [tool_crash] FileSystemException: Cannot open file, OS Error: No such file or directory, errno = 2
body:
## Command
```
flutter --no-color pub get
```

## Steps to Reproduce
when I try to run flutter pub get with the image_cropper package and some other packages I get the following error message:

Oops; flutter has exited unexpectedly: "FileSystemException: Cannot open file, path = '/Users/usr/flutter/packages/flutter_tools/templates/cocoapods/Podfile-ios-swift' (OS Error: No such file or directory, errno = 2)".

I only run into this issue on my Mac m1. I looked into the specific path and there is no folder cocoapods, why is this and how do I install this folder and the needed file?

body: ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Visit https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/flutter#4 2. Search `Wrap the TextField inside a Flexible`. 3. In the first step, the `Select Row` should be replaced with `Select TextField`

title: Google Sign In Web plugin to support Signing in without a pop up window.

@ted-marozzi

title: TextField onEditingComplete Bug on Mobile Web
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Add a TextField widget to a Flutter app with an onEditingComplete function
2. Build the app for web
3. Run the app on a mobile browser (I have tested Chrome on a Pixel 6 Pro)
    (NOTE: This problem only occurs in mobile browsers)
4. Try entering text into the TextField and tapping the appropriate "I'm done editing" key

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I expect the onEditingComplete function to be called whenever I tap
the "I'm done with editing" key.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
The onEditingComplete function is only called if the entered text string
contains one or more non-leading spaces or consists only of spaces.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'TextField onEditingComplete Bug',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'TextField onEditingComplete Bug'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  TextEditingController controller = TextEditingController();
  String descriptionOfProblem = 'On a mobile browser, the TextField '
    'onEditingComplete function will not be called if the entered '
    'text string trimmed left does not contain any spaces. However, '
    'a text string consisting solely of spaces will still call '
    'the onEditingComplete function.';
  String typedText =
      "What you type will appear here on <Enter> only if it has a space somewhere";

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Padding(
        padding: const EdgeInsets.all(40.0),
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: <Widget>[
            Text(descriptionOfProblem),
            const Text(''),
            Text(typedText),
            const Text(''),
            TextField(
              autofocus: true,
              controller: controller,
              decoration: const InputDecoration(
                border: OutlineInputBorder(),
                hintText: 'What you type here will sometimes appear above',
              ),
              onEditingComplete: () {
                setState(() {
                  typedText = controller.text;
                });
                controller.clear();
              },
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

comments:
The code sample is also available at:

- https://dartpad.dev/e345f7f3d6b9232708385cbb0f068d4b
- https://gist.github.com/RedQuark/e345f7f3d6b9232708385cbb0f068d4b

The code sample is also running at: https://www.redquark.com/flutterBug/

Video: https://youtu.be/Mr7hNV6mePs

Oddly, while creating the video today I encountered a slightly different behavior. This time, in order to get the expected result, my text had to have a trailing space or spaces, or consist entirely of spaces. Yesterday, a space in the middle of the string would work too, but not today. You can see this in the video.

@RedQuark 
Thanks for the detailed report. Although I am able to replicate this issue, but it only occured on Android mobile browser and not on iOS mobile browser( checked on safari) which leads me to this similar issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/89384. Can you check if that is similar to your case and behavior ?

@darshankawar
Very similar to my case and behavior. For [#89384](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/89384), if you try to enter a text string without a trailing space (on Android mobile web browser), you cannot trigger either of the onEditingComplete or onSubmitted actions. I guess the one tidbit I can (and did) add to that issue is that if the text string does have a trailing space (or consists of only spaces), then the actions do fire. I don't know how useful the knowledge that this issue occurs with onEditingComplete (by itself) might be, but I am closing this issue as a duplicate of [#89384](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/89384).
I can also confirm that this is only a problem for the Android web browser. I ran the same code on an iOS device with no issues.

This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you are still experiencing a similar issue, please open a new bug, including the output of `flutter doctor -v` and a minimal reproduction of the issue.

title: Unhandled Exception: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. simple GET request from anywhere in your app.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I would like to receive a JSON response with data.
Just Like using PostMan,
i configure the pem,ca and key and send GET request to receive my data.
**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->


`Unhandled Exception: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = https://mycontoller.app.io/api/data
`
<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
Future<void> getData() async {
  var url = "https://mycontoller.app.io/api/data";
  SecurityContext context = new SecurityContext();
  context.setTrustedCertificates("/Users/myuser/Library/Containers/com.example.testmap/Data/Documents/cafile");
  var client = new HttpClient(context: context);
  context.usePrivateKey("/Users/myuser/Library/Containers/com.example.testmap/Data/Documents/keyfile");
  var request = await client.getUrl(Uri.parse(url));
  var response = await request.close();
  print(response.statusCode);

```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

[ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(209)] Unhandled Exception: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = https://mycontoller.app.io/api/data

```

title: [Web] Text content is overlapped by the numbers for arabic language
body:
![Screenshot from 2022-01-07 11-33-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42038853/148567415-4c4a54b9-3d0b-4bf2-bad5-65ace1f7ed6c.png)
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute flutter run on the code sample in Chrome
2. Open Developer Tools (Ctrl + shift + i) 
3. Click on Toggle Device Toolbar button to see the application as Web App
4. Reload the page
5. Look at the centered Text Widget with Arabic text

**Expected results:** The text content should not be overlapped by the number when letter spacing propertie is set to 1.0

**Actual results:** The text content is overlapped by the number

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Test',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Test'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: const Padding(
        padding: EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 20),
        child: Center(
          child: Text(
            '2. يمكننا تقسيم علامات الترقيم إلى خمس فئات على النحو التالي:1. نهايات الجملة: نقطة ، علامة استفهام ، علامة تعجب',
            textDirection: TextDirection.rtl,
            textAlign: TextAlign.start,
            style: TextStyle(
              height: 1.5,
              letterSpacing: 1.0,
              textBaseline: TextBaseline.ideographic,
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

title: [webview_flutter] Unable to upload files
body:
We're using an integration to Liveagent for tickets, chatservice etc. We've made an flutter app for our customers with a webview to the chatservice so they can get in contact with us easily. 

Running the link we open in the webview in the web, eg chrome, it works as intended, can upload files etc. but running it in the webview we're able to type to eachother but whenever we try to upload files through the upload form nothing happens apart from endless loading.

We've tried adding all sorts of rights for both android and ios without success. I suspect this will be the same issue trying to upload to any other html form as well using the plugin.

Using the latest downloadable stable version of flutter, dart and webview flutter.
comments:

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->
I am getting an error in FlutterViewEngine of the sample code after the flutter upgrade. As mentioned in the error, the activityControlSurface . attachToActivity ( activity, lifecycle) has changed to  activityControlSurface . attachToActivity ( ExclusiveAppComponentActivity<Activity!>,lifecycle). 

Error:
Type mismatch: inferred type is ComponentActivity but ExclusiveAppComponent<Activity!> was expected

This is the use case.
    
    private fun hookActivityAndView() {
        // Assert state.
        activity!!.let { activity ->
            flutterView!!.let { flutterView ->
                platformPlugin = PlatformPlugin(activity, engine.platformChannel)

                engine.activityControlSurface.attachToActivity(activity, activity.lifecycle)
                flutterView.attachToFlutterEngine(engine)
                activity.lifecycle.addObserver(this)
            }
        }
    }

How to solve this?

      Consider also attaching screenshots and/or videos to better
      illustrate the issue.

      You can upload them directly on GitHub.
      Beware that video file size is limited to 10MB.
-->

title: [google_sign_in] iOS PlatformException (PlatformException(missing-config, GoogleService-Info.plist file not found, null, null)) after CLI initialization migration
body:
I have FirebaseAuth set up in my app with Google Sign In amongst other social login options enabled. I had no problems with siging in and managing users/sessions until I followed the steps in the official flutter firebase docs for migrating to the flutterfire CLI initialization and removing old files such as the `GoogleService-Info.plist` file in the iOS project. The issue I'm facing is only for iOS simulators, not for android.

## Steps to Reproduce

The steps to reproduce this would be to:

1. Follow flutterfire docs instructions on migrating to CLI dart initialization : https://firebase.flutter.dev/docs/overview#initializing-flutterfire
2. Call on the GoogleSignIn().signIn() method

**Expected results:**
I expect to be able to sign in with Google using this package without having the GoogleService-Info.plist in my project, since the firebase docs say it is not longer needed and is backwards compatible.

**Actual results:** 
My function no longer works as it used to, and hits an exception:

```
flutter: error signing in with google: PlatformException(missing-config, GoogleService-Info.plist file not found, null, null)
stack:
#0      StandardMethodCodec.decodeEnvelope
#1      MethodChannel._invokeMethod
<asynchronous suspension>
#2      GoogleSignIn._callMethod
<asynchronous suspension>
#3      GoogleSignIn.signIn.isCanceled (package:google_sign_in/google_sign_in.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
```
I think this might possibly be because something is not updated with the google_sign_in package to account for the new dart initialization with the flutterfire CLI, such as its looking in the wrong place or for the wrong file now that I'm pulling from the `firebase_options.dart` file and do not have a `GoogleService-Info.plist` file that was manually added to Xcode anymore. I'm pretty stumped because I followed all the migration directions, which say the file is no longer necessary, and I did not get any errors from the flutterfire CLI when I configured my project and added my firebase_options.dart file. I feel like using google_sign_in with firebase_auth is one of the most basic things users of either this package or the firebase suite of packages will want to do, so I don't know if there's just something else I completely missed to make these not work together maybe?
<details>

<summary>Code sample</summary>

A sample of the function that is the source of the PlatformException is:

```dart
  Future<UserCredential> signInWithGoogle() async {
    try {
      // Trigger the authentication flow
      final GoogleSignInAccount googleUser = await GoogleSignIn().signIn();

      // Obtain the auth details from the request
      final GoogleSignInAuthentication googleAuth =
          await googleUser.authentication;

      // Create a new credential
      final oAuthCredential = GoogleAuthProvider.credential(
        accessToken: googleAuth.accessToken,
        idToken: googleAuth.idToken,
      );

      UserCredential userCred;
      // try to link Google credential to current anonymous user
      // if google cred is already linked to another acct, sign in to that acct
      try {
        userCred = await _user.linkWithCredential(oAuthCredential);
      } on FirebaseAuthException catch (e) {
        print(
            'Error linking Google cred to anonymous credential: ${e.message}');
        print('Error code: ${e.code}');
        if (e.code == 'credential-already-in-use') {
          final String userId = _user.uid;
          final FirebaseFunctions cloudFunctions = FirebaseFunctions.instance;
          final HttpsCallable callable =
              cloudFunctions.httpsCallable('deleteAnonymousUser');

          // UserCredential that will be returned at end of function
          userCred =
              await FirebaseAuth.instance.signInWithCredential(oAuthCredential);

          callable.call<String>(userId).catchError((error) {
            print('Error calling `deleteAnonymousUser` from Google sign in.');
            print('Error:$error');
          });
          return userCred;
        }
      } catch (e, s) {
        print('Error signing in returning user:\n$e\n$s');
      }
      return userCred;
    } catch (error, stack) {
      print('error signing in with google: $error\nstack:\n$stack');
      return null;
    }
  }
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

Can you provider your `pubspec.yaml`?
And isn't it only worked for `firebase_auth` or whole firebase libraries?

@tr-stan 
`google_sign_in` plugin currently doesn't support dart-only initialization and for mean time, you'll need to fallback on manual installation.
See this merged PR in flutterfire repo to indicate the same: https://github.com/FirebaseExtended/flutterfire/pull/7745
Original flutterfire issue which reported this: https://github.com/FirebaseExtended/flutterfire/issues/7753
Closing this from here, as above should answer your question.
Hi @darshankawar thank you for the clarification! I saw in one of the linked issues that documentation clarifications are already in the works. 😄

title: Flutter web DropdownButton hover stays at current version
body:

https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/material/DropdownButton-class.html

title: ScaffoldMessenger.showMaterialBanner gives an overflow error when navigating to a second page
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample below.
2. Click on the 'Show banner' button in the app.
3. Click on the 'Go to second page' button in the app.

**Expected results:**

The Material Banner should persist to the next page without any problems.

**Actual results:**

An overflow error occurs:

```
════════ Exception caught by rendering library ═════════════════════════════════
The following assertion was thrown during layout:
A RenderFlex overflowed by 24 pixels on the bottom.

The relevant error-causing widget was
MaterialApp
lib/main.dart:12
You can inspect this widget using the 'Inspect Widget' button in the VS Code notification.
The overflowing RenderFlex has an orientation of Axis.vertical.
The edge of the RenderFlex that is overflowing has been marked in the rendering with a yellow and black striped pattern. This is usually caused by the contents being too big for the RenderFlex.

Consider applying a flex factor (e.g. using an Expanded widget) to force the children of the RenderFlex to fit within the available space instead of being sized to their natural size.
This is considered an error condition because it indicates that there is content that cannot be seen. If the content is legitimately bigger than the available space, consider clipping it with a ClipRect widget before putting it in the flex, or using a scrollable container rather than a Flex, like a ListView.

The specific RenderFlex in question is: RenderFlex#d1013 relayoutBoundary=up7 OVERFLOWING
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>



```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const App());
}

class App extends StatelessWidget {
  const App({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      home: HomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class HomePage extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomePage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          title: const Text('Home Page'),
        ),
        body: SafeArea(
          child: SingleChildScrollView(
            child: Center(
              child: Column(
                children: [
                  ElevatedButton(
                    onPressed: () {
                      ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showMaterialBanner(
                        MaterialBanner(
                          content: const Text('I am a Material Banner'),
                          actions: [
                            IconButton(
                              onPressed: () {
                                ScaffoldMessenger.of(context)
                                    .clearMaterialBanners();
                              },
                              icon: const Icon(Icons.keyboard_arrow_up),
                            ),
                          ],
                        ),
                      );
                    },
                    child: const Text('Show banner'),
                  ),
                  ElevatedButton(
                    onPressed: () {
                      Navigator.of(context).push(
                        MaterialPageRoute(
                          builder: (context) => const SecondPage(),
                        ),
                      );
                    },
                    child: const Text('Go to second page'),
                  ),
                ],
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ));
  }
}

class SecondPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const SecondPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: const Text('Second Page'),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>

  <summary>Flutter doctor</summary>

```

title: MaterialBanner appears above SliverAppBar
body:
Hello, I was trying to use `MaterialBanner` with `SliverAppBar` and discovered 2 issues: 1. MaterialBanner is not displaying underneath the SliverAppBar 2. SliverAppBar gets massive top padding (it doesn't have massive padding in DartPad, only on iOS and Android) [DartPad](https://dartpad.dev/?id=2fb141d5bbca63d177cecf45543c4419) [Gist](https://gist.github.com/ezraaaa/2fb141d5bbca63d177cecf45543c4419) ## Steps I tried to remove padding 1. Add `AppBar` to `Scaffold` 2. Add `PreferredSize` to `AppBar` and set height to 0 ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a Flutter project 2. Copy and paste this [gist](https://gist.github.com/ezraaaa/2fb141d5bbca63d177cecf45543c4419) to your `main.dart` 3. `flutter run` 4. Press "Show Banner" button **Expected results:** MaterialBanner appearing below SliverAppBar like [this](https://kstatic.googleusercontent.com/files/f5ca1d47c305c6aa0b25e61ba9c455144c74e0eaab40c99cfbc9921984ee1aca7b4e51047b690fa21d81aead363c7e8b6743a43fa6c8c6d8c60cc5ea7aebe630) and without massive paddings. **Actual results:**
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return const MaterialApp( home: Scaffold( body: CustomScrollView( slivers: [ SliverAppBar( snap: true, floating: true, title: Text('SliverAppBar'), ), SliverToBoxAdapter( child: MyWidget(), ), ], ), ), ); } } class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget { const MyWidget({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return Column( children: [ Text( 'Hello, World!', style: Theme.of(context).textTheme.headline4, ), ElevatedButton( onPressed: () { ScaffoldMessenger.of(context) ..hideCurrentMaterialBanner() ..showMaterialBanner(MaterialBanner( content: const Text('I am a banner'), actions: [ TextButton( onPressed: () { ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).hideCurrentMaterialBanner(); }, child: const Text('Dismiss'), ) ], )); }, child: const Text('Show Banner'), ), ], ); } } ```
Logs ``` Analyzing testing... No issues found! (ran in 2.1s) ``` ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel master, 2.9.0-1.0.pre.256, on macOS 12.0.1 21A559 darwin-x64, locale en-GB) • Flutter version 2.9.0-1.0.pre.256 at /Users/ezragunn/Development/SDKs/flutter • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 45726a8458 (8 hours ago), 2022-01-05 20:00:17 -0500 • Engine revision 36eafae59d • Dart version 2.16.0 (build 2.16.0-144.0.dev) • DevTools version 2.9.2 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 31.0.0) • Android SDK at /Users/ezragunn/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-31, build-tools 31.0.0 • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) • All Android licenses accepted. title: PopupMenuButton icon splash radius is too large
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
No way to modify the splash radius for PopupMenuButton and it is vey large by default. 
<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
add splash radius property
<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->
comments: Hi, @maheshmnj , don't you think splashradius should also be passed as parameter to inkwell?? As  passing gild will not be having property to change splash radius.

title: Marker does not rotate on the web
body: I wrote an app using the google_maps_flutter_platform_interface library. A custom marker properly rotates according to the rotation setting on Android, but not on the web, where the rotation is always 0 (north).
comments:
@Henk-Keijzer 
Can you provide `flutter doctor -v`, plugin version and a [complete minimal reproducible code sample](https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example) that shows the behavior you are seeing ?

Hi Darshankawar, I added the following simple routine to my code and this has the same result on the website (flutter build web). I did not test it on the connected Chrome or Edge device, because it would otherwise use cross-domain connections (which is not allowed).

  Future<void> buildShip(ship) async {
    shipMarkerList.addAll({MarkerId(ship) : Marker(
      markerId: MarkerId(ship),
      anchor: Offset(0.5, 0.5),
      position: LatLng(52.2, 4.5),
      rotation: 90.0,
      flat: true,
    )});
  }

My guess is that it has to do with the fact that rotation in flutter is a double and in the Android Google SDK an integer.

This is the result of flutter doctor -v:

[√] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.8.1, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.22000.376], locale nl-NL)

Thanks

There are more problems. I use the following to move the marker(s) to another position:

      shipMarkerList.addAll({MarkerId(track['name']) : Marker(
      markerId: MarkerId(track['name']),
      anchor: Offset(0.5, 0.5),
      icon: await shipMarkerIcon (shipMarkerColorTable[int.parse(track['colorcode'])], markerBackGroundColor),
      position: LatLng(calculatedLat, calculatedLon),
      rotation: calculatedRotation,
      flat: true,
      )});

The addALL replaces the marker with MarkerId in the list, or adds a new one of the marker is does not exist yet.
This works perfectly on Android, but on web, the markers do not move....

@Henk-Keijzer 
I think you are hitting same issue as reported here: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/80578
Please follow-up in it for further updates.
Closing this as a duplicate. If you disagree, write in comments and I'll reopen it.
